fS1CwKKmnt9k_FRarMgzdA.text: I'm actually surprised to see this restaurant has less than 5 stars. I have been in Vegas for about a week now for a convention and out of all the restaurants, this place by far had the best service. I came with 3 people and we did a tapas style dinner. We ordered a bunch of appetizers: calamari, meatballs, and mozzarella, which were all delicious! Our favorite was the calamari, which is perfect for anyone who loves spice. I was also really impressed by our server who came by and split the appetizers evenly for us. It was the right balance of quality and service.

PtT_5G-GIh8g9LHK3tD2ug.text: My wife and I ate here on a Wednesday evening. We made reservations for 5:00 PM and were seated immediately. Even if we did not have reservations getting  a seat wouldn't have been an issue as there were plenty of empty tables. 5:00 PM dinner is kinda early for Las Vegas, so an empty restaurant was not a worry to us. I don't remember the music being overly loud when we were there so I can't comment more on it. We had normal menus and then our server gave us an iPad with all the menus on it. We selected a couple drinks on the iPad and then our server wrote down what we had selected and then took our order. It seemed a little redundant. Give us a regular menu and a drink menu and call it good. They brought us 4 slices of bread and some olive oil, chili oil, and cheese. After finishing the 4 slices they brought us more. Our drinks arrived very quickly as well. I had the Linguine in White Clam Sauce and I thought it was good. I don't ever eat fresh clams so I cannot comment on if they were cleaned properly, I can say I don't remember eating any sand. The dish overall was good, but did have a LOT of sauce. The bread we had left was a good way to savor every last drop. My wife had the Spaghetti D.O.P. and it was amazing. I can say I probably enjoyed it more than I did my own meal. I would say it was probably the best spaghetti dish I have ever had.

xy7_-k3KQO7Ap0G-Kds4IA.text: I dined with my brothers and sisters and got charged twice for the same meal !  Don't trust these people and review your bill very carefully.  The prices are high and the atmosphere way too loud to talk to your table mates.  The salad was dripping in its dressing and the food way over spiced.

mOlVC48CamzuFCZvbsFIUA.text: Had a horrible experience, first of all our bartender at the bar was ver rude and helped other people at the bar before us. Had he been Sincere and helped us during the course of our drinks. The experience would have been better had he only given me a water, really ruined the experience at this place. I'd be happy if they went out of business because of this horrible experience. Took an hour to even be able to get an appetizer.

beTRGxLn1tQb2Sj6C2lbpg.text: The only way this dining experience could have been worse if if the food totally sucked. It wasn't great, and the service was horrible. We ordered drinks and waited over 10 minutes to receive them. We ordered another round and waited even longer. When our meal was served, the entrees came out at different times and my 'salad and meatball' appetizer came out several minutes after everyone else causing their entrees to be cold by the time we ate. After speaking to the manager, twice, he told us that they serve the food as it comes out and that was the way it came out...not my problem! And the restaurant wasn't even 25% occupied. The food wasn't great, just passable, so all in all, won't be going back there again...ever!

HAEXF-T4uW0JJtDJD766Gw.text: This restaurant was a  big disappointment, it looks very nice from the outside but the menu, service and food were really very poor.  I ordered the chicken marsala which I have eaten at many restaurants and it didn't come with pasta, mashed potatoes or vegetables, just over salted pieces of chicken.  My girlfriends pasta wasn't any better and the prices for two salads and two meals and one glass of wine was $137.00.  We should have gone to Maggiano's just down the street we would have had a great meal for about $40.00.

Gh1kYQ3Qoal4lNSeN-qktA.text: Here is the bottom line, if you like your pasta cooked Al Dente, then you will probably like the food. But if you don't like pasta cooked Al Dente, then your out of luck, because they will not cook it any other way. I am not fond of Al Dente, or not being able to have my food cooked the way I want it, so 3 stars is the best I can rate this restaurant. I had the rigatoni in Sunday Gravy (sauce) with pork, and the gravy is very good. I also ordered a side of meatballs (which they give you one large meatball for $12). It was OK, but I have had a lot better and it was certainly not worth the money. The bread served with the meal is authentic delicious Italian bread, served with sides of oil, hot pepper sauce, and grated cheese (although I wish they also included butter as a choice as well). The decor is very sleek and ultra modern, and although it hardly fits the theme of an Italian resturuant, it is a nice looking place. The prices are high for an italian resturuant, but when you take into consideration your eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant, right on the strip, the prices are fairly reasonable. There are certainly many better Italian restaurants in Vegas, but if your staying at the Paris, and don't feel like leaving the hotel, you can get a decent meal here (as long as you like Al Dente pasta!).

KlRqm42JhZNmO1VTUlkmYA.text: First off, the service was good and the appetizers were decent.  We had the mozzarella (good) and the rice balls.  Before I continue I just want to share my qualifications for even giving a review - I can cook a wide array of foods; from Peking duck, to rib roast with bearnaise, to what has been said is lasagna as good as anything that can be found in northern Italy (with homemade sauce).   My wife had penne ala vodka, and while the flavor was good, the plated portion was at most worth $18-20, even by Las Vegas Strip standards, not the $28 they were asking for.  I had the Veal ala Martorano.  The "sauce" was basically some stewed tomatoes, chunks of garlic and chunks of Chile peppers (Serrano's), some salt and pepper over fried veal.   Now for those of you who enjoy heat for the sake of heat then you might very well enjoy the "sauce".  However, I find that spices-heat should not appear out of nowhere like a left jab to the face, depending on which fork full of food you happen to take a bite of.  They should be infused in the dish and add to the flavor, not fight with the other flavors.  That was not the case with this dish.  If you think you might like the dish then I would suggest trying it this way -go buy a Serrano chile and get a slice of pizza.  Then take a bite of each at the same time.  This will save you the $32 cost of trying the "veal ala martorano" to see if you like it, although it may be an insult to your favorite pizza.

KNjhCTNbTrck4tImcNa6wg.text: Excellent staff and service. The food was outstanding and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The eggplant Parmesan was large enough to share so you get your money's worth. A Notable wine list was also a nice compliment. This place is worth a try. Not to mention, for a more upscale place they were not pretentious and also were reasonably priced.

jyj2LU5mL8RgpbueaozkvA.text: We dined at the Paris Hotel location.  I just don't get it.  The food is average at best.   The waiter and the manager were both obnoxious.  It seems to me they are all just Gordon Ramsay wannabes.  "Yo cuz".  Really?  How stupid.  Go somewhere else.

ENUawrg45sYV3ar7OtrQJA.text: Unfamiliar with Martorano, I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant.  Overall, the look has a very modern/trendy feel to it, though admittedly a little confusing with the random mob/action movies playing on all the TV's periodically turning up over the sound system for certain scenes, only to fade back into the dj's mix.  Food wise---I enjoyed the meatball over fried mozzarella. The meatball was sizable, tender, delicious and of course fried mozzarella---what more need be said.  My entree was the lasagna which is better than average, but not necessarily anything to get too excited about.  What I did quite enjoy, however, was the wife's risotto with shrimp and scallops.  Quite possibly one of the best things I've ever tasted.  The risotto was so buttery and rich with each bite--completely flavorful, and the seafood cooked perfectly.  If I were to go back, I would certainly order that.  The price point was a little high, but as expected for this sort of restaurant on the strip in Vegas and certainly not outrageous.  Waiters were attentive and food brought promptly.  Overall good experience.

98xNITYh-qd1jYRYeGAqAA.text: The employees and manager there were complete snobs. Had a drink and left, super unpleasant experience.

h9GN13Q9WQib7XQqsA4gbg.text: First time and it was very presentable. Had reservations in advance. Waited about 15 minutes because we were early. The menu is right in front and you can scroll through it to see what goodies you would like to eat. When you get seated they have an electronic presentation the waiter does with wine etc... They bring out the fresh baked house bread and several dips for it. We had the big Meatball, which was excellent. Ordered Linguine & the fried Lobster tail. The risotto was the best so far I have eaten. The experience was the BEST! I will be back for more of that. Dessert & everything was the ALL Delicious!! The flat screen tvs were all over, no sound. I heard there is a DJ on the weekend and the floor turns in to dancing which was not the night we were there. It was a good experience. Lots of food that it is ridiculous. But we ordered a lot of food!! I wish they had sample platters for sale!! Guess I will have to eat here again to try the other dishes. Very upscale in price so please see the menu. Ambiance, presentation, food display, employees on top of their game were all Excellent!!

yj91zA3i9sfnXsV03omvHA.text: Now aside from homemade spaghetti and meat balls at home and a pizza from our favorite pizza parlor,  I'm not much for Italian cuisine. That being said, while staying at the hotel my wife and I decided to give Martorano's a try as an alternative to our usual steak house, seafood, and buffet dining. We had a bad experience, first they gave us probably the worst table in the house, right at the restaurant entrance so parties waiting for their table were standing right over our table. Ok we didn't let that bother us to much. Now the food. My wife ordered the Linguine in white clam sauce, what she got was Linguine soaking in olive oil that taste a little rancid. Neither of us could eat the Linguine but she did eat the clams they were ok..  I ordered the Rigatoni with Sunday gravy recommended by the server. A big chunk of roast pork that was fairly tasty but there was not enough gravy to satisfy my taste so I asked for a little more gravy, the server said he could do that for a  5 dollar cup of gravy as a side dish. ( WHAT ) I did not pay the 5 dollars simply out of principal. I could not finish my plate.   I'm not someone that makes a big deal about bad food or service ( service was ok ) in a restaurant because it makes for an uncomfortable situation for all. I just do not return.(  later that night I picked up a couple slices of pizza at JJ Boulangerie )

8-B3IuqV8R_u8KfsSOtKnQ.text: This place was a joke!  We should have known the attitude we would get when the menu states "No substitutions", "Don't break my balls".  We went anyway because we were staying at the Paris hotel and needed an early meal before the show.  The atmosphere was very pretentious and awkward.  Almost every server that poured water or wine was a nervous wreck and shook like leaves.  We asked for butter with our bread and they brought one pat on a little dish for 4 people!  The wine was very overpriced ($19 for 4 oz.).  The meal was mediocre, especially for the price.  I'm used to high prices for fine meals, but this one really was a disappointment.  I've been to Italy many times and no place treated us like this one did.  My sister asked for salt when they brought her meal and the waiter insisted that she taste it first and stood there while she did it (she still wanted salt!)!!  They made you feel like they were so superior in their knowledge.  I would never recommend anyone go there!!

ojsgz9ZB23fjli_foNFDjg.text: If you want to spend $161.00 for food that tastes like Olive Garden then eat here.  Be careful with the waiters daily special. My Chilean Seabass was $62.00, now I think he should of mentioned that when I was looking at ordering the veal for $28.00.  I'm a foodie and I don't mind spending the money on good food but this is nothing special at all.  You pay for the ambience and food presentation.   I learned my lesson - always ask the price of their daily special.

xuoINJkLgo1T91XOM11HMg.text: My husband and I love this place!!!! The amazing food and awesome bartenders and staff you can't go wrong with stopping in here!!!! We always try different dishes and everything is amazing!!! As Vegas locals we frequent here because everyone here is so friendly and helpful!!!

m5AFoT4FIOoY8YJPgBeC2Q.text: Very unpleasant experience, music is so loud it's impossible to carry on a conversation, even to the point that the table vibrated!  Movies on big screen tv makes no sense.  Looked forward to a nice Italian meal, booming music ruined it.  Food was ok but overpriced.

Ox5dZKNfwouKA8u6-rC6hQ.text: Great food and awesome service. Water glass always full, waitress came back many times to check on us. Place was pretty busy.  Set us right away with our reservation. Chicken Scilian was very good and pasta was very tender.

pmPSDYcSOgPiTvWeXKQK4A.text: This place is awful. I suggest visiting this restaurant only if you enjoy getting an instant heartburn from house salad dressing that consists out of straight up vinegar, consuming overcooked chicken in Marsala sauce that's saltier than the Pacific Ocean, or washing it all down with a glass of Pinot that must've come out of a cardboard box for $5/gallon. To top off your experience, you will wait 1.5 hours for your course to make its way to your table and your dessert will be unavailable at the end of your meal. We came in with a party of 8 people and not one of us had a single positive thing to say about this place. Maybe this restaurant should try to focus on food rather than pretending to be high-end with poorly written iPad apps that aim to replace the drink menu.

lsBf2U5dNNRCJdLHUb_MmA.text: Im giving this restaurant 2 stars only for the food....  the loud atmosphere and the I could care less attitude from the waiter Paul because the owner wants it that way doesn't work for me.   If a customer requests COOKED  pasta and  NOT al dente pasta.... it should be cooked as requested.... it's the same as when someone requests a steak to be cooked  certain way it gets done.... pasta should be no different.    I as a paying customer don't care how the owner thinks it should be cooked.    As a local to Vegas I have to say I will be thinking twice before returning to this restaurant in the future.   Also sound is too loud.... TVs were way too loud.... We couldn't even hear the specials, neither could the waiter hear our order. Again was told the owner likes it that way.    I don't think as a family we should be shouting across the table so we can hear each other.

IucIfFeKKiZ7n286jSPamQ.text: This place is preeeetttyyyy tasty. I was craving Italian food (meatballs specifically) and man am I happy I walked in this place.   I saw at the bar, and was immediately helped. The service here was pretty awesome. I started with the meatball appetizer, and it was soooo good. That is a meal in itself with the bread they give you. The chili oil is really good, too. I didn't finish it all to save room for my main course.   My 2nd course was the carbonara. They actually being out an egg to mix on top of the hot noodles like traditional carbonara. The noodles had a nice chew to them and the pancetta is really good. It's a rather heavy dish though... I could barely finish half. Needless to say, I didn't have room for dessert..... Even though I really wants to try the tiramisu.   Overall, I would definitely come back! It's priced like the rest of the restaurants on the strip, but it's actually really good for Italian food.

iMvvzikacJuigyiZ2x6IsQ.text: Great food, exhuberant service in sidewalk style but filteted noise and little smoke.

-2vovSjxV0hU5y0D02WUWg.text: Love going to the spot great service great energy great atmosphere I had the seafood fra Diablo delicious Evis was the bartender or waiter did an outstanding job also the bread with a hot olive oil dip was ridiculous

C9UIzD3xTm0W35JbX57Rmg.text: I have eaten here about 5 times... the food is ALWAYS amazing.... get the cheesesteak and the scallops are as good as it gets however, this last trip there was much better due tothe AMAZING SERVICE we received by Ray and Francisco! we were a large group and they were rock stars! Thank you!

C16mYq3guZ5QMxzd8R4Yhg.text: Where do I begin with this review. Wow is the first word that comes to mind! My family and I had a 8pm reservation. As soon as I gave our name we were seated immediately. The ambiance of this restaurant is FIRST CLASS! The decor, the service, the music, the menus that light up, everything is NEXT LEVEL. We had a wonderful server who came over and seated us immediately. We started off with the Famous Meatball & Salad and Fried Calamari Martorano. One word: AMAZING!!!! The meat ball had SO MUCH flavor. It was very tender and rich but not overcooked at all. It spread apart with a slight push of the fork. The gravy, very flavorful and rich. The salad was fresh and very flavorful as well. The Calamari....seasoned and cooked to PERFECTION along with the sauce and green peppers, hands down the best calamari I've ever eaten, PERIOD! I had actually stopped eating calamari the past 8-10 years because it simply wasn't prepared right the past few times I had eaten it(restaurants should take notes from Steve). These were our appetizers.  Next up, entrees! The kids kept it very basic, spaghetti with sauce(no gravy, sauce) and salad. My wife ordered Linguine in White Clam Sauce and I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak. I didn't try any of my wife's but she said it was fabulous. I was nervous about the cheesesteak because I don't like a lot of bread, especially if it's hard and firm. My plate came out and the sandwich was PIPING hot. So hot I had to allow it to cool down. I finally took my first bite and the flavors oozed inside of my mouth. The cheese, the steak(SO tender and juicy) and the bread roll was not too big and it was beyond soft. The meat and cheese seemed like it sank into the inside of the bread and it made a perfect fit! The peppers on the side were spicy(exactly like I like them), juicy and fresh! I only ate half of the sandwich and I was stuffed! The kids finished their meal off with cake that I didn't try ONLY because I was too full. Steve and Marsha treated us like family! Steve is one of the most humble, authentic people I have ever met in my life. What you pay for when dining at Cafe Martorano is a EXPERIENCE, period! Its truly entertainment: the music, the movies on the big screens, the decor, the service, the food; it's simply on another level. When we visit Vegas again in a couple of months I know exactly what I'm ordering and I can't wait! Hands down the best Italian food in Vegas, no questions asked!  Yo Cuz!!!!!

Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steve and baby girl...Yo Cuz!!
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proud of Steve! Read or watch his story online. He came from the bottom, selling sandwiches from his mothers basement. #betonyourself

i5tS0qV7hiJtiyl8ZxkJZw.text: We truly enjoyed our dinner here. Our pasta dishes were full of flavor and freshness. My husband had Bucatini Carbonara a house specialty. Neither one of us had ever tasted anything like it. Needless to say he cleaned his plate and thoroughly enjoyed this meal. I had the Fusilli Pollo this was delisious. It does have a strong bell pepper flavor something im not used to in my pasta. Our waiter took on the style of the resturant making small tall with us. It was nice to enjoy a different dinning experience with different dishes. We eat out alot and it can get boring. So this was a refreshing fun evening. Oh you must top it ofc with the carrot cake, it is out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner was too delicious to worry about snapping photos but this carrot cake was the perfect finishing touch

4YhDMBjkPrXl2d1o-QcOuw.text: I love going to different restaurants when in Vegas, but a must stop is Martorano's! Never have I ate such a delicious carbonara than here! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The staff is always friendly every time I have visited. Definitely a place to check out if you haven't!

0V4spHOZXPtLhKQ2c-RjsA.text: We have been going to Matarano's since they were at the Rio.  I was very disappointed with the food this time had the Rigatoni with Red gravy the pork was very fat and it seemed like they skipped the gravy sauce as the noodles were very dry.  Should have asked for more sauce but by the time it showed up more than an hour after ordering I was very 'Hangry' and ate it anyway.   The old location felt very old school Italian and the dining experience was made better by the attention of the wait staff. I miss that

GHqU4fvbQNqTYYyKbRqgdg.text: Great dinner and great service.  Pricing are Vegas high but overall the food and service were better than most.

vwTiWIaKwepcpJLsXp8rVQ.text: I went here with a friend. The food was so good. It reminded me of the type of italian food i used to eat on the east coast. It was fresh and tasty. The only areas that could use a little improvement was the time it took for the order t come out and the presentation of the veal. Other than that this is the place to go for real " Sunday Gravy" and good food. It is a bit unassuming when you walk by. However, you need to stop! go in and try the food. I reco the cheesesteak sandwich and the meatball salad. A very generous and flavorful salad accompanies a gigantic meatball and plenty of ricotta cheese. The gravy is flavorful and good.   On the veal, i would have dressed it up with some gravy over the top of it and some fresh basil and oregano to give it some depth and color. The taste was good. It was tender and not chewy.   Will i be back, ABSOLUTELY!!!  Already booked a party there.   PS they have tis all around the rest. We were having a terrific meal whilst watching the God Father.  Cannot get better than that!!

ZOU0EbB8WtaCY5CLtTuAKQ.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Martarano's!  Felt like 5 star dining meets home style restaurant in Little Italy. First and foremost, the food was incredible!  The preparation of our food was perfection.  Loved the mozzarella...best cheese stick we have ever had! Both entrees (sea bass and bucatini carbonara) set the bar for other Italian restaurants.  Every staff person we encountered was top notch but especially enjoyed our waiter, Brandon.  An absolute must if dining in Las Vegas!

FvAt7QhXiNn8rMDDqMrNsw.text: Came here for a bachelorette party dinner and it was so yummy. Perfect portions and the menus lit up. So cool!

QZT_d5UyPbSY_BGgGYBlEg.text: I'm glad I did not read the reviews before i went.  I thought it was great  The girlfriend and I went for dinner after a show.  We were seated near the bar, with a view of the walking area outside the restaurant and could see into the restaurant as well.  The music was interesting, not what i would expect, but since I was a child of the 80s, i enjoyed it a lot.  I guess they have a dance floor as well, since they were playing a lot of 80s and 90s hip hop and dance music.  I liked it, but we did not dance...  I thought the food was good.  We shared the Fusilli Pollo and it was enough for two of us, with an appetizer.  We had good service and the price was good as well  It's not a chain that you see in every town, and that's what we were going for.  And it was close to the hotel...

NWjexKo7qMZvaYItOFdCiQ.text: It is more an experience than great food.  The risotto was crunchy and disappointing.  It's average Italian food, not great.  The wine somnelier was very helpful though in helping us select a great wine.  All in all, unless we just went for drinks, we would not return.

TLLHuV3IjHkYqrCwjlNshA.text: Cuzzzzz... best Italian restaurant ever. Atmosphere is good and the food well... you can't get better Italian anywhere in Vegas. Evis is a world class bartender who remembers your drinks and order:

jgQ-Hvow6riIfU-evZYB5Q.text: Very authentic Italian food.   You cannot change anything on the menu  which was a bit annoying but understandable once the food came out.   The pasta was al Dente and so delicious.

4YBKgKUZfNR5XikAw7-4hQ.text: We came here just to try the caesar salad because we heard  so much about it. I must say it was excellent, one of the best Caesar's we've ever had. We also had the shrimp appetizer which was just as good. Bryce and Umberto took excellent care of us. The next time we come we will be sure to ask to sit in Bryce's section. We would highly recommend this restaurant.

BgvTFYKKxx1oKr-VGq0_GQ.text: If I could choose 0 star, I would do that.  We  were yesterday, Sunday the 25th table of 7 people.  We had the worse server ( The blond lady) with attitude and over 'I work by the book'.  Just to mention we are Diamond guest who spend 10-20K a night in the casino.   First she said on what ever we ask to change or add or remove from a dish ( My wife is pregnant)  ' No! I can't. You can see in the menus no changes at all' and after I asked a few times to ask the kitchen and begging , She came back and said 'oh it's ok the will do it for you'. It happened a few times.   Then one of the pasta dish wasn't cooked, And we know more than her one or two things about pasta, She said it should be like that. 'If you wanna change and make a new one it will take you 40 min for a new pasta'. Are you serious !?! She didn't want us to order a new one.  And so we said yes, And guess what? It took 20 min, half of the time she said.  When we said we don't want it because of her bad service, She was  laughing on front of our face with the manager.  One more thing, The pasta is not fresh, and costs 35$ and up for a poor basic marinara pasta. SHAME on Paris hotel that they let this restaurant to be opened there!  Don't go there. Poor menu, WORSE SERVICE.  Super expensive, You better go eat with this prices at Gordon Ramzi restaurant or Mom ami Gabi, X10 times better value for your money , 10X better menu and food quality and the most important you get an excellent service there.

FSRWdQK_K-YISLcVa4tUeQ.text: Great service. The menus are tablets that are back lit for anyone who has trouble seeing in semi-dark rooms. I had the spaghetti with fresh tomatoes and roasted garlic, which was very good. The bread side came with cheese, olive oil, and a pepper oil - all of which were good. The room is filled with TVs showing old movies with subtitles. I'd  return to this place. Great service, great food, and a great location.

wvHjdvFYD1X-tXk_Ygh7jA.text: We ate at the bar because we didn't call ahead for reservations.  I'm glad we did.  Jeremy, our server, was great.  Made good recommendations, had jokes all night and made it a pleasant experience. By way of food, I started with calamari and then had a seafood pasta special.  I thought all of the food was phenomenal.

fyKSugHq62Y9Ir1CcBz-tA.text: Martorano's couldn't care less about you - it's all about the 'thug' attitude of Steve Martorano who believes the food is better than reality. The staff has nothing good to say about him.  At the Paris hotel, I had a diabetic blood sugar crash. After starting to recover, I was escorted by the EMS of Paris Hotel to the nearest restaurant with the desire of getting simple carbs into my system. Slumped in a chair and sweating profusely, I had to deal with extensive discussions until the manager finally stated that he refused to let me order anything except exactly what was on the menu. It went so far that I requested a pasta dish from the menu and asked that no "gravy" be put on the pasta . . . but charge me full price. "Absolutely Not" was the response. It was stated many times that Mr. Martorano does not care about my issues and refuses to make any alterations to any of their dishes - regardless of circumstance. Period.  Aside from this inhumane treatment and outrageous behavior, I was forced to eat Martorano's pasta dish prepared according to 'Steve's' menu requirement. I'm an Italian from New York, my grand parents were from Italy and operated a successful catering business after immigrating to the United States. I know Italian food. I cook and have spent 33 years in the food industry myself, and let me tell you, this food is not authentic Italian. Bread is the most basic aspect of an Italian meal and it should be outstanding. Martorano's bread was absolutely horrible: dry, tasteless and without texture. No kidding, the best part of my meal was the water.    Even if the food had been good, which it was not, how can people tolerate supporting an individual who is so egocentric that he would rather see a patron in distress suffer than serve a pasta dish without his precious "gravy" slathered on top. The tone of everything Martorano is negative, offensive, insulting and stinks of a pompous individual who would rather intimidate his customers and staff than be a beloved restaurateur. Steve Martorano needs to grow up and respect the people that spend their hard-earned money on his over-priced, mediocre food served with an attitude.  "YO CUZ"!!!!!

HyDjP4uWK3dAQf_Z7fj3BA.text: Amazing food! Bryce and Rudy were fantastic servers. Highly recommended if you're in Vegas!

CoFBlS_kryCDKoDBs7WQqw.text: This was AMAZING Place. The food was sooooo good. Our waiter Paul was great. A little bit of a salesman when it came to the menu. Trying to sell the food off the menu was pretty smart Paul. But great service funny guy. The mozzarella with the tomatoes were so delicious. The calamari was very tender and the fresh ricotta with meatballs was to die for. I am glad I trusted him because he knew what he was talking about when it came to the food. Everything was so fresh. I am so going there next time. I wish I can find a restaurant over here in the valley.  Never tasted anything like it.

4W3YF-GcNHtPlu4gWd7SFA.text: Bryce, Edgar and Mike the wine-o were amazing.  Our evening was fabulous due to their expertise and friendliness. We will be back.

mYYDFA404k3fYLRPi9pJYA.text: Nice atmosphere, excellent service, food was much better than I expected...I recommend ordering the meatball and salad combo; one their signature dishes, My wife ordered a cabanara dish that was just right...I had a pasta and meat dish that was delicious, would definitely visit another Martorano's

HMni5h2eIOrpu0N7VVMp1w.text: Really good service and food drinks fancy the best place I've gone while I'm in Las Vegas

5djzlj85CZXpn77It-nP9A.text: Incredible.  I was expecting good, old school Italian. But it was so much better.  Mozzarella made to order. Sunday gravy, best chicken parmigiana ever, and carbonara served with fresh egg yolk cooked into the warm pasta at the table.  One word of advice: as good as the bread and two types of olive oil (plus pecorino Romano) are, skip them.  You will want every bit of your appetite reserved for the main courses.  Definitely a new favorite in Vegas (and we live here).

9ZraHqvx3DMGPGyHU8qSsw.text: Great place to celebrate a birthday! Food was wonderful, service was excellent. I will definitely be coming back!

QKDBUVEStjFkUJtNUzbHuw.text: Great food and awesome atmosphere. I had the chicken with peppers and mushrooms and it was great. The bartender picked a great wine to go with it. I loved the fact the Gm Jeff came by to introduce himself. Definitely will come back next time I'm in LV. (It also doesn't hurt when you're favorite movie is playing in the background, Casino!)

MQxvDGk7TVef_8DV77pBDA.text: Ok in June my wife and I went there and after waiting almost 45 minutes for our dinner we left because the service sucked. I'll never go back and I would tell everyone else much better places to go in Vega.

A couple of us had the salad and couldn't eat it as it was all vinegar,  them came the worse pasta clam dish ever. Also the pricing is outrageous...this was not a good experience

ef5s5ku0G2dcU74LH5hJaw.text: I've been to this location three times and the old one a couple. I've never had a problem with the quality of the food, it's amazing. If the place is at capacity, the service might be a little slow but that's to be expected. Some of these reviews are from some spoiled ass people that don't know anything about the biz. I'm sorry they don't customize dishes but it states it clearly on the menu! No one put a gun to your head and said eat. Maybe in old Vegas they would have. Then again they would have done us all the favor and buried your fake foodie asses in the desert afterwards.

uZFD5lZydWJLWv12C60ueQ.text: OMG! Best food I've had in a long time and I have family in the restaurant business! Please open up in the Los Angeles area!

GzFRXTgoxCNfF7Q4zANrPg.text: Omg! This was my 1st visit and it did not disappoint even the bread was good. I the chicken parmesan and a side of fresh veggie risotto and I highly recommend both! I will totally be coming back next time I'm in Vegas. The atmosphere was energetic and it's a great place to people watch. The music is vibrant and therr were tv's with sports and movies on. The service was also superb.

Eqt-aogRFPwUSLuY2v3npw.text: There is not too much to complain about here. Yes there are over priced items from on the menu. Stay away from them. The Carbonara Pasta dish is the BEST I ever had. And the meatball and Salad app was amazing. My Italian grandmother would be jealous of the Sunday "gravy" (We call it sauce).   Stay with the classics and you won't be disappointed.

HSD8HzN_mNtunn50E-Xrqg.text: Went here for a birthday dinner. Food was great! Chicken Downtown was delicious! Eggplant stack and a meatball for appetizer was also great. But what really stood out was our server Brandon, super nice guy and extremely knowledgable about all the menu items. Everything was excellent.

7YFzeRp-fAx5qtzzY6Y_Hg.text: Martarano salad was delicious. A bit pricy, but the food is pretty damned good. Ate at the bar, bartender was very attentive and the food came very fast. The linguine and clams was legit. Giant clam meat within the pasta. Delicious. Some might find it salty, but that dish is supposed to be. I would totally eat here again.

1H0rOFZXg5-N11qSrkOxnQ.text: Wanted something to ease our hunger pains,  but now wanting a full meal.  Ordered the risotto at the bar and it was HEAVEN!  Melted in our mouths.  Looking forward to my next visit!

jqaFg7KKx9mXAnkLMxiFSw.text: Good food but not as good as their fort Lauderdale location.   The Bolognese sauce was a bit bland and the meat was fatty and not properly rendered down.  This same dish in Florida was perfection.  The bread is delicious and the pasta was served perfectly al dente.

brmnzaFkALyecmeOkfJn7Q.text: My husband and I were told to have Italian here.. we were on miracle mile.. rt outside the mall a short walk in flats of course to Paris straight through the the cobble stone walkway  Didn't need to wait to be seated at 8:30 hostess gave us out on perimeter dining  Service was not over top but pretty good  Bread was somewhat ignored  Water was on spot! Drinks, order, food, presentation were all very good. Willing to fetch anything we needed didn't anticipate my needs..but still adequate. Linen, nice glass wear and flatware. Our food which I don't recall with all the talking and drinking and more drinking was pretty damn tasty  It was good. Experience given was very nice  Bill was what was expected $$$ Overall I'd do again

4_ziheGahRPhsAMiQZx_hQ.text: To make a long story short - great everything! Great service, great menu, great drinks, great fresh daily mozzarella, great decor, great location.... and the list goes on. We had a large party of 10 and we loved where we were seated.   You know how you go to dimly lit restaurants and the older people in your party can't ever read the menu?! Welp, no problem here because the menu is digital! Fancy!   I dare say that you will not go wrong with anything you order. Everyone in my party was ecstatic with their meal and raved about it. I had the most divine braised short rib pasta! I still dream about it. The drinks are great as well.   It's well worth it. I paid for my date and I believe for the two of us ,it was only $200 with drinks. The dirty martini is excellent and I got some sort of pear basil drink that was delicious. Next time wine for sure because the gentleman sitting across from me said it was delicious with his steak. I tried both and he was absolutely right. Can't wait to go back!!

79ElSBy940oTPLOAHsazWg.text: This is seriously the only good thing we experienced at Paris. We were so disappointed with everything else, but this saved our evening there.  We didn't order anything to eat, but we came in for a drink at the bar and were pleasantly surprised. The bartenders were super nice, attentive, and knowledgable about their selections. It was nice being able to chat a bit about the different wines they carried and they offered me a few to try based on my preferences. We were impressed.  The decor is interesting with blue lighting and very modern. Not exactly what I'd expect from an Italian restaurant. We came in on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too busy. We were greeted right away when we stepped up and got a seat at the bar. The bartender came over right away to help us.  Although I don't see us ever staying at the Paris Hotel again, if we were in the area and wanted to grab a drink, we would totally come back here. I'd even be open to trying it out for dinner.

0Y8uzta8Ut0Ph3OpmTa94w.text: Great wine. Weird atmosphere. Inside Paris on a fake paris street. Calamari was excellent.  Service was good. Over priced. Ordered the lobster. Good enough. Would never come back here. So many better restaurants. So expensive. And a stupid atmosphere.

iusmd9kmLvJc2qn91Xqkvw.text: I came to Martorano's with a request: seating for a party of 25, within 30 minutes. After a few escalations, we haggled it for 45 minutes, and only if my party agreed to do things "family style" - that is, order a bunch of stuff from the menu, and everyone shares. No problem! This was a great compromise, and I was so grateful they let us do this. Awesome service, both in that regard and once we were all seated. All of our servers were attentive, kept the wine flowing, and were able to talk in an educated way about the food that was being served to us.  There were a couple of pain points though. First, while they wanted us to do family style, they didn't have a policy in place for it. We actually just had to order 3-5 of each menu item, and pay the same price. Not quite what we expected (the manager led me to believe there was a specific family style menu). Second, the food is just fine, but some of it just isn't worth the cost. $30+ spaghetti? It's good, but not quite that good. No one at all in our party liked the  Linguine in White Clam Sauce.  I'd recommend the veal, meatballs, and calamari bibzy. And making a reservation for large parties ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs, ricotta cheese, and veal
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light up menu

mS1ZzFlQvemXgdWc97RxMw.text: This is a straight to the point kind of joint. The menu is the menu, no substitutions, no hold this or add that or sauce on the side. Just order and eat. That's it.   Best parts: Cadillac Margarita, strong yet tasty. Meatball, GREAT flavor. House made mozzarella, yummy. Light up menu, nice touch. Bussers were nice and efficient.   Decent parts: Everything else. Cesar salad, nothing special. Calamari, nothing special. Veal Marsala, below average. Spaghetti pescatori, lots of seafood, but just good. Gnocchi, bland.  Bad parts: Over priced, shoot em up movie playing on the tvs, no outside drinks allowed (not even cocktails from the casino bar). Not offered fresh Parmesan cheese and no salt or pepper to be found.   We would come back for meatballs at the bar but that's about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 couples and we were all underwhelmed. Not horrible just average food.

ga3up_ANGfu8OeILXEG0LQ.text: The food here was disappointing. The service was good but I would probably not come back for the food. Maybe, I'm just not the right type of customer. There were there for dinner before going to see the new Inferno magic show.  We ordered, the fried calamari, spaghetti with meatball, carbonara, and cheese steak, and a salad.  First of all, when I order calamari, I expect it to be crispy and temperature hot. The sauce that they put on the calamari made all the pieces soggy. Have you had soggy calamari at a restaurant before? I haven't. This was the first time.  The spaghetti was fine. Nothing special with a giant meatball. For $25 or so for an average bowl of spaghetti wasn't worth it. If the sauce was more flavorful, then sure, but really, I could have made that spaghetti. The carbonara was okay, but I think they must have used swiss cheese, or the combination of cheese they used wasn't as good. It was very strong. I love parmessan, gruyere, asiago, etc. but whatever the combination was - was something that I personally didn't like. The Philly was okay, as well, but nothing special.  Usually price isn't a factor, but when the food isn't great, then it becomes an issue, because it wasn't worth it.  If I had known, I probably would have gone to Maggiano's instead. Oh, finally, the salad. It was swimming in dressing. I ordered the Maggiano's salad for $14. It was just that - lettuce and some tomatoes. I am being critical in that the world of restaurants has made so many innovations in salad that a $14 salad shouldn't be a small plate of greens with dressing that I could have bought at the grocery store.   I love great food and expect it when it is billed as a fine dining restaurant. Mediocre is right. I make better pasta at home than this restaurant. I don't think the chefs understand that people's palate's have changed. We're used to eating at so many great pasta restaurants - Nora's, Buddy Vs, Maggioni's, Wolfgang Puck, and a few more - gosh even California Pizza Kitchen, and I'll say Buca Di Beppo have some solid dishes, so this place is a great disappointment.

vPl1I7n6s9BvLH6Y0e1x3g.text: I had a caesar and the bucatini with meatball.... it was good. The sommelier was well informed and let us taste a couple of reds before we made our selection. J7rpw-gdgDh0IxrzU9-U2A.text: My wife surprised me with dinner place at this place last night for our first time. I was super excited. Been wanting to try this place for a few years and we are locals!   We got seated fairly quickly because my wife made reservations ahead of time. The ambiance was great. Romantic and classy yet hip. Our server was great. Very knowledgeable of the menu and personable. His assistant and the GM were great. Everyone who waited on us was amazing.   I took off a star because the bread wasn't all the great and my chicken parmigiana was kind of boring on the plate. As for the taste it was pretty good, but I don't think it met my expectations for how much each dish was.   I would still recommend though. It was a great date night place.

24H7gOX9NCCEn-AlfOZdpQ.text: A warning to picky eaters or anyone with allergies or dietary restrictions- this is not the place for you!  I am a very picky eater who does not eat tomatoes or even tomato based products. This can make it hard at Italian restaurants, but I normally just ask the server to hold the sauce. I decided to order chicken Parmesan for $28 dollars when dining at Martorano's with my friends tonight. I asked the server if I could have the dish without tomatoes, and she told me no. She said the chef refused to change his dishes (his grandmother's recipes), so I could get a plain piece of breaded chicken OR order the dish as is. I said I would take the plain piece of chicken with cheese on top- NOPE! No cheese allowed. Well, I decided I wasn't about to pay $28 for plain chicken (not even pasta or veggies on the side). Also, since plain chicken wasn't on the menu, I'm not sure why that was acceptable, but putting cheese on top was not.   I then asked for a special appetizer for the evening, fried mozzarella. This dish came with sauce on top, so I simply asked for the sauce on the side. NOPE! They wouldn't do it. I'm sorry- you can't serve the MADE TO ORDER DISH with the exact same ingredients, just on the side, rather than on top?   The server tried to offer alternatives, but 1) I'm very picky and couldn't find anything else without asking for no sauce, and 2) this interaction left a bad taste in my mouth. The server did point out the menu said "no alterations," and I accept it was written there, but what a ridiculous rule! I asked if it would be different if I had allergies, and she said no! Unbelievable! I decided to not order anything at all, and went to eat at a different restaurant later (they held my ingredients for me, no problem!).   In addition to this, when being seated, my friend (who had a reservation) asked for a table inside. We were told there weren't any available, even though it was empty inside. Furthermore, after the meal, the server didn't even offer dessert- she just tried to bring the check. My friend had to ask to see a dessert menu.  When all was said and done, my friends enjoyed their food... but the no change policy was enough to ruin my meal, and it really put a damper on the evening for the rest of my group. If you are going to charge outrageous LV Strip prices, at least let the customer order his/her way. Will not be back at this establishment!

4v5Rn4XQDzl3H654U_7dMA.text: An hour long wait, despite having made reservations more than a month in advance - we were originally seated on the "sidewalk" outside the restaurant, with casino guests stumbling past mere inches from our table. Make sure you ask for a table inside the restaurant, but not under the house speakers - it was so loud, we couldn't even hear our waitress, who immediately screamed over the noise, "Yeah, people complain about the music all the time!" Do they, now?  We started with the Fried Calamari Bibzy ($20), which was a conflict of textures - some of the larger pieces of squid were completely melt-in-your-mouth tender, while other pieces were crazy rubbery - even the waitress quipped about the half-eaten portion when she finally arrived with our drink orders.  The place has a fantastic wine selection, featuring some really nice and inexpensive offerings, including several of our favorites from the Conundrum Winery by the glass - and we received some awesome suggestions from the sommelier, who had to scream his selections over the music.   My wife's Linguine with White Clam Sauce ($32) arrived under a thick layer of Italian parsley - so much so you would have thought someone dumped a lawnmower bag over the plate. And while the pasta was perfectly cooked, many of the clam pieces were gritty with sand. By the time my wife called it quits, there was such a pile of parsley "clippings" floating in the remaining broth, you couldn't see the bottom of the plate.   The Veal Piccata ($34) was tender and the lemon butter sauce was excellent. Just don't forget to order a side of pasta, because everything is a'la carte - an important fact that was either not shared with us, or we simply missed the detail while the waitress attempted to scream over the music.  Oh, and don't ask for salt or pepper - "The chef seasons everything to perfection." Maybe for his pallet, but the veal would have certainly benefitted from a tiny sprinkling of salt.

X64gaMqj-lbxwLbC6tmnFg.text: I've eaten here many times. Excellent food and service. Very nice decor.  One of the better restaurants in La

SI6TTJExQDHQz0cqRQCLpA.text: Get the spaghetti pescatore.  Its fire.  It is Vegas, so expect it to be pricey.  Service was good, it was also not a very busy evening.  Drinks were great as well.

7k5bq8N4y4EoBtvaLo8uJg.text: Martorano's can't decide what kind of restaurant it wants to be. Its both tacky and faux elegant. Its kitchen is open yet its ingredients and prep are very basic.  Its prices are high and its quality of food is middle at best.   Steve Martorano is painted as a South Philly goon (Posters of him with "Yo Cuz!!" in large print are plastered everywhere") who somehow learned how to cook despite no formal training. You will see his book, his image, and videos of him talking about cooking during your time there. It's like walking into someone's ego. They are really selling this guy's image along with the food.  The Ego would be fine if the food matched it. Or, at the very least, justified the prices.   None of the food was bad, but it wasn't very good either and, at about $50 a person, I'm hard pressed to recommend this place when there are SO many better Italian options on the strip in the immediate vicinity.

vPHDI4T-UDBO1yz7u7kuYw.text: We were at Paris Hotel for 4 nights in February 2017. We enjoyed a lot of good food but by far this was our best overall experience. From the reservationist the day before to the hostess the water server all the way thru to our waiter it was primo. Food was excellent as well, we shared the waiter's recommended special of the night - be sure to check the iPad for their specials. Loved sitting out on The Avenue as well. If we are back at Paris Hotel, we will definitely return.

2mZRHpL27C6nCTOUd3Otpg.text: Incredible Food, Service, Ambiance and Drinks!  Louis our server and the entire staff were fabulous!

5VhJ-8Qx_NN__NZ9yvs6hA.text: The extremely poor service outweighed the delicious food. My daughter had just turned 21 and we were in the mood for some fine Italian food so we made our reservations and arrived right on time. We were seated, but no server was to be found for about 10 minutes. We had no drinks, or water. Finally our server Raymond came over and introduced himself, he was pleasant but dismissive, not even apologizing for the wait. We understand the restaurant may be busy, but maybe more waitstaff should be hired because one server can not handle 12 tables at once. We were looking into getting a bottle of wine and he asked us if we were staying at The Paris Hotel. We said no, but staying at The Cosmopolitan across the street. He kept trying to sell us something we did not want but insisted and made us try it anyway, still not liking it we ordered what we originally wanted. Took another 15 minutes for our bottle of wine to come and be served.  The whole time we noticed the table next to us was a bunch of high rollers, and got anything they wanted. There was every server, bus boy, sommelier helping them the entire service. Our server was barely present the whole time, and was mainly focused on the table next to us. A sommelier did not even show us the bottle of wine that we ordered. Then it came time to order our food, and we were excited because we heard the food was amazing and it certainly did not disappoint. Our first course came, we got the meatball salad and it was divine. I noticed though that every other table that got salad got it served to them by their server, in which we did not. Not a big deal, but bad front of house service for sure. Our main entrees were fantastic as well, we got the chicken parmigiana and veal parmigiana. Excellent food, kudos to the kitchen. Overall it was extremely poor service, which is very upsetting due to how good the food was.   Will not be returning due to the service.

4wLWKix675AMs88uM3hhQw.text: First time eating here....and...LOVED IT. There are so many dining options in Vegas- but we will return here!  The service was great.   Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive.   I love the fact that they show you pictures of the specials. We had the pork chop special and the sea bass with lump crab meat. Outstanding!  They make their own mozzarella and it was wonderful.   Great experience!

qdEZ75NHexn0WoQQp8OSYQ.text: The only reason why I making this a three star review, is the fact that the meatball salad was off the charts and the wait staff was very courteous. They're claiming the best chicken Parmesan in Las Vegas, if that's the best then I'd hate to see the worst because it was soggy and not very good at all. We had the flat pasta bolognese and it was so salty it was barely edible. I will eat there again solely for the meatball salad and the Motz appetizer.

SFwbMJTRSjUD46ZC1bYhnQ.text: My sweetie and I had dinner here for the first time last night and were blown away by how fabulous everything was. From the atmosphere to the service (Paul is an outstanding waiter who is both friendly and knowledgeable) to the food, it was simply top notch. The Caesar salad is big enough to split and the dressing was flavorful. Both pasta dishes we had we perfectly cooked and seasoned. Wine was reasonably priced considering the quality. This place gets it right on every level. We will be back!

hxRSnWdQE2rRAlAb6csIpQ.text: Great:  Bread Calamari Appetizer Linguini & Clams, portion too much Scallop Special, portion a little light Fried Peppers  Not so Great: Service Fusilli Pollo, portion too much  Didn't have dessert, but they looked great at other tables.  Better choices around.

wJ2lWxVfz1Sxb5h8hf-zyQ.text: Fabulous food here!  Wait staff is very attentive and friendly.  We greatly enjoyed our experience with Brandon and the bartender Jenna.    Our first night here we stopped in for a drink and dessert.  We saw someone else enjoying the Cesar salad and knew we had to come back.  The following night after watching a show, we returned....  The Cesar salad is splendid!  Beautiful presentation with large shaved Parmesano-Reggiano pieces on top.  Bread is served wth olive oil, grated Parmesan, and chili oil.    Desserts.... No words, just yummy feelings. We tried the chocolate cake with cream cheese frosting the first night and the following night plus the tiramisu.  Delectable!  Flavors do not disappoint.  I want that tiramisu recipe!  BEST ever...  Atmosphere:  There are TVs playing Vegas mob-type movies with subtitles, music playing, Several disco balls glittering in the back.  The blue colors are inviting.    really cool modern menus... Backlit!  iPad/tablet technology used by wait staff.

kVI6j03fwP6mETyoJcKzLw.text: Excellent Italian restaurant modeled after East Coast Italian! Bryce took very good care of us! Pasta excellent!

AzengwjPk95OXRfU449PWQ.text: For some strange reason, our concierge recommended this place for family dining with a baby. WOW. That couldn't have been further from the truth.  The food was pretty sensational despite it's high prices. ($14 for still water, really?) I had the carbonara, where the yolk was broke and mixed in table side. Our server advertised it as the best pasta on the menu and his description was right on the money.  The environment, however, was extremely odd. In the light up iPad menu, there's an excerpt somewhat warning of the restaurant's unique style of operation. White tablecloths and embroidered napkins suggest fine dining however TV screens playing movies with explicit content, an obscene amount of disco balls and gaudy neon blue lights complete the interior decorations. Very loud music bounces from current hip-hop to 80s pop to 90s r&b, with the occasional pause and dimming of lights to focus in on 90 seconds of the most vulgar scenes of whatever feature film is playing.  All in all, an extremely strange yet delicious experience.

2suIGqSeSIKUrLpjvcWxWw.text: Went there this past week, stumbled upon a great Italian restaurant in Paris...who knew?  But the food was great!!!  We started by splitting the eggplant stack, highly recommend and I had the veal marsala, tender and delicious and my friend had the chicken parm which she said was great.  Super attentive waiter and manager checked in on us, great hospitality.  Check it out!

MtDGFFxCqgLLjDF28ZDLWQ.text: Great dinner and service! Veal Park and Lobster were fantastic. Orders all desserts for a birthday and they brought it all out with great flare!

GupMXIGicVxbB4mMUT9nPA.text: I have waited two weeks after eating at Martorano's to write this review, in order to take some of the emotion out of my review.  I left there disappointed, because I like Paris Las Vegas so much.  But if you're looking for Italian in Las Vegas, you can do so much better.  It was fairly simple to get a reservation the same day.  People on walk-up at 8PM were told about a 45-minute wait which, on a holiday weekend in Vegas, still seemed reasonable.  Greeter staff was nice.    Our server was polite, but was very busy in another part of the restaurant.  We waited almost 10 minutes after ordering drinks to get them, and it was only because our assistant waiter (the busboy) saw us looking around, and was alert enough to ask if there was a problem.  Martorano's boasts about their meatballs.  The meatballs get lots of hype.  And the meatball appetizer is OK, but not life-changing.  If you've ever eaten in Little Italy in any city, or at a decent Italian restaurant anywhere that makes its own meatballs as opposed to using those from their foodservice, you'll think the same.  The presentation is nice, but for $20, I expected more from a meatball.    The food was very good.  Please don't mistake the tone of my review, accentuated by what happened when ordering, for putting down their food.  It's pricey, but it's The Strip.  I had Veal Parmigiana which came with NOTHING for $42.   My problem came when I tried to order a side dish.  I wanted a side of pasta, but too much tomato is a very bad thing for me, and I was already having it in the veal. The waiter knew this, because I asked for very light sauce with the veal.    I asked if they could do the pasta with just butter or oil and garlic - very simple, staple ingredients in any restaurant kitchen, let alone an Italian kitchen.  I was told NO, right away.  No discussion.  The restaurant has a firm "no substitutions" policy.  I explained to the waiter that it was something akin to a food allergy, and he told me there was nothing he could do.  The answer was NO.  So I asked just for some plain spaghetti, no sauce.  I was going to be sneaky and just take the butter from the bread and put it on the pasta.  Guess they were two steps ahead of me, because that wasn't allowed either.  I was going to take the spaghetti with marinara and LIKE IT!  OK - no side dish.  And, it's not as though Tomato was going to kill me.  I wasn't going into shock...just some discomfort.  But, no dice.  The waiter sensed my displeasure, and the GM appeared later.  He apologized for not being able to accommodate my wishes.  He told me that the chef had full control over the kitchen, and he was adamant about there being no changes and no substitutions for anything on the menu.  I asked to speak to the chef, but was told "Oh, he's not here, he's in Dallas...but he reads feedback comments you leave when you sign your check".  For the record, as polite as my comments were, he never responded.  It was simply the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard of.  Celebrity Chefs everywhere make accommodations for guest requests that aren't outrageous. I mean, I wasn't asking them to make me gluten-free pasta.    We ate our entrees - which were good.  Nothing memorable, but good.  We skipped dessert and coffee.  The heavy word:  There are WAY TOO MANY CHOICES for great Italian in Las Vegas - and within a 10 minute walk of this place - for any restaurant to be less-than-accommodating.  I'm not saying you won't have a good meal here; but you can do better.

gzTxJc80QuQg_RyYTR5erw.text: Absolutely Awful...I just wish I would have read reviews FIRST.. I would have never have gone. SERVICE... Ridiculous. They were not even busy and they let us sit with our menus  menus closed for some time.  FOOD...so NOT good. You know how when you are eating Spaghetti  and the oil is overwhelming? Yep... That's it. Awful  Please please SAVE your MONEY. I suspect they are struggling. I wonder why? Why don't they try and listen to the customers reviews ?  Here is your chance Management... Email me and ask me to give you a full report.... I will be happy to help.

Q-If6FpoYEGf6OcRCqn--Q.text: Seven Stars guest--arrived 10 minutes early--told us we had to wait because the waiter was not available (since when is that the customer's fault?) --asked for another open table--was told the waiter at that table was waiting for a party of 10 and couldn't seat us until that group arrived..wow---decided to wait for the first waiter to become available -even though there were many open tables-finally were seated--waited 15 minutes--no water, no bread, no excuse me I'll be with you in a minute--no nothing---told my fiance that if no one came our table within one more minute we were going to leave-and we did-went to Mon Ami Gabi--and loved it

9jYIdhCbkBuMU4SMtGqPnA.text: This is by far the best ItAlian restaurant.  The service was impeccable and the food was the best. I recommend it very highly.

0PDyE5u9ZuKONzlvQDRwjg.text: If you're at Paris and looking for a great restaurant then eat at Martoranos. Excellent service and food is delicious. Big portions which is nice. Our server Jessie was super cool. Great personality and very attentive to our needs. She recommended the eggplant stack... wow!! And the famous meatball is amazing!! Must order this! We had the veal Marsala and penne alla vodka. Food is awesome I'll definitely be back! Great job Martorano you have great food and great employees! Thank you to our server Jessie she was awesome.

GniG1UHZ1ki5TPGCaIg6Jw.text: First time in Vegas- wanted to eat well. I love Italian food. My son suggested this place as he had been to it at a previous location. He told the waiter we would start with appetizers and then decide on the main course. The waiter said that he could not take a partial order - we had to order the entire meal at the beginning. I said - I may want dessert... he said we had to decide then. If I had been in my hometown I would have asked for the manager and had a discussion with him about how ridiculous this was. Instead we just ate our appetizers and left - we went elsewhere for our dessert. What a shame.

GmiLdrfPZcMkoforKi8TLA.text: This is a return visit as I was here last year and definitely wanted to come back. Martorano's never fails to please.  The food is superb as are the wonderful waiters.   They are attentive and cheerful without being overbearing. I will definitely make another visit here when I next come back to Las Vegas. This is my go-to spot for fine Italian dining.

jGPJwobRb7G-ICQge8sjIg.text: Excellent food.  The wife and I shared the famous meatball and salad appetizer and eggplant stack and they did not disappoint. Very tasty and well seasoned. The main course of chicken parmigiana and seafood pescatore are both recommended.  Wait staff was very attentive and knew there courses.  Would highly recommend

tkE2LFN-a_1nZ-k9K1KWcQ.text: Great place for amazing food as always. Thanks to Steve for bringing this restaurant from Florida to Vegas.

a7Gd92aXvvc-bP3qih5r0Q.text: Review for dinner, 9:30 pm Saturday 12/12. Reservation made through Open Table. I can't stress enough how wonderful an experience we had at Martorano's this evening. Server Paul went absolutely above and beyond our expectations. My wife and I chose to share an app, entree, and two sides. Paul did us the favor of splitting our order tableside and even served us for an extra personal touch. He couldn't have been more personable, attentive, helpful, and funny.   The food we orders was incredible. The fresh mozzarella and cherry tomatoes with evoo, sea salt, and a 25yr balsamic reduction came out first, and let me tell you, coming from someone who use to sell fine cheese, this mozz was top notch. The 16oz NY Strip was a perfect medium rare, and the blistered shishito peppers were the perfect compliment. The sauteed greens were cooked perfectly as well, and the risotto may be one of the best I've had.   Note to potential diners, on Friday and Saturday they have a DJ performing in house. Great mix, but can be loud in the main dining hall if that's not your thing.   Bonus points for Rocky playing on the tv's in the dining room :-)

CP1BzEp1p8RqRS6WVZv0yg.text: This is the second time we've dined here. The first time was in Harrahs in Atlantic City and it did not disappoint ! Paul out server over at the Las Vegas location was awesome! Im so stuffed!

3uraBu7YHCbK16Ol_1vw9w.text: This is hands down one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! The Chicken Parmesan is phenomenal with fresh mozzarella; the gnocchi are like little pillows of heaven; the meatball/salad is a must-order. Even the olive oils that accompany the bread are worth raving about.. hello red pepper infused oil. It's one of only a handful of Italian restaurants I'd ever recommend. Our server Paul & all of the staff were nice, helpful & attentive. (P.S. I'm posting from the table because it's so good you have to know now!)

QIrBQRLTyMsXLmzuCwTw7Q.text: Our severs Raymond and Francisco were excellent and so was our food. Chicken Downtown was fantastic.

aqOegbv3gW_8ZnSqRAZi0w.text: Food was good. Eggplant stack amazing and homemade mozzarella to die for! Service was impeccable!

F-_H3OkATCxAejA34YfmSw.text: Been here many times and the food though expensive is awesome. Jeff and Nate were terrific and very personable. Highly recommend the short rib pasta.

uSDWREpQTiavvRLnNCI4JQ.text: Fantastic dining experience - the staff was spot on and the food was excellent. Try the meatball!

4Cjp9sBMn_V9BqP8rP3MNg.text: Wow. Amazing meal. Read the reviews 1st and they were spot on! Do not miss the meatball and fried mozzarella appetizer and the egg plant app! We were getting full so we split the Rigatoni Sunday Pork and it was AMAZING!!!! Do not miss these 3 dishes. Our Bartender Evis recommended it and he was spot on. Had an wonderful glass of wine with it! We will be back every time we visit Vegas!

-47o30yA5DPGd3tnLpA1Hg.text: If you e ever been to the restaurant in Florida, then don't go here. Will totally be disappointed!  My husband and I started w the meatball n salad app. Which was made for one!! Super small, not enough to share! Sauce was great! Meatball? Eh.. The theme of the restaurant seemed a bit watered down, especially w the wait staff wearing "yo cuz" shirts. One word of advice, "yo Steve, do us real fans of yours a favor. Get your ASS to VEGAS  and tell those Fu-ers at Cesears To let you do your thing.

W96dsSWAMKpVs0Lbmndr0g.text: Let me start by saying- if you want a quiet, candle lit dinner- this is not the place. Martorano's is the "go-to" place for a True Vegas experience! They have a great Vegas atmosphere- very fun and vibrant! In the middle of my dinner, a screen dropped down and played a movie scene from Austin Powers. Then a while later, there was dance music and a disco ball!   Food was AMAZING!!! I had the Veal Cutlet Martorano- I mean the guy's name is on it- of course it was freaking delicious!!! I also had the meatball which did not disappoint, but I'm telling you- the Veal Cutlet Martorano is one of the best Italian dishes I have EVER had!

yxCuqjZ9i_Q_Yuv3Aueu4g.text: An unexpected find for amazing veal and chicken Marsala! Portions were great and the side of pasta and Caesar salad easily shareable. The atmosphere was fun but not overdone and our waitress amazing. She was so helpful with suggestions and attentive. The wine options also very good.

G2-OPybnWPsF09htw1oLQw.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Martorano's. The food was excellent and the portions were very generous. The servers were friendly, professional, and attentive. We'll be back!

1OUWnPf0dSmrplHkTllkOA.text: Dinner with friends at Martorano's was great. Started with the salad with meatballs and calamari. Amazing. For dinner we had veal marsala, veal piccata, lobster and rigatoni's with Sunday gravy. Everything was excellent. Service outstanding. Looking forward to another dinner here soon.

kacmuF2fkU1-kqaXIxor6Q.text: I was impressed with the atmosphere of this restaurant. The decor is pretty upbeat and unique. They have several tvs which play old movies and at some point they dim the lights and play loud music. It's a pretty fun place if you are in the mood to party. However, if you are not it can be very dark and too loud for dinner.   They have a large variety of dishes. I highly recommend the homemade mozzarella. There are a few dishes with it, so you have several opportunities to try it. For my main entree I ordered the tailgate pasta which comes with ground beef, veal and pork. The dish is super meaty and the pasta was perfectly cooked.   For my dessert I ordered the carrot cake. This dish was good, but easy to forget. Unfortunately they do not have a lot of options for desserts. I felt the five options available were very mediocre.  The service was also ok. The staff was friendly but it took about 45 minutes to get our main entree. Overall, a good option if you are feeling like having Italian food with a great atmosphere.

WKKjOKnVWOuQj_FYSarQeg.text: a delicious meal from start to finish at Martoranos in Paris Las Vegas.   we shared the meatball appetizer and eggplant stack, both were out of this world. how do you stack fried eggplant with cheese and tomatoes and still keep your eggplant that crispy. i need to know. also the meatball was so good, not dry in the least bit and that big dollop of ricotta on the side really pulls it all together.  for dinner we got the rigatoni served with the biggest piece of slow cooked pork you could find. i swear my grandma would have been smiling ear to ear over that gravy, pork, al dente rigatoni, and yup, more ricotta cheese combo.   as if all of that food wasnt enough, we finished with the ice cream trio which was so amazing. the cookies and cream ice cream had huge pieces of oreos in it and this dainty little cone it was almost to pretty to eat.   service and food was incredible. cant wait to try his other locations.

J4cZ4nPsPOBNKnzy_i2xdQ.text: Definite 5 stars plus! Great food. Exceptional service. I had the meatball mozzarella appetizer and a dessert and I was stuffed. The server was knowledgeable and very pleasant. Convenient location right outside of the Paris hotel. The movies that were played made dining feel like I was at home. Beautiful decor as well.

kc8frKGe7iMZnMz7xSVaqA.text: This is a loud and boisterous restaurant, please do not expect a quiet romantic meal. That's fine. Service was spotty. The stacked eggplant was excellent. The balsamic on the plate is for looks only, unfortunately added no flavor. The carbonara was under seasoned and muddled, a great disappointment. Will not return.

dxuXIsYxXAi8UnEXxCkDzw.text: Great food and atmosphere! Loved the music, vibe, service- everything! We'll be coming back!

8xlbE0DI2Enin91uEJSYHA.text: I've eaten here at couple of times in the past and the food here has always been very solid. This time was no exception.  They have a weird policy not to bring out any bread until the food has been ordered.  Maybe many have left after filling up on their bread and then decided not to order.   So once we ordered our food they brought out some of the bread served with romano cheese, olive oil and a spicy oil to dip the bread in.  We started off with the bibzy fried calamari.  Tender and delicious with a sweet n spicy sauce sprinkled with sesame seeds.    I opted for the protein side of the entrees and ordered the veal piccata.  A generous portion of veal that was ohhhh so tender and delicious.  I could easily cut it with a fork, no knife needed.  The veal was sitting in a delicious sauce of wine, butter, lemon, olive oil and surrounded by tasty capers.  The meal was very filling and by the time dessert was offered I was too full to partake.  I'll definitely have to save room for some tiramisu the next time around.

I'm from Philly, and let me tell you their $18 cheesesteak is .....worth every penny.  It is absolutely the best.  Their meatball is spectacular, my only issue is; why the heck they charge extra for a tablespoon of ricotta.  That kind of stingy-ness as well as the inconsistency with service is the only reason I cannot give them a 5/5.       Overall, I have never not been happy with their food.  And locals....there is a discount!!! Great place to go.

Nathan is a huge asset to the restaurant and you will not be disappointed if you are lucky enough to have him as your bartender/server.

np2vOjfBosacUcDdB-iDmw.text: This is an Italian restaurant in the promenade between Paris Hotel and Self-park/ Bally's. I hate to give this place a poor review because the food was so good. I had the spaghetti which was fantastic. Great wine list too. Bread and flavored olive oils are unique and tasty. The deal breaker is the service. It started out good and the server was nice enough but then after we got our food and ate, she just ignored our table for 20 minutes. Unfortunately, we were in a hurry and spent 20 minutes waiting for the check. We asked two bus boys to let the waitress know we wanted to go but to no avail. Might have been an isolated incident but disappointing. It could have been a great experience.

wgcI7h9opEINvEA4GMdNuA.text: This is a classic New Jersey style Italian restaurant in the middle of the Paris hotel lobby. Given the casino adjacent location, the food was surprisingly good and the service strong. The bread was terrific, always a good sign. The meatballs are good too - light and fluffy. We looked up the recipe later and they put hoagie rolls in the meatballs, a nice touch. The prices aren't high for a Vegas restaurant, our dinner actually cost less than brunch the next day.

PKSvjXgmReBVE-D1L6LaLw.text: Celebrated our anniversary dinner in Vegas, such an amazing 5star experience one of the best restaurant and service we've ever experienced! Amazing wine list, had a bottle to share, started with the fresh mozzarella and eggplant stack it was great, main course was the carbonara WOW amazing! Dessert and espresso to finish and everything was absolutely delicious. Welcomed like family, treated like royalty thank you to the staff for a night to remember. Atmosphere is so cool and like nothing around! Truly genuine and unique experience. #YoCuz

d8w29DBkAjTqS4hBlMUzLw.text: Absolutely phenomenal service and by far, the best Italian food we have ever had. The homemade mozzarella is delicious and the pasta cooked perfectly. The meatball is out if this world. Cannot more highly recommend. And big shout out to Raymond for making our first date night as a married couple absolutely perfect!!!!

HM2qqHHnwnod7GyQ4RU3Tg.text: I've been ordering calamari as my favorite appetizer for decades and the Calamari Bisby is hands down without question the best I've ever eaten. It is the most tender bite of calamari you can imagine. The flavor profiles boasts a slightly spicy and sweet Kung poa style  taste leaving you wanting more.  Next time I come to Vegas I will be back for the appetizer alone. I ordered the veal Parmesan for an entree.  My companion ordered  the chicken parm. Both met and exceeded expectations, the chicken outweighing the the veal in tenderness and flavor. I will make an effort to return here next time I come to Las Vegas. The service was above par.  The waiter was helpful and the delivery/bussing service staff was borderline entertainment for the evening.  I can't stress enough to get the calamari Bisby even jf that is all you come for.

Xum00ZJzgRfuVuySP4QAfA.text: We really loved this place inside the Paris! We came here twice while on our vacation and both times we sat at the bar while they were only serving pizza and salads. The Caesar is to die for seriously! And the pizzas are unique and delicious. Great for a little bite mid day around 3pm. Both times the bar tenders were exceptional as well and made it a truly nice experience. Next time we are in vegas I'm sure we will be here again.  Ambiance is cool too with the blue lights!

Beware the waiters are great sales people so keep that in mind when asking for suggestions from them. Hands down the BEST MEATBALLS ever. Penne in Vodka sauce was a bit dry but the chicken parm was everything ! Overall delicious food, pricey but that is what is to be expected from a strip restaurant.

O_UxiU3Lxu-DSdgSycTqpw.text: Amazing food. Great restaurant. Highly recommend the meatball over fried mozzarella & the watermelon ice martini. Exceptional service. So happy to have found a great restaurant!

JbMfKFfY__7XqRND5nusRg.text: First time visiting the one at Paris Casino and like the one at Rio Casino they never disappoint. I had the special: Rigatoni Bolognese and it was the best pasta dish I've had at any restaurant. My wife had the Chicken Parmigiano and she said it was the best she ever had. Of course started the meal the world's best tasting meatball.  The server Mike, the manager John and the cook was the most professional and beyond approach when it comes to service. The chef made my dinner twice cause he didn't like how the first one came out and you don't find that commitment to quality and detail like that anymore.  If you come to Vegas and miss this fine dining establishment then you are definitely missing out. Don't walk but run here for a fine dining experience.

1ZrUdRbaXJGuapgs3iW7Rw.text: My wife likes the Matarano story, bought the book, I kind of read a few parts. Great story, pretty good recipes, and was pretty excited to try the new place in the Paris. Went for lunch and was impressed by the trendy upscale decor..Had sports and a n old gangster movie on the t.v.s. I like both so cool. We ordered the bucatini carbonara and the bucatini meatball with red gravy, and truffle fries...both pasta dishes were pretty good. Carbonara had the white Parmesan sauce which was my favorite, other one was pretty solid with one good sized delicious meatball..good but $28 at lunch time good???not sure..Truffle fries were flavorful slash a.little salty..$80tab for lunch seems to make me not like it as much as I hoped..Maybe I'll return for dinner to give a fair review..Cool and friendly waiter was a plus..#yocuz Lower ur lunch prices..haha..
