QpQPwezcQyCSO2AEx5uVEA.text: Jeremy, the bartender, was awesome. The food was awesome. We'll definitely come back. A great experience while watching the Cubbies win!!

s8lKclC4wK_wSR8fQWNpuQ.text: First I'd like to say that the atmosphere is very relaxing and enjoyable. Sadly however, I can't say the same for the menu options and service. The menu lacks selection and customizability. I asked if the spicy sauce on a dish could be substituted and he said "no we don't customize orders." I then asked if their was another dish that included paste, with chicken, that is not spicy. He replied "no". I can't believe that they can't customize an order that costs upwards of $30 a dish. This establishment lacks quality and versatility that many younger individuals desire, due to this I would highly recommend overlooking this place and finding a more "family" oriented restaurant (save your money and time).

VtdLBnk2Rf-3GaIc9d2wsA.text: Excellent service and scrumptious food.  Meatball and salad was perfect appetizer.   Attentive service never let my water glass go below 3/4.  And the pasta.....yum!  We ordered the bugatini and it was cooked perfectly al dente.  When in Vegas , head to Paris casino and dine here

J5B1SFXkRhdY0KyUEc8Z_w.text: The only thing good about this restaurant was the food. Our waiter took our food order before even asking if we a wanted a drink. We were presented our "specials" on an iPad. Who wants to hear about a $52 piece of pork from an iPad picture. The place has sports playing on the flatscreens and disco balls hanging from the ceiling with waiters dressed as paper boys from the 40's. I have no idea what this restaurant is trying to be. Our waiter never came over to check on our meal and we were never asked if we wanted another drink. Our dessert was presented on an iPad. There's nothing 5 Star about this restaurant but the food.

F5f2ZAqg_HzUBzvW3KjeEA.text: All I can say is: terrible , really bad. A simple cafeteria food with a higher price. If you can avoid it do so. Not worth it.

_X4te-cFGwvQIR1kFsqB8Q.text: Came here solo (long story) while in town. Server Paul was charming and informed and made me feel welcome. Delicious food, fun music. Loved it and will be back!

Q0OSasnChuTIWZoF6HRbSA.text: Stay away. Large portions of mediocre food, and expensive. Staff nice but doesn't make up for the food.

WET6mmUjl2Jl5Vs5WElMLA.text: This place is great !   Came in and was greeted by hostess immediately, bar / restaurant had some old Blk/Wht movies playing.  My guest was super impressed with the light board menus. Manager came by the table during my meal to thank me for business.  Great vibes just like the spot in Frt. Lauderdale.  Your going to want to grab an order of Rice Balls, Truffle Fries, Clams Casino, Tagliatelli and a Veal Parmigiana and a glass of Barolo.  Thank me later.

d3Ji1AQPAK4DHJFtPJqr0Q.text: Really enjoyed dining here at the Paris hotel. I had the meatball salad and the carbonara pasta. My husband had a rigatoni special. Delightful martini choices. Canolli was okay. Pricing is excellent for the quality of food, Vegas experience and the name alone. We will definitely go back.

lMGZaTZDRFYFpGg1n4t76Q.text: Was looking for a place to eat in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. Didn't really want Italian but it smelt good from outside. So glad we decided to go in. We had Salad, Chicken Parmigiana and a Cannoli with chocolate chips. We shared this and had plenty of food. It was so good. It all tasted very fresh. I don't like cannoli's but this was the best I've ever tried. The service was very good as well.  I totally recommend eating here.

SEHZqUnQYZXHuGdjFiw2cg.text: Great Place , food is as good as Ft Lauderdale the original . Every dish is amazing  Dessert is amazing

bmkpiM7vhaAEJz_p5kkw9g.text: Food is so good here!! Great staff. Me and my wife had an awesome birthday meal thanks again to the chefs and front of the house. We will come back soon.

JyMs6qBP5C-XnTBvVH0uMA.text: Dined here with my boss on a Tuesday night approximately two months ago. Attention from all staff was wonderful, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was nice as well as we were seated outside. I had some sort of pasta (Can't remember the name but similar to the spaghetti and meat sauce) but it was one of their evening special plates, it was delicious! All ingredients were super fresh and the portion size was perfect.  The bread with oils, vinaigrette and spicy sauce was delicious as well.

7TLNmLFDe4txuoy-aLm-cw.text: Wonderful salad! So tangy and just perfect with a side of spaghetti. Service on point at the bar. Our bartender allowed us to taste a couple of wines...our favorite touch. Paris!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

42Ss9959eKO3PkPXGJfzjQ.text: Our server Paul is the man. He took the restaurant experience to the next level. When you get details about the history, about the mozzarella being made fresh daily, the can't miss meatballs, and his favorites...you are set up for success.   The caprese salad is bomb. Fresh mozzarella, tomato, crispy basil and aged balsamic. Yes. Get it. That was probably my favorite.   The meatball is 1 big meatball with a side of a tasty salad. Paul split the meatball for us and some salad, awaited our joy, and we let him know he was right - it's tasty. I wouldn't say the hype is THAT accurate, but it is a nice app. The salad it comes with is a little higher on vinegar which is a nice cut to the meatiness of the dish.   We also split the spaghetti pescatore - aka seafood spaghetti in a tomato sauce. The pasta here is cooked al dente (firm) and this is how I'm used to eating pasta so I was super happy about it. If you're used to a more cooked pasta, don't be shocked.   It was too much food. We were both like a package of crescent rolls - a second away from popping. If you're sharing, I'd recommend 1 app and 1 entree. Or 3 apps.   It's vegas, so somehow this wasn't weird, but they have a dj and disco ball scenario going on in the restaurant. It threw me off because the food quality and service is more upscale, and then you have club music in the background. It didn't detract for us just a talking point. Another, don't be surprised, thing.   I know I already preached about Paul, but I can't say enough good things about him. He's full of fun facts, is super likeable, and at the end you want to invite him to join your table.   Good food, great service, dinner for two around $120 (2 apps, 1 entree, 2 glasses of wine).

SlMp3bh_-ONnp8Ua0mT5LQ.text: Great service - loved the atmosphere and the food was incredible. We had Penne al a Vodka and Chicken Parm with sauteed greens. Both were outstanding! We will be back!

FcET71UHWHWyhXBOeWFWBg.text: The server did the best that he could given the restrictions of the menu and lack of substitutions (even with an allergy). The food is bland and overpriced. There are FAR better restaurants in Vegas to spend your money in.

KP6QKuJq4a7MGqEYkM_ruQ.text: I have to say have been to Vegas many times and always wanted to try this place when he had a joint at the Rio. Well he opened up between Ballys and Paris and I finally got my chance. Ate at bar as I was alone , outstanding. Chicken cutlet Parmagana was top shelf. Fresh mozzarella delicious ragu . Melted in my mouth. The meal was ala carte the bartender did ask me if I wanted a side I wasn't that hungry so I declined but I wish I would have. It was a late Saturday night  good music old movies playing Saturday night fever scenes ,rocky..I would recommend it . Some may not like the music  it was different.

MACNj4xdJhX6S2DwH4566Q.text: Paul was fantastic!!!!!  We felt entertained!!!  Food was wonderful and the watermelon martini was the best drink I have ever had!!! Great music too, we will definitely be back!!!!

BCTg9ZONXQ_tI5XKISEr6Q.text: I do not like rating places 5 stars because not too many things can be as goood as it gets.  But, this place is......As Good As It Gets.  The atmosphere is nice, the service great, and the food is incredible.  Yo Cuz Steve was there in person watching his crew cook up the food.  I lucked out at the seating because I could watch the events of the staff as I enjoyed the Company in my party.  The eggplant stack appetizer was pretty darn good.  The speghetti pescatori was outstanding.    The prices were not cheap but not out of this world like some of the other nearby places.  If you pay decent money, you want decent food and this was the case here.  Steve was especially busy during our time here because NFL Quarterback, Joe Montana was dining a few tables over.  But he took the time to come over and talk to us.  This was really special to one of us in our party as he is a frequent diner at his Atlantic City location.  He is one huge dude and takes his craft seriously.  It was nice meeting him.  I would highly recommend this place.  I will be back!

3s9pmmK4Hpx3Zw7KMetD5A.text: Great place! The food was fantastic. We ordered the meatball bucatini with the ricotta cheese. Ray was our waiter and he was on point with everything. Very professional and friendly. I would strongly recommend this place!

Gn_hNQ80r-bBNLOt0JuCJA.text: The service was terrible (the waiter ignored that I wanted tap water and "upsold" a huge bottle of flat, even though I was dining alone... $7.50).  He neglected to bring me a second glass of wine.  I had the 'special' of lasagna, the sauce had zero flavor (and they were very stingy with it), the sausage/meat mix was terrible, chunks of spice and then chunks of zero flavor.  The homemade mozzarella was good, but definitely didn't make the dish worth the $36 price tag. If you are looking for excellent Italian in Vegas, keep walking.

Pux9T0ijzrgw4JUteQPjzg.text: Save your money... Terrible food and what a joke... who upsells you at what is supposed to be such an upscale restraunt. Total joke... but sadly it was on us.

7iC8UKzoswFXg-Ye2nFhMA.text: My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by just how fresh and good the food was. We normally go outside of whatever hotel we staying in but very glad we checked this place out for dinner before our show.   The portions are quite generous, enough to share. My husband had already eaten a heavy snack just an hour before our arrival.  Even though I'm an eater, I really needed his help with the Parmesan chicken, mozzarella & tomatoes and sauteed spinach. Our server Luis was excellent. Will definitely return here for dinner next time we're in Vegas.

QJFrr4v5H0DKDlmHfHHMiQ.text: Mozzarella was excellent!! Spaghetti al pomodoro was a work of art !!! Beautiful!!! Affordable pricing with quality products

3cfIRIHW4kfaAQqF1SUK_g.text: Classic American Italian made to perfection. It seems like it all starts with the ingredients here; the house made mozzarella and ricotta were delicious. You can absolutely taste the difference in these dishes compared to any other Italian food you're used to. We started with the shrimp scampi appetizer that out server plated for the two of us to split. The scampi sauce was awesome. I got the bucatini and meatballs and enjoyed every aspect of the dish. The "gravy" was simple and delicious, perfect al dents pasta, extremely flavorful meatball, and the final perfect element: that dollop of ricotta.  Aside from the food, the service and atmosphere were also worth the 5 stars! Our server was super attentive, excited to tell us about the food, answer any questions and made a great wine recommendation. (It was their brand that they sell at the restaurants and online which we'll be ordering very soon!). We loved the fun super club atmosphere and you go in looking forward to enjoying this unique fun experience.  My only tip for them would be to make sure the hours are advertised consistently. I went to check out some other yelp reviews while we were dining and noticed it said the location was closed. Spread the word that it's open late & has awesome late night full dinner service!  Will recommend to friends that visit Vegas and return to this spot when I'm back!

8Ca4ect-Mqe588uUKohs6Q.text: First, I probably would never return because of the level of noise from the music.  We could not hear each other talk.  And as the night got longer the music got louder.  That is all part of the atmosphere we were told.  They do a great job of pulling off a Philly-style place, but we did not enjoy that. The food-ourparty split the meatball and salad, and the eggplant salad.  Both were wonderful, along with the warm bread.  I could have stopped there and been satisfied, but order a special for the night entree-a short rib dish-disappointed,  the flavor was not good, pasta was bland, and all was too salty.  My husband had a special-seafood dish, loved it. Others liked their choices.  My monitor was great. Service seemed good because when the staff was at our table they were attentive, but when we wanted the check and when my food came a couple minutes after the others the service was slow.  Sorry to say the music level ruined it all.

kGlN7yxyKYBSoCwiZ7ny8w.text: I stopped by this place with my girlfriend as we wandered through Paris. The food was great but the service was phenomenal.   We had the shrimp bibsy special (shrimp with a sweet and slightly spicy caramelized coating), the chicken parmesan,  the gnocci, and dessert.  My favorite was easily the shrimp and I am definitely coming back at some point for more.   The service was top notch from start to finish.  I was surprised every time i needed something it was already there before i could even think to ask.  It was truly amazing.

MaZ77S-tLj9XR6ODDrvKmQ.text: Great service, very friendly staff, intimate ambience. Food was so delicious. I got the shrimp bizby and it was to die for. Perfectly seasoned and cooked, not rubbery or bland at all. The next dish was the meatball and fried mozzarella...again, perfectly seasoned and cooked. I tried some martinis and they were not weak at all. Wide selection of beer and liquor. It was very cozy and romantic, yet somehow it was lively with music and people - perfect balance! I went two nights in a row during my stay at the Paris and it will certainly be my go to place when I'm in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

adppUdVcYuavmj0o3EYmYA.text: I reserved my table as Albus Purcival Wulfric Brian Dumbledor and the hostess totally got it.  That made me happy. Great food. I had the meatball. I put that salty ball in my mouth and I was beside myself with satisfaction.

44qb39mPOSQRBoE42jG2-g.text: Definitely one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had and the food was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The staff was excellent! We started on night off with the meatball salad and egg plant stack which both were so delicious. The meatball had such and amazing flavor and the egg plant was cooked perfectly. Then for our Entree we had the carbonara and I must say it was fantastic! I highly recommend visiting this place. If you don't mind spending money on delicious food this should definitely be the go to spot!

KX1m2nveffDDtM0ysIYb1w.text: Get the calamari. It's sooooo fresh and soft. You can cut them in half with a fork they are so soft. We are mostly used to frozen calamari so having fresh calamari is night and day. I would come back just for the spicy calamari. The staff is so professional and attentive. The atmosphere is great with people walking by gawking at the beautiful plates presented from this restaurant. There is a 3 course meal for 50$ or look to spend about 60-80$ per person for dinner, appetizer, sides and drinks. Also try the mini ice cream cone sampler for desert. Is casual wear for men and women but I saw people in shorts at dinner time.

xZIeWuZP3jmoGx1yPPCpjg.text: Was just average food.  I expected it to be much more authentic , so therefore I was somewhat disappointed. The service was above average and my server did seem to understand my dislike to the food. Very apologetic and did try to get me to order something else, but by then I had lost my appetite. I don't think I'll be returning.

Pi22SxCTuUrekeCxSe7ltg.text: I came here a few weeks ago for a some appetizers and a drink. The bread and chili oil was a really nice start with the Martini that I had. The meatball was flavorful and tender, I would definitely come here again to try one of the entrees.

vxHDSoU7g0yGF5-_Jq6OFQ.text: I had dinner at the bar last night. I had chicken Sicilian and it was delicious. In my view, it was a large serving. I did noticed that the couple next to me ordered appetizers,  the appetizers seemed exquisite. It is pricey, but the quality of the food is well worth it. Exceptional service from everybody.

i2dLQzcpeVzdgmrixZDTsQ.text: Awesome food and great service. This is a must if you're in vegas!! The meatballs are truly famous. Our waiter Brandan was simply the best.

WVRno42bIXP_tKOJltrr7g.text: Restaurant was very nice although they play old gangster movies on several tvs throughout which makes it hard to pay full attention to the table... Service was top notch and food was delicious. Had the meatball to start and shared the rigatoni and the chicken parmigiana. The chicken was huge and tender but a bit too much cheese on top. Everything was going great until approx 9:15pm the music went from Sinatra style dinner music to blaring R&B and disco. It was quite strange and took away from the ambiance and the meal. The music was loud and awkward and with poor transitions. Great food and great service - just go before the 9pm discotheque starts!

0xUyf9nKPspyq32xB5iPng.text: Incredible menu, fabulous service, and a Sunday Gravy worth a second helping. We'll be back for sure.

Khdg_NmC3bw7rLqutJVzSQ.text: The best damn Italian I've had since I was back on the Least Coast!! Service was excellent - the Veal and the Pasta (Bolognese of the day) and Salads were simply delicious and just perfecto. Multo Beni boys!! We will be back whenever we can. In Vegas Italiano is a must and this may be the very best in town.

cyzFnhVHsaNDBz45Ug0ALA.text: My husband and I stopped by Martorano's this evening before going to see Garth Brooks in Las Vegas at the T-Mobile Arena.  We started off with the fried mozzarella appetizer which was the best appetizer we have ever had!   Then we split the Carbonara and it was also delicious!  Our server, Chris was very knowlegable and personable!  Overall, an excellent meal and we will return!

wN6-dX8Qa3gLwKMTXHm_mw.text: Very surprised by the 3 star rating. My wife and I give it 5 stars!   Everything was delicious,  from the meatball salad appetizer  to the chicken parmigiano.  My wife had the special California  sea bass with lump crab. Setting was perfect and service was superb!

bKqMVoS1PVBb3dGlsJJ9HA.text: Delish!!! Top notch service and food. The meatball is to die for and can't complain about the chicken parmigiana, calamari or gnocchi either.

eKJfzzQMILoNOLIhqTZhgQ.text: Amazing Food, Service and Atmosphere. I can not express how good the food is. The Famous Meatball with gravy and ricotta cheese is awesome. Chicken Sicilian is delicious couldn't eat enough. The Tagliatelle Beef and Veal Bolognese is pasta to perfection. Waiter Jason aka "Showtime" is the best. Great service and friendly staff. Overall awesome evening... And the DJ was on point and the dance floor was on fire. Thanks Martorano's for a great night.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Food and Great Service!

M1qTAZhbMz-QhTHuoXY8iw.text: Outstanding meal. Venue is fun and different. Had the fried mozzarella with a home made meatball on top. Fried mozz was definitely the best I've ever had. Meatball and sauce were the bomb! Linguine and clams for my dinner- simply amazing! This is one of my favorite dishes and it was outstanding. My husband had the chicken parm with a side of gnocchi. All phenom. Would definitely recommend! #YoCuz

jQWeRG-evS9o5m6VW8cylg.text: This place looks fantastic! The service once they get to you it's very good. Definitely not worth the hype. I would almost rather go to Olive Garden. There is not a single thing here that I was impressed with except the meatball salad. It is enough for two people to share and has great taste! Had the chicken parmesan and was definitely not impressed. They brought out the wrong order at first and they made it right but by the time they came back I was so full on bread it did not matter that they brought me new food period was not able to eat it anyways. Had a few bites and it was okay period then packed it and gave it away to the homeless. Martorano's you guys really need to step it up. The appetizers came out at the same time as the entrees. They sat us very quickly but the waiter took 20 minutes to come say hello. Once we started eating we realized something was not right and it took them an additional 20 minutes to come but that was only because we waved them down. I think you guys have a great place on your hands, a few tweaks would bake it so fantastic

Im29XZuA8JB0Ctp8N8rzuQ.text: PHENOMENAL, I had the Chilean Seabass and I was with party of four, the rest had the stacked eggplant, (not a fan of the eggplant) but it looked good. The place is like a club as well; music were 70s-90s dance hits. Great music great food, great everything. Clean, Well explained about food and beverages, Well organized. I will be going back for sure!

nvnCRi7JmXNInclKluT0gg.text: I will never go back to this restaurant.  The owners motto is, "Don't bust my balls"!  Seriously.  That is this guys motto.  In other words don't ask for anything other than exactly what is on the menu.  And frankly, the food was very mediocre for the price.  Service was average.  But as soon as you ask for anything not exactly as it is on the  menu, "NO!" comes out of their mouths faster than breath.  For your money, there are much better alternatives where the owner doesn't have, "Don't bust my balls" as his motto.

Pa8umzFyrArtOTneSLwILA.text: My husband & I and cousins just had dinner here.  It was the worst experience we have ever had.  I'm a vegetarian and I ended up eating a salad, bread & glass of wine for my meal. The only thing that the chief would do is make me pasta w olive oil and garlic.  No vegs nothing.  My cousins wife had chicken marselo and the chicken was tough as can be. She also wanted her salad with the dressing on the side and the chief won't do it. Then on top of all of this we ordered cannolies for dessert for cousins bday and out comes a giant bug crawling over our table. Will never go back here ever!!!

DpGzFMcLptJnF9HdFEm5qw.text: Our family had dinner at Martorano's in April, 2015. Most of the entrees were in the $25-$35 range. Two of my sisters ordered the special which was grouper. They both enjoyed it till they received their bill - $62 each! I realize they should have asked the price, but still, I think the waiter could have given them a clue.

4_ZmiEyU9mG5qyg-Egm16g.text: Raymond was awesome!!! Really good food and service! I got the carbonara mhhhhm goooood!

E6MiBosPBSyXsaLmEba2sA.text: Worst Service Ever. I was with 3 friends and we decided to check this place out.  We were thinking we would have drinks and maybe see.  When we didn't order food right away the waiter obviously got upset.  Suddenly the manager was there asking if we were going to be eating.  We said we just wanted a drink we thought.  He told us the tables were reserved for people who were going to eat.  I looked around and there was maybe 2 or 3 other tables with people at them.  One of my friends began to protest but I was just in such shock I said let's go.  The manager said he was sorry.  No he wasn't.  Don't be rude AND lie to me.  We went to the French restaurant in the Paris and had a wonderful meal and spent over $200.  The service was wonderful.  Martorano's is not friendly.  The food may be good but I'll never get to find out because I was asked to leave.

Lxg5hw9UfAh0J8L9g8LUAg.text: Seriously delicious. If you're in the area and hungry for an awesome Italian meal, definitely check out Martorano's new location on the Strip!

JSg8H8to0wiLJW5MlqWqEw.text: I read some of the other reviews and I cannot speak on the ambiance in the main dining room as we sat out in the patio area. I will however speak on the food.  I took a client here for dinner on a Thursday night before a night out. We ordered a bottle of wine and the calamari to start. The service was excellent, the wine was presented well, and the calamari was out of this world (I'm a bit of a calamari snob). I then ordered the Chicken Sicilian. I'll make this short...this is probably the best Italian food I have ever had and I used to manage an Italian restaurant. My client was also very satisfied as we were talking about how good dinner was for the rest of the night.  Again, I didn't experience the atmosphere of the main dining room which, from reading other reviews I could see as being kind of cheesy. But if you are just looking for great food, go here and sit out in the "patio" area, which is in front of the restaurant out in the main hallways of the Paris Casino.

NI5efzuCgR1Mjn_ndJaooQ.text: I was a little reserved about eating here based on the dollar signs and the rating of the restaurant, but we didn't have much time to go anywhere before we had to run to catch our flight. We arrived at 5:30 and got seated immediately. We explained to our waiter we had a flight to catch and only had 40-45 mins for dinner. He quickly went through the menu and gave us some great recommendations. He was very attentive the whole time and kept us on schedule. My friend ordered the pork chop with a side of angel hair pasta and I had the braised short rib bolognese. Oh my...my short rib was divine!! The meat was tender and you could tell it was simmered for a while in the sauce, because it was juicy every bite. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the wine was delicious. My friend enjoyed her pork chop. I had a small bite and it was too spicy for me. The waiter was right, it's perfect for those that like their meals with a spicy kick. It was tender and very flavorful! Served on a bed of spinach and peppers. By far one of the shortest and best meals I have had in Vegas. Staff is great and the food was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5IQ3X0ECYX4yARvqzyAsog.text: Words cannot express the wonderful experience we had on Valentines Day Weekend ! The ambience is modern, fun and upscale. Our evening started at the bar with a few old fashions and ice martinis. We were then seated with our fantastic server Yuri! He is hands down the absolute best service we have ever had. His knowledge of the menu made the entire experience! From the meatball salad to the lasagna and lastly the waffle ice cream sandwich ! Absolutely divine! We unfortunately are not locals but visit Las Vegas and Ft Lauderdale often. After tonight we will ALWAYS make time for some "gravy !" #YoCuz

Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Ice Cream Sandwhich

FVKfe9ad569038E8D6d5Hw.text: Best Italian I have experienced. Not only is the food amazing full depth flavor but excellent customer service. Thank you Martozano's for the tremendous experience. Our host Bryce shared the culture and details on our favorite dishes and Truely gave us the top notch the entire evening.

ogam3ICWYwAEuoXsJWB3LQ.text: My absolute favorite restaurant. Never disappoints. I come every time I'm in Vegas or Atlantic City.

1_cq93PbIyA3C1F3eNgM-Q.text: 1st time at this restaurant and hopefully not the last. The food was good as was the service. The Decor was pretty. Ordered the carbonara and was  pleasantly surprised with the egg yolk that was broken table side as I've never had it done like that. Overall the experience was good and I left satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara

uRqZvbcMpz92xh8XUOPA-Q.text: The experience was fantastic! Food was delicious and presentation is an added bonus. Not to mention that the service was phenomenal and so friendly. The atmosphere  is comfortable and enjoyable definitely a must when in town

0HIDeFT4DZu_wUL8T-9DqQ.text: Cool and fresh spin on an Italian restaurant. Located inside Paris Las Vegas, nearly between the Paris and Bally's casino floors.  This dinner spot is popular and busy! We lucked out with bar seating for our group of 4 around 645pm.   Our bartender and server was friendly, attentive and informative.   Started with the Angel cocktail. A sweet option.  Ordered the Chicken Cutlet Parmigiano. Delivered hot and fresh. Great seasoning and texture on the breading.   Menu is high end. Average entree is $40.  Best to call ahead or reserve a table in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cutlet Parmigiano
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angel
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool disco ball decor.

jSyvsmyIzFs4I0-tpHi2Wg.text: Incredible! Food is a 10, experience is a 15! Paul was our server, every single item he suggested we order was delicious! He made our experience at this restaurant so memorable. Even my 92 year old grandma was impressed ! We can not wait to come back!!! And the cheesecake is a must have for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream cones
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VrUq9pkeWH2eL15uPcFiuQ.text: The staff was kind and friendly upon walk up. They went above and beyond to accommodate our tight schedule and show times. We order apps at their suggest for a quick turn over. The eggplant stack melted in my mouth! The calamari was the best I have ever had. Not too sweet and wasn't chewy at all! Like the best!  My husband got philly and it was very hardy and meaty. Everything was hot and we really enjoyed the food. The bartender Andrew made great drinks and had us to-go cups and our check without even asking. It literally shifted our entire night! Special shout out to Ben, the manager on duty who made this experience 5 Star. We will eat here again!

aTMFauTp6wIrAhSL0N_PYg.text: Yo cuz!!!! Food was excellent!!! Just as I expected it would be . So why one star ? Overall it was not a great dining experience. We requested that we would like to do appetizers, then the pasta special and then entrees. 3 courses  to enjoy with our bottles of wine . We were told NO !! Not allowed!!!! 2 courses only only !!! What!!??  Also no salt and pepper on the tables or even offered with a pepper mill . No cheese offered with our pasta entrees . And overall the waiter was was not attentive.  Also based on Florida location we expected a fun music experience. NO !!! Music only on Friday and Saturday. !!!  Next time in Vegas we will not be returning ..

FUZoWgs19T8IzbKHxYkyNw.text: Small sample size as I'm a party of one who got one dish but... I'm a super judgmental diner who grew up in New Jersey and is almost always disappointed in traditional Italian food. I had the Bucatini with a meatball. The pasta was cooked perfectly (and seasoned right) and the meatball was top notch. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jaTKgvI6qz4J4oq69-9rJQ.text: My daughter and I visited the Martorano's at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas and by the end of our meal, we were already planning our next visit.  Everything about this restaurant is top notch.  From the moment we walked in and were greeted by the friendly hostess, we began our incredible dining experience.  We ordered the mozzarella and tomato stack to start and it was perfect.  The mozzarella had a lovely consistency and the tomatoes were delicious. Each bite just melted in my mouth.  We both ordered the linguine in white  clam sauce and we were so glad we did.  The dish was unbelievable.  The best linguine and clams we have ever had.  Lastly, we ordered the key lime cheesecake baked by Marsha Martorano.  It was absolutely exquisite and we savored every bite.  The best part of the evening was that we were able to meet Steve and Marsha Martorano in person as they were in the restaurant.  They are an amazing couple with incredible energy.   We loved every minute of our dining experience and wished we lived closer so we could visit more often.

pf5x2ecW90cZVTwZdsh1tQ.text: Everything we had was top notch. Our waitress was excellent and helped me decide between 2 meals. The food was fresh, homemade and some of the best Italian food I've ever had. I would highly recommend this restaurant and will make this a regular.

1aeH3RBipWVDawh0EoJaqw.text: Fantastic service, but the food was SO OVER PRICED and while we never balked when we checked out the menu in advance, after tasting the food- it is not at all worth what they charge.  Hubs had the Pigs Feet and said it was good, but I ordered the Caesar salad ($14) and it was soggy and drowning in Parmesan cheese. Now, don't get me wrong, I ordered the Parmesan chicken, I do like Parmesan- but the salad was DROWNING in it.  To their credit, the waiter was incredibly gracious and immediately took it off the bill and offered me an alternative option, but it was disappointing.  The Chicken Parm is just chicken parm -not fancy or special ($28) and you have to pay extra for a side of pasta pomadoro to accompany it.  We loved the location- in the walk way between Paris and Bally, great view and people watching, and the DJ played fantastic music. So atmosphere is a big plus. But overall, just MEH! Not somewhere I would enthusiastically recommend and not somewhere I am eager to bother with again.

F5AWNJx7noVmEe_9RAalpA.text: Very difficult to dine here cuz the owner doesn't allow ANY changes to the menu.......this goes as far as leaving oil off an item. Getting a bowl of pasta to my liking was IMPOSSIBLE, even though prices are very high. Our entire party left and EASILY found other GREAT restaurants to accommodate us. Owner is quite arrogant!

3DliJ8vQIr1XyFJrWd7trw.text: Well well well... I have no idea how people can eat this firm noodles . We complained that noodles but they said it is normal way to they cooked. We just take away that dish. Also food took too too long to the table more than 25mins.    Service was very great. But foods were not good.  Disponited.

VOXnQvvwYIeuFW0EMjJ_2A.text: Ohhhhh man, I don't even know where to start with this delicious experience! My best friend and her family make it a tradition to come to Martorano's every time they are in Vegas and this time, I was the lucky guest that got to learn WHY they love this place so much! I'm not sure why they only have 3.5 stars because I thought it was absolutely incredible from beginning to end and left the most full that i've ever been. HIGHLIGHT: The menus LIGHT UP so that you can see what you're reading! I've never seen this before and it is such a cool concept! :)   We ordered a delicious bottle of Malbec to start, and enjoyed it along with their family-style apps {that they dish up for you!} and soft and airy bread with parm and dipping oils. For the appetizers, we ordered their famous Meatball & Salad {a MUST! I could probably eat this for my meal}, the Eggplant Stacked made with house made mozzarella {ANOTHER MUST}, and the calamari. We were honestly full after these apps but then the REAL meal came! I ordered the Chicken Sicilian and it was so delicious. Chicken tenders, mushrooms, capers, and hot cherry peppers. Warning, it does have a kick but I love that! The entrees do not come with a side but I ordered a side of spaghetti so that I could taste their famous marinara sauce. The entrees are HUGE and if you order apps, I highly recommend splitting them. I also tried my friend's Veal Piccata and that was delish too!   All in all, a VERY great experience. Pro Tips: Order an app or two, share entrees and a few sides. This place is pricey and you don't want to be left with a ton of extra food like we were because when you're on vacation, leftovers go to waste! :)

uE6bocrOr52qi09PjOihwA.text: Unfortunately, I went in to Martorano's with high expectations and left underwhelmed. Aesthetically, it's a beautiful restaurant in a good location. The menu lighting up once you open it is a cool feature, the ipad with drink menu was interesting and unexpected, but the food was mediocre and not what I was expecting.  My friend ordered the Fusilli Pollo, and I got the Penne (w/out meat), with a cocktail and mule. The drinks were basic, and the food lacked flavor. With an upscale restaurant, I wasn't expecting large portions, but I was expecting a tasty meal but it was nowhere to be found. Music was loud (which was fine, that honestly didn't bother me but if you're going on a weekend night and are sound sensitive or want to hear your date, give this place a pass) and service seemed a bit hard to come by.  Our waiter was friendly, and polite when he came by. We did watch 2 different people with to go orders, and 1 lady who wanted to place an order, go to the bar and have to wait an excruciatingly long time before someone noticed them or said something to them. It was made even more excruciatingly long since there was a man in a suit directly in front of them (behind the bar) who was serving up 4 different glasses of wine to another member of staff (waiter, by what they were wearing.) Like at least tell the people 'hold on, someone will be right with you' but they were too absorbed in trying out these wines to even bother. It looked bad, and tainted the experience more. (Also, I'm not sure what the standard here is for drinking while working or while in your work attire, but maybe take it somewhere that *isn't* the dining room? In direct site of literally everyone in the restaurant? It looks tacky.)   All in all, it was very expensive (which we were expecting, and were okay with) but the dinner did not meet our expectations, nor did the experience.

uN0U0lNUYxqq1W5OxuXuIA.text: Straight to the point.   Food- Tasty, full of flavor.   Portions-Good size. Took home 2 Togo boxes.   Atmosphere- Casual, nights don't recommend the older crowd it gets loud with a DJ my parents didn't enjoy it.   Service-Fast. Only drawback was we didn't get water refills and when we wanted the check the waiter was mia for a hot min.

P0BBVbw1XALzWMoA_4eoeQ.text: I've eaten here many times. Excellent food and service. Very nice decor.  One of the better restaurants in La

rXp4XefAt9SZto9zwCCTxA.text: Fantastic great food and obviously the message not to break his balls about his cooking applies. Great service great wine list. Just a pleasant meal all the way around.

gd4yEO027anwslK13HCSEA.text: We had a party of 6 last Saturday night and I ordered the lasagna special the waiter was quick to note that they do not have the special available they were out what Italian restaurant on a Saturday night on the strip runs out of lasagna at 7:30 so I ended up ordering penne alla vodka dish and I asked to substitute for a different pasta he said he would check got back to me said no they do not do that . You would think they would help me out since the lasagna was already out.So when the dish came it was not penne alla vodka wasn't even close wasn't even edible the waiter was more than accommodating to exchange it but by this time I lost my appetite I managed to call the manager over and and  asked him what restaurant at your caliber runs out of lasagna on a Saturday night at 7:30 he said he only makes 15 pieces of lasagna per night the restaurant holds 125 and if you have two or three turnovers that's a lot of people I asked him why he cannot do substitutes on pasta he said that's their policy .At the end of our meal the waiter said he took my dish off the bill like he was doing ME a favor that is horrible customer service every time I go there I have a fantastic time but this time it left a bad taste in my mouth probably the alla vodka hard to say if I will return

CJqbyEEUH9dojgwBgrfvQw.text: The bucatini  pasta  with a meatball was phenomenal.  Truly  a great dining experience  coupled with a fine wine list. Service could have been a tiny bit better but food was  outstanding.

PqHASFnoX66RE2sZSZN0rg.text: This is located in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. The atmosphere and the servers are great. But the pasta and seafood dish I had was very spicy. I didn't enjoy it nor did I finish it. Also shouldn't they be playing French music rather than American pop? I enjoyed the Malbec wine.

QScPlvFf97j-7NhSJrdKLw.text: Ordered prime rib sandwich and it was good. Meat was juicy and tender and the hoggie was fresh and it came with au juice.

4_1lpBgAERSgaXlQLl2hHA.text: Hands down the best meal I've had in Vegas in my life. I not only love this place but I've been here 8 times. Everything was perfect. Literally. From the amazing food to the amazing service to the amazing bar to the amazing prices to the amazing location. I can't say enough about this meal! One love cuz, one love.

JqDzn98bBLGJKhhbZwOUQg.text: I must have to say. If you love Italian food this is not the place for you. Husband and I went here last night for our Vday dinner.  One it was not packed and hostess sat us near the outside of the restaurant as if the place was packed inside and that was the only choice. Mind you they knew my husband is a Diamond member. After sitting there and no one offering us any drinks or anything. Finally after 15mins the waiter saw I was upset and I asked him to move us so we can enjoy the restaurant vibe. Then after being moved inside. 3 mgrs standing there doing nothing bug chatting and waiters as well. Just as we were about to leave waiter finally comes over and offers us a drink menu.  So faster forwarding to our meal.  We ordered the meatball salad. It was decent. Wasn't dry but nothing great. I ordered penne vodka and husband ordered the chicken parm. My husband is italian from Brooklyn NY. He judges any italian resturant by your chicken parm. We get our food. Husband looks at his plate and asked the waiter where is the gravy(sauce). Waiter says its under the mozzarella. Husband looks under was like what italian eats dry chicken parm. Waiter brings over a tiny side of gravy and husband again says. Chicken parm is suppose to have alot of gravy. Waiter says we can give you a side of gravy but have to charge you. At this point husband just wanted to eat. So he agreed. Get to my penne vodka. TERRIBLE! Penne vodka is my all time fav and growing up with italians back home in NY. This place should be ashamed to call themselves a authentic italian resturant. My pasta was hard the sauce was filled with onions and garlic.  After a while. The manager comes over and asks how's it going. Husnand states about the Chicken parm. Manager says we serve chicken parm dry like that, just a little sauce under the mozzarella. Husband looked at him and couldn't believe that came out his mouth!  After all said and done. I left very hungry and with an upset stomach just for eating some of the hard pasta. So if you really want a good italian resturant. I suggest Pasta Mia across from the Palms, it's not on the strip per say but if you want some good italian good this is your place. Its authentic and delicious! Oh and very afforable!

83tIHvAOPx4t02QSu8n_8g.text: Best pasta I have ever eaten at a restaurant. I had the Bucatini Carbonara. It was rich, but flavorful and addicting. My gf doesn't even like pasta, but she was impressed with the bite I made her try. I highly recommend this dish and this restaurant. The service was on point. Our server was very professional. The drinks were fantastic too. Lemon drops. The appetizers we had were the Eggplant Stacked and a meatball and cheese appetizer I can't recall the exact name. Both dishes were fantastic. I would recommend the Eggplant Stack. Trust me... Overall I had a great experience. I will be a returning customer.   PS: they have a strict no altering dishes rule. If you're the type that likes to modify your dishes you will not like this place. That being said, I wouldn't change a thing ;)

4zypbaIC4E_gdxdv7M9HmQ.text: Horrid atmosphere, amazing food!  I have never found a restaurant that I loved and hated so much at the same time.  This is an example of a Las Vegas vanity restaurant with an 'experience' I would avoid at all costs but food that begs me to come back for more.  We were seated inside of the restaurant late in the evening, exactly at the time we reserved our table.  The staff were friendly, attentive and professional.  The service staff had spot on recommendations for drinks and appetizers. Stars all around for everyone.  Inside the restaurant was clouded with vanity pictures of chef Martorano in poses that show him as the 'Boss' he apparently is.  Music from the 90s was being pumped through speakers so loud the servers had to shout the specials and signature drinks, and even that was not good enough to hear anything they said.   Much worse, a string of scenes from Martorano's favorite films were loudly played on TV screens throughout.  Scarface, Rocky 3 & 4, and an old Steve Martin film were forced down our throats as we tried to enjoy delicious cocktails.  Why the TV's?  I felt like we were at home watching bad cable.  The food, however, oh the food!  Are you kidding me?  We ordered four items from the regular menu and specials, and everything was just amazing.  Super fresh, top of the line meat, seafood and pasta.  The standout was a sea bass special, absolutely melt in your mouth perfection.  The pasta was perfectly prepared, just as promised on the menu.  Martorano's is loud, loud, loud, so go for great dining with somebody you don't want to talk with.

IhUa06ow89XPDAtzidVS5w.text: We ate here while showing a friend around the Paris Hotel and we thought we'd be in for some incredible food after hearing all the waiter had to tell us. We were prepared to be blown away by amazing food. It fell short. I like my pasta al dente but this was just too undercooked almost to the point of being crunchy. The sauce was just ok and so was the meatball. The ricotta was really good. The guys that ordered the veal and chicken parm didn't have any gripes but weren't blown away either. I think if you set people up for greatness as the staff does, then you should deliver. That didn't happen. The mozzarella appetizer was good but not over the top delicious as promised. It was just eh....  I come from a long line of great Italian cooks, especially my Dad, and this stuff just can't touch any of their stuff.

jWQob5mOCnMWESw-g8EQWA.text: Awesome food and Sunday Gravy!!!  Meatballs are the bomb.... Yo Cuz!!! A must when in Vegas!

From Jeff the host who was helpful and friendly on the phone, to the hostesses when we arrived.... the bartender was spot on with drinks....Paul our server was on top of his game and he handled us RI gals pretty well lol the gentleman helping Paul was so nice as well.....food was delicious and will highly recommend!! gTHJDsMa4hQ39Fo1rT6cWg.text: Firs time there had the best veal parmigiana ever. Second time there had the worst veal parmigiana. They need to have consistency with their chefs   So disappointing will not be back.

6ZkEhLUvRaMuD8Fuy83bYA.text: My boyfriend and I went there a couple of weeks ago during our stay in Vegas.  I have nothing but great things to say about this place!  First off, WOW on the food!!! LYhOuAWLFPX_UjBdIbHJfA.text: " FAST FOOD IN PARIS"  Guest of this establishment during V day 2016. Was excited to spoil my gf to fine dinning VEGAS-STYLE.  What we experienced instead was fast food fine dinning at it's best. It took more than a few minutes for our waiter to introduce himself and serve water.   We ordered philly steak sandwich and Shrimp spaghetti. As expected from menu we were asked to be patient for food, as it was "made to order".  We received what I felt was market prepared bread everyone boasts about.    After more than 20min when the food finally arrived I was pissed!!!  The philly sandwhich ($18.00) looked like a complete mess.  I felt that it was purchased from Costco frozen food sandwhich.  The spaghetti was warm-cold not hot as I expected from a freshly prepared entree.  Shrimp was prepared perfectly, wild caught.  The calamari was a F'n JOKE!  It was frozen.....Yo Cuz!  You fed me a frozen entree??????  When it came time to pay this establishment inquired about my experience.  I gave them a "D" rating simple fact that it was terrible!  I gave this establishment 2 stars for two reasons; Incredible ambiance & MGR inquiring about our experience prior to completion of our meal.  I will not be returning.....

0wUvnC8kH_O9fkmix0ehjw.text: my wife and i have eaten at martaranos for years...and we keep going back....its simply the best italian food in las vegas... we ate at martaranos on 5/18/17 for my wifes birthday.....our waiters raymond and juanito were excellent....top service...always checking to make sure that everything was alright.....the food was superb...i am of italian heritage....my whole family is from italy....and i can verify to you that martaranos food is 100% authentic italian food.. they use the finest ingredients...and there recipes are right on the money...the restaurant itself is beautiful....well decorated...the manager mike was very cordial...making sure that our dining experience was total satisfaction...then to top it off i found out that martaranos takes off 20% from your total bill including liquor, for all local residents....awesome way to end the evening....i highly recommend to anyone that wants excellent italian food, to try martaranos...you won't be sorry......its phenomenal.......

TgIbAW8TdA3BG2lVlxSBiw.text: Food was just ok service was bad. Ordered calamari was tough. For the prices they charge would not go back. Nothing worth shouting about. Water was always empty. They can't service the whole table at one time bring out food when done each plate what a scam

kzioEl_VBSw2NCqmbYTi7Q.text: I gave it two stars for the food. When we got seated, we got the iPad with the drinks. The waiter then gives us a spiel about the owner, food served family style, so if one dish is ready and the others are not, you must serve that dish and wait for the other dish to come out. If your other party doesn't want the dish you ordered, they sit and wait...and wait. They brought the appetizer, after yet another bus boy had brought the wrong dish, and we said we were splitting it. The assistant said he would be back to serve it to us. We waited   and waited while he went to get plates. Then waited some more. Finally he came with some plates.  THREE times the "assistants/bus boys" brought us the wrong meal to the table. They gave our food to the table next to us. They did let us keep one misplaced dish, but only after our waiter finally showed up and I told him we didn't order this. He said "yeah, the other table got your food" so we had to wait again for the food that we ordered. Since there was only two of us, the waiter was doting on the other table with four people. Bigger tip, I assumed. I ordered ice tea, and got a bottle of Chinese tea and a glass of ice. I guess they have various favors of bottled Chinese tea. Once the correct food finally arrived, it was ok. I've had better, but it was adequate. Will I go back? NO. No excuse for a restaurant that has been open for 6 months for the service. If this chef is so great, I suggest he hire a manager who knows how to staff a restaurant. The service was absolutely terrible and totally disorganized, and we were there on a night that it wasn't busy at all. I shudder to think what happens when that restaurant gets busy. My suggestion, go to Buddy V's at the Palazzo for good service and good food and walk past Martoranos at the Paris Hotel.

Kx7mser7xYfu1FAygoTXng.text: appetizers were really good! meatball salad & mozarella stack. entrees were salty as all hell... cut back on the sodium, cuz!

VdvbWmrJqvweSs5XLiBo-A.text: STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!  This place will not last long.  The servers act like frightened dogs.  The management is argumentative.  Your soda comes in a plastic bottle.  The music is so loud it could make a Slipknot fan complain about auditory pain after dining there.  The server tries to force you to order your entree at the same time as your appetizers and when confronted as to why you need to order our entree right away they smugly answer like mindless buffoons "Cuz that's the way we do it here".  By far the worse dining experience we have ever had in Vegas.  We didn't even get past the drinks before leaving that abortion of a restaurant. If you want a comparable dining experience for a lot less money, then do yourself a favor and go to the Double Down on Paradise and scrape the dried sputum off the floor and put it on a plate.  You won't even be able to tell the difference between that and  Martorano's complimentary bread with ground rat meat they place on the table prior to cattle prodding you into ordering.  I know it's an Italian restaurant so mind my French when I say this place SUCKS!

gNl5X7E4nMAhv75uWMVmuQ.text: Ah, where should I begin? This place started out rough and only went downhill. Our party of 8 had reservations and the restaurant was not all that busy for a Saturday night...now I understand why. We were told that we could not be seated until all 8 members of our party arrived.-Strike one. We went to the bar to have a drink, but it took so long to navigate the cute little iPad menu that all of our party arrived before we could order a drink. At least we were able to sit at our reserved table. We then sat and waited 15 minutes for a server...did I mention it wasn't that busy? When he did arrive, he impressed us again with an iPad drink menu...for 8 people? Really? I asked for a paper menu and was told that it was not updated. Strike two. Good news, we did get water after 25 minutes! The server was pressuring us along after he made US wait?!? Strike three. I haven't even tried the food yet, and honestly don't care if I do. It's like a nightclub more than a restaurant. I would have asked my fellow diners if they felt it was loud too, but you can't hear each other at all. The noise level is LOUD! Skip it and just go straight to the club.

7hfrJu2vtECJogMa78pRcQ.text: This may be a little biased- I grew up on Italian food from a mother who was the most amazing cook. The food in my neighborhood was what we referred to as "red sauce" or "italian-american". Martorano's took his east coast-italian american food that we all grew up on and brought it to Vegas- and good for him. There is an entire population in Vegas who never had this. I should know, I was there Saturday night with 2 very "American" friends from California. They LOVED it. Their review would be 5 stars all the way. I just have had this food so much that it is not unique. Strictly local red sauce grub. I had to explain what "gravy" was to my friends - which was pretty funny. I also had to hold my tongue at the "mark-up" of Proseco ($15 I pay at the market - $40 at Martorano's) - They gave us a nice tasting of mortadella mouse- it was very tasty. I had the linguine vongoli. I thought it was really good. They are very generous with the clams. Usually, you get such a small amount. Very good meal. My friends got the pasta with fish and liked it and my other friend LOVED the eggplant stack and satueed spinach. Good restaurant for Las Vegas

kZN8FJeozwvTAB5hdzal5A.text: This is a very nice hang, catering to a very middle-America crowd.  Points for lovely design, friendly service, and Strip-central location.   Review based on bar service only.  I had a very nice time at the Martorano's bar last night. Very friendly, knowledgable service. Nice lighting and not too Crowded (Wednesday evening after ten).   I had a house-specialty cocktail called "Angel" -an upscale twist on a margarita. Sweet, but I knew that going into it. Followed by a glass of Pinot -Grigio.   And here's the thing: I was so distracted by the wine glasses, that I almost forgot about the beverage. Rarely have I heard a wine glass ring so beautifully. It was like an alcoholic Tibetan singing bowl. Truly marvelous.   But the wine: eh..the selection was pretty average -same with beers and whiskys.  The house cocktails are pretty standard for the Strip - as were the prices. Three beverages came to $42 +tip.  And here's the other thing: I love Italian food, and spent many years in Boston's North End - the traditionally Italian part of town. Even the best pasta dish is inexpensive to make, and should not be flamboyant. Simple good food made from fresh ingredient is what it is all about.   Martorano's is "production Italian". More emphasis on presentation than is necessary for such a simple cuisine - with prices to match. The gullible are easy to impress. But again, pretty normal for The Strip. I'll go back for the hang, and the singing wine glasses. Probably go light  on the food.

in-qmEYegP9MPMIbmCeDNA.text: Stopped in to have a cocktail for the first time. Sat at the bar as I am apt to do and was glad that I did. Nathan, the bartender, was a True professional. My martini was made just to my liking. I ordered the special, Bolenese. It was fresh and delicious. I requested a glass of wine and Nathan's recommendation was spot on. I will definitely be back again.

XToPLgWnT-vwJePHarF2WQ.text: I love the meatballs but hate the dining atmosphere here.  It's loud with music and movies etc.  Just a different vibe and not for me so I always order food to-go.  Meatballs 5/5 The meatballs are about as big as a tennis ball and super delicious!!

iW9zK9tILnMLccK0oyMHEg.text: If you are looking for a quick bite go out on the strip where quality and excellent service isn't important. Everytime I am in Vegas I eat at Martoranos because the food is excellent the service is EXCELLENT the atmosphere is excellent and if you the type that believes you get what you pay for then you will see and taste the quality you paid for! The warm Mozzarella is to die for and basically everything else on the menu. Its obvious that Mr Martorano prides himself in running a class act of a restaurant because I will NOT eat anywhere else because Chef Martorano and his staff at this location care and it shows big time!! Give it a try you wont be disappointed! All these negative reviews I think are incorrect or fraudulent regarding service and times for food delivery because NOT ONCE  in the over 20 times Ive been here have I waited more than 30 min max.

lzSgpugfFICkmP1eND2YUg.text: I wanted to dislike this place.  The life-sized wall posters of the giant tattooed Italian American Cook with his catchphrase "Yo, Cuz" along with omnipresent clips of HIS favorite movies and HIS favorite cooking show (himself) should be all the warning you need that you are dealing with a massive ego here.  Oh, if that weren't enough, the entrance to Paris on the Arc has one giant image of Gordon Ramsay and one of this guy.  So, at first glance, I'm thinking, "Ego, pure and simple, and nothing more."  I'm happy to say I was impressed by the outcome, though.  Ego or not, this food is good.  Now, disclosure, I'm not Italian, so I'm probably not as harsh a critic as others.  But, I've eaten at a fair share of Italian places, and I know some authentic Brooklynites of Sicilian heritage who know a thing or two about cooking.  This place nails it.  The fried mozz, best I've ever had.  A giant ball of fresh, in-house made mozzarella, thick sauce with spicy peppers, perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The bolognese (special of the day while we were there) was literally the best I'd ever had.  I mean, just melt-in-your-mouth amazing.  Cocktails were great, no complaints here either.    I'd definitely come back here again if I'm ever in Vegas and craving good Italian.  This was well worth the visit.  For Vegas, the prices were actually pretty decent, too.    It does get a bit loud there, though, especially after 9pm.  They warn you about this, but it's still hard to hold a decent conversation, even with someone right next to you.  Part of the kitsch, I guess.

WyJ0trz5oGG-Gfgrtt_AlA.text: 80s disco Italian restaurant. Yeah you read that right. A total gimmick and a bit cheesy but the food is really good. If you need a meatball while listening to The Bee Gees, then this is your jam.

JSUI5XqtMpYfyN40oDSCzw.text: What restaurant tells you very short and plainly you cannot have any sauce on the side...being Diabetic less sauce is best and our waiter would not even ask kitchen!!  No service which seems to explain low reviews.  Bread good, salad good....

9okOyYPRcWz1ptSdgibiLw.text: Great service! The food was good-- a little pricey. We ordered the calamari, sweet and spicy shrimp, and the salad for appetizer. They were all great. For the main course-- we got the chicken, steak, spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were a little salty.  Overall, the food was good and service was great!!! Took off one star for the price -- as it is not a fancy restaurant with a steep price.

Q6do3lGO7wFQpoFXRnRzVw.text: Would definitely recommend this restaurant. We ate here on a Friday night and we ate a little earlier in the evening. The atmosphere was nice and was not too noisy which I have grown used to in Vegas. We ordered our drinks and I had the Black Beauty (at least I think that is what it was called) which was fantastic. For dinner my boyfriend ordered the lasagna and I ordered the bolognese. They were both delicious and very good portion sizes (I usually have trouble finishing a pasta plate but I was able to here). We really enjoyed the televisions playing old school Vegas movies like the original Ocean's 11 movie. For dessert we had their homemade ice cream and that was also a wonderful addition to our meal. Will be returning on our next visit!

57I3SqytZdGSKSKoJfCTOQ.text: Nice surprise here in Paris hotel. Really good bolognese, pasta, they even created an Alfredo dish for us that the guy said was best he ever had. Good bread, good atmosphere and good for business dinner.  A little slow on service at the table. Fantastic bartender last Thursday night so lots eating at the bar.

JxYoEopkPOCXiPQls1H6gg.text: Oh I'm sorry but I cannot leave this a bad review at all when I came here to this particular location with my friends from New Jersey we happen to walk by right as they were opening the restaurant and what do you know it was like we hit the jackpot lottery I swear to God it was crazy we were there first table and chef Martorano was there!  He kept coming toward table and bringing us food that we didn't order There were other tables in the restaurant that were two tops but it was so strange because I didn't think that we were the first actual people to be seated I think that maybe we were there first party of six It was my girlfriend Sheridan's birthday that we were celebrating I didn't get the bill if there even was one but my friend had said that the chef had hoped it up somehow it was crazy I'm sorry but I thought the food was good and I will never forget how this big jumbo macho Italian guy with the muscles came up to us and were so friendly and was talking to us I'm not sure that even realised it was Chef Martorano at that point until we had left  I don't know about these other experiences but I had a nice time plus the booze always helps

6Mm9eQktER341yNhgVHO4A.text: Service was great. The tomato mozzarella starter was wonderful. All 3 main meals were below average. There are much better Italian restaurants in Vegas and for half the price.

plZ9X5l6ft58StwNyyNK5w.text: Excellent food!  Everything is made fresh. Raymond and Francisco gave us outstanding service. We found this restaurant when we were in Fort Lauderdale and loved it!!  So glad we found it here in Las Vegas!  Will definitely recommend!!!

le6gI-v5pIHBSgImIdqw8w.text: We've never heard of this place until one night when we were desperately looking for a place for dinner while on vacation in Vegas.  I'm glad we went for it.  It was a good experience overall, however the 4 stars are mainly for the service and the calamari appetizer.  I know some people complained about it being soggy because of the sauce but I think it's the sauce that *made* the dish!  It's different from any other typical calamari appetizer I've ever had at most restaurants.  It's lightly breaded and fried, but they put a slightly sweet and tangy sauce on it that made it completely different in a good way.  I ordered the seafood pasta with red sauce (I forget the fancy dish name) and the seafood was obviously very fresh.  I would pick this place over some of the other "celebrity" Italian restaurants in the area.

rxyTc6hxp_4DDOy9jiQX1g.text: I was really impressed with the food at Martorano's in the Paris Hotel. The decor is quite modern with specials and cocktail menus displayed on iPads and a light up menu.  The customer service from the hostess to the waiter were all top notch.  THE FOOD WAS DIVINE!  I tried the caesar salad, linguine in white clam sauce and the homemade mozzarella with olive oil.  I don't suggest this place for a romantic date night but for a fun night out it fits the bill with fun music and stellar food.  For the cost it would have been nice to not have all the buzz and noise from the casino and for Martorano's to have it's only restroom which is why I deducted a star.

GOAc5UkPP6C9GEzXi5FdNA.text: Overall a good meal. Had meatballs, lasagna and scallops as our group shared. Scallops were a little overcooked but everything else was tasty and service was good. Our server was a little slow, but he tried given it was busy.

CQaizKY1W7SQwNB9ZZFSwQ.text: The Good: The food was very good. Sauce had notable flavor. Wine list was decent. Service was good.  The Bad: over hyped a bit. It was good but about what you would expect. I had a hard time moving from very good to exceptional.  The Rest: overall a nice stop and if you don't mind the higher price associated with vegas fine dinning, you wont be disappointed. If you fine dine frequently you will be satisfied but probably not wowed.

JzdKbwbpLcThU1sscRLgpg.text: I wasn't sure what to expect when I sat down last night, it officially opens this weekend so we were sampling it pre-grand opening. We had fantastic service and the food was incredible! If you're looking for a great authentic Italian meal--THIS IS IT!  I liked the ambiance of restaurant blue light accenting the walls, pictures in black and white (one of the owner), tvs on walls playing movies with subtitles on, and music going. The menus are electronic, a little heavy.  But each table got an ipad that displayed drinks (wine list, cocktails), daily specials. It was very high tech!

3ZMh8eV5qlyyFB81CKH_zA.text: I made a reservation for my team dinner at Martorano's last week and we had a great experience.  All of the details were considered (including the light up menus - love!), the service was impeccable, the decor was modern, and the food was fantastic!  I started with a peach martini - perfectly mixed and quite tasty.  I shared a caesar salad and fresh burrata to start - spot on!  My entree was the penne with vodka sauce and it was sinfully good.  We shared a panna cotta with fresh berries to close out the meal and it was perfect - light and delicious. Definitely worth a visit when looking for Italian comfort food on the Strip!

XMsz0CfcHLlQzv0IZ51N-g.text: I was in Vegas this past weekend and had dinner at Martorano's Paris and it was ABSOLUTELY GREAT!!! I had the most delicious sea bass that melted in your mouth in the most wonderful white wine sauce, I mean gravy.  Steve was around and I the pleasure to meet him, he is a super nice guy, down to earth I thought that was so refreshing. I LOVED this place and would go again every time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass in white wine THE BEST!!!

pZxIgxLh1XhO7GPechc8UQ.text: I joined two friends from out of town who were staying at Paris Las Vegas to try this restaurant.  I've walked by it many times and was always curious as to the food.  My friends like Italian, so this was our choice.  We had a 5:15 PM reservation and got to the podium just about 5 PM.  We were asked to wait because there were others ahead of us.  But, there really wasn't and she motioned us to come over.  We took seats on the patio that's on the walkway along the shops, buffet, and other dining venues in the Bally's/Paris connector.  We were promptly greeted by our server, given menus that light when opened, and brought water and iced tea quickly.  We were then brought a basket of bread and three toppings for the bread--one a spicy oil, some grated cheese, and regular olive oil.  We were cautioned about the spicy one but it really wasn't spicy.  One of my friends requested butter and that was brought for her.  We started with Bibzy calamari that is described on the menu as "fresh never frozen calamari tossed in a sweet & spicy chili sauce finished with sesame seeds."  There was another kind also, but this was described as their most popular so we went with that.  I usually can't get calamari because it's almost always a dish to be shared and I have yet to find a place that will do a half order for solo diners.  The calamari was good and the sweet and spicy chili sauce was something quite different for calamari.  I expected it to be deep fried and was surprised when it wasn't.  For the main course, I got the bucatini carbonara.  The server broke the egg and mixed it into the sauce at the table.  The sauce was tasty but a little heavy for carbonara.  I asked about the pasta and it's not house made.  The staff took pains to explain it was imported from Italy.  Service was good although there was an error with the order.  Besides the regular menu, the server had a tablet with photos of some other dishes they were highlighting.  In taking the order, one of our party wanted one dish but evidently it was taken as pointing to another.  When the error was pointed out, they were willing to make the dish he wanted, but he opted not to wait and go with what they brought.  The three of us agreed on our rating for the restaurant.  As a local, I can go to many neighborhood Italian restaurants with food as good or better and with prices that don't carry the "Strip" premium.  $12 for a side of spaghetti?  Live and learn.

IxLCuXRVevt2JdLkNA0Qjw.text: My wife and I ate here this evening and it's a pretty popular place. My wife asked for the chef not to use oil on her spinach as she cannot have oil in her diet. They refused because they wanted to maintain the integrity of the dish. It's a piece of fish over spinach. First time during our trip that a restaurant gave us grief over her request.   The food was definitely 4* but the overall was 3* because of the issue above and the slow service.

PiHu3CtdKZar3YG0aefnTQ.text: This place was one of my favorites. The had Emlo as their house wine, which is always a plus. The food was great. I went with a nice Caesar salad and a fish dish. Everything at this place was perfect.   The menus were electronic and very neat. We sat on the patio which is not really outside, but the hotel area had painted ceilings so it seems like you were somewhere else.   Food was top notch! Highly recommend.

Our appetizers and server was amazing! The spicy calamari was the best that I have ever tasted! The meal portions are very large so the waiter recommended family style so we all ordered a few items and split it. It was all pretty good, and the service was polite and helpful.

QAmloRmZtpfefTsVSsUc6w.text: Call me a creature of habit but I'm soooo glad I visited this great place years ago and wrote a review. I again ordered their Fried Calamari Bibzy and it was a nice spicy glazed version of fried calamari with thin slices of jalapenos to add an extra kick.   Their great service was very consistent too from my last experience. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, great customer service especially from Raymond and Francisco. They made sure we were taken care of the whole way through.   Highly recommend to order the following entree: Lobster Francaise  Spaghetti Pescatore   For dessert, try their amazing carrot cake along with their double expresso. Delicioso!   NOTE this place says it opens at 430 but it's only the bar that is open at that time. The dining area opens at 5p

R3m_43WN-zLprrfSJXaXhA.text: I was in Vegas for an event and was looking for a quick, yet filling dinner before heading off to catch a red-eye back east.   The staff was very attentive and the menu was delicious & considering this is Las Vegas, the pricing was very reasonable as well. Highly recommended if in the Paris (great people watch spot too)!

WON7hPPj415XqwUnjKh_RQ.text: Amazing dining experience for our large group! The 12 of us come to Vegas every year & this was our favorite dinner yet! The food was delicious & the service was impeccable! Edgar took very good care of us & it blew our experience at Hell's Kitchen (from the night before) out of the water. The ambience was fun & the music was lively. We will definitely be back!!!

syNYbpPpjlwq1v1MqCuQww.text: I'm not going  there on the  prices on the neon menu. I'm from Cali So I'm use to high prices.  when your rockin a Restaurant in the Paris hotel in Vegas.By all means. Charge the shit out of all the lemens that stagger in the door after a hard day of penny slots and cigarette smoke. As for the food.Its good/ flavors are on point.portions are plenty Service is good. The throw backs.... You get the feeling the waiters are on commission. Kinda pushy to up sell. Almost to the point of me having to say "" cool your jets Bro"" we don't need 3 orders of Calamari U get my drift. But the killer. It was so damn loud in this shack you couldn't talk to the person across the table from you. I'm all for the music/ Vegas/ flash. But god damn..  Good luck you las Vegas storm troppers

2krPpJi6pJ2kKPEcp4CsRQ.text: Food was just ok.  We had the salad, drenched in dressing, the peppers, average, and the spaghetti, ok, that was good.  Service was sub-par.   Wouldn't return.

FFWvk9hhXMKzNAmW8ErfcA.text: There's a reason this place is never full despite it having a prime location in the Paris hotel.  The negatives here heavily outweigh the few positives.  The service was mediocre at best... it felt like we our waiter was trying to up-sell us on everything.  Their menus are also completely overkill - they're backlit and make you feel as if you're getting a tan! Unnecessary as the front section of the restaurant is completely lit from the Paris walkway.  The two things to look out for:  the calamari (especially the one with peppers... not good), the salad (it comes swimming in dressing and completely soggy).  Don't waste your money on these!  Additionally, the price point here was completely ridiculous.  I know it's Vegas, but the food needs to at least be decent to charge this much money!  It was $200 for our party with some of the dishes over $30. Completely not worth it.

d-3Lec0UQQ0Fj4NgIwOviA.text: I'm a big fan of fresh pasta so when I heard this place imports from Italy I was super excited to try it. But it was mediocre from start to finish and not worth the price we paid.   My husband and I like to be adventurous so we started off with the pigs feet. This was a little too fatty for me but the sauce was adequate and it was interesting to try.   Afterwards, we weren't sure what pasta to get so we thought we'd split the bolognese of the day. The picture on the menu made it look big but when it arrived there was not a whole lot there. I thought the pasta was extremely underwhelming for supposedly "fresh pasta".   Because I'm a glutton for punishment, I decided to order the carbonara which I thought would be better. It wasn't. Pasta still tasted stale to me and the sauce was underwhelming as well.   Overall we felt that the price for everything just wasn't worth it. Yes it's the strip and you're gonna pay more but for this price we expected top notch pasta. I felt like the meal was comparable to any run of the mill pasta place on the strip that would be cheaper.

vwZFvBIX2uZf8GLcXTPiMg.text: First of all I eat on my terms. Not Steve's terms. I'm a local here for years. I was waiting for a friend and I wanted to order appetizers but the server wouldn't let me because I wasn't ordering my entire meal at the same time which the server then told me was that's the way Steve wants it and then we ordered the chicken cutlet Parmesan and it was a thick as  the heel of the shoe which was just a complete turn off so this place sucks!!!! Then when we wanted to split the check, the server gave us a hard time about that. Steve your food is subpar. And to try and make Michelin star rules Is frankly hysterical.and when the manager came to the table he was cocky and condescending and only repeated the same words as the waitress,  oh that's how Steve wants it so Steve you could stick your restaurant

4qeqWROcSTx-F0m7k-Cijg.text: We love Martorano's in Paris. We've never had to wait in line and it's in a good location. The cheesesteak is delicious as well as the pastas. I love how this restaurant really takes all the best food from Philly and incorporates it into their menu. The Water Ice martinis are so amazing if you like water ice. It is truly like dessert in a glass. You can't go wrong here.

Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso Martini and Cherry Water Ice Martini because I couldn&#39;t decide! The cherry water ice is amazing. Reminds me of philly!

Ee-qE0RwD0uuAKyP_dVNgw.text: Nathan at the bar was amazing. And the food is out of this world. Highly recommend the eggplant stack and the meatballs.

NeTUj7fFe3KwqoNBO2Kf-w.text: This is easily the best Italian cuisine I have ever eaten.   We have tried the one in Atlantic City and it was just as great.   Grim the time you walk in, they greet you and take the time to explain the menu and tell you in detail about the specials. They use an iPad to show you all the specials and drinks. The menus have a light that's helpful since the ambiance calls for lower lighting.   Our waiter was Yuri and he was fantastic! Super knowledgeable and friendly. We had the meatball salad and it was so good. We also had the shrimp appetizer which was great though a bit spicy. For main course I had the pork chop which was cooked perfectly and the even the spinach (which I really don't care for)  was tasty. My husband had the veal and that was cooked to perfection, crispy though so tender you could cut it with the fork.   All in all it was a great experience and we will definitely be going back.
