uD004Tr6O7xz5ZrdRfhsdw.text: Delicious! Food and service was great! First time here and I would definitely come back again.   Tried the homemade mozzarella and fried mozzarella! Both had great texture and tasted authentic

9Bpi-dEGra2kqhvBgTVi0g.text: I ate at Matorano's because it advertised the best chicken parmesan in Las Vegas. And it was indeed a very good chicken parmesan. Not the best I've ever had by any means, but quite respectable. Prices are high, even by Vegas standards. Service and atmosphere were good, but I wouldn't make a return trip a priority.

0SCTCuJMJW-L4wJxMGEz1Q.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Came back Again for our 13th Anniversary still the best Italian food and service in town. Our server Ray once again truly made our anniversary dinner a special one to remember. Everything our server Ray recommended was once again on point! Thank you Martorano's every time we are in Las Vegas your food and service makes our time at the Paris a day to remember!

NFVuyoEnqriSZqh4pnRrSQ.text: This is an absolutely amazing Italian restaurant. The service was spectacular all around. In a city whose service is declining, they show you how it feels to be treated like royalty. I loved it and would definitely come back again. Amazing effort, amazing food, amazing people.

QIumoeie03pRkEBAppdkMQ.text: I have been here multiple times.   I went there this last week and I was highly disappointed. I mentioned my problem with one of our two servers.  Nothing happened.  Then I also wrote about it in the electronic comment section that comes with the bill.  Nothing so I decided to leave a review.    I will start with another patron was extremely drunk and causing problems he was in the table next to us.  It made it hard to enjoy our dinner.  Secondly, they brought me the wrong salad but they fixed that and brought me the Caesar salad I ordered. The problem is it was bad.  The lettuce had many wilted pieces in it and the croutons were mostly stale.  I usually love their Caesar salad.  I quit eating it and showed it to the servers assistant who was helping our table.  They did not do anything about it.  Our entrees were good to a point. I have to say that over all it was a bad experience.

88sU0hZ2DTSMa5a2X7WtCw.text: A real comedic event   A good menu, but a bad excuse of a restaurant and a really poor Las Vegas restaurant management team!  Really sloppy - their dress, their presentation, their view on food / service, etc, etc, etc   Just ok service - rushed and unrefined  The food is good, but It is not great by any stretch.  You experience is overshadowed by the management / service.    Find your good customers and don't rush them.    Overpriced even for Vegas. No regulars here, but just tourists who are drawn in unknowingly.  2 years and the location will likely turnover to-another entureprienoer.            Not worth a return trip based on the management, presentation, price, rushed service and poor leadership.    Too many other GREAT options.

I9VvcMi8Tp7aYz6hWUBd_Q.text: If I could give this restaurant a 1/2 star, I would. The service and food were less then desirable. The menu items sounded delicious, but the actual food served to me proved to fall short of that. While I have never personally met the chef, I can tell you the ladies in my neighborhood church have better gravy and better meatballs then this place.   To make matters worse, the management was completely uncompromising and pretty much ruined my best friend's birthday.   We had a moderately sized party with a special request to order two meals and appetizers separately from the rest of the group. The waiter informed us that they could not do that and that they WOULD NOT DO anything to assist. He sent a manager over and he said he could do nothing for our request, and due to the owner, appetizers could not be ordered separately from our meals. We explained to two different managers our situation and they regretfully informed us that the owner refuses to make any exceptions in how his restaurant is run. Management did nothing to accommodate, even when the situation was explained to them over and over again.   If you want good Italian food I can recommend several other places that severely beat this place. Picasso, Sinatra, Andiamo, Nove, Casa di Amore, MAGGIANOS, PIZZA ROCK, BUCA DI BEPPO...literally pick any other Italian restaurant and you will be happier.    Furthermore, if you have any business colleagues, clients, friends or family that you plan to recommend here, don't.  Steve Martorano and his restaurants will never have my business again.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not the greatest gravy or meatball, POOR SERVICE. I&#39;ll be taking my uneaten meal to the homeless.

KjczLn_r3GwMtp1rjR4GYQ.text: 5 stars for service and food quality! Jessie was our server and she was outstanding. Super friendly, accommodating, and made us feel welcomed. All of her menu recommendations were spot on. For appetizers, we had the Famous Meatball and Eggplant Stacked. So delicious, I highly recommend both appetizers. Perfect sizes for sharing. For dinner we had the Veal Marsala and the Carbonara. So flavorful and authentic. Nice size portions as well. The atmosphere of the restaurant is really cool too. I'd definitely eat here again not only because the food is so good but the service we received was impeccable!

OdL3ItmXuJcTolmKT-KIRw.text: I really disliked this place, and most of the food we ordered.  The decor is nice, black and white. With blue lighting along the bar and the kitchen, which is open (about a 1/3 wall) at the back of the restaurant.  The environment is odd. From the outside it looks like a typical classy restaurant, but once you're in it's a different story. "Yo cuz" is plastered all over the place, I'm guessing that's the chef's catchphrase. Several tv's around the room were playing Mystic River (a great movie but would not be my first choice for a dinner - the concept of having a distracting t.v. while in an " elegant" restaurant was off-putting) while funk and disco music played a little too loud.  They try to be trendy and modern, the menus are backlit and the server brings over and iPad that he uses to go over the specials and which serves as a cocktail menu/shop/dessert menu, but doesn't actually serve to order.  The servers were very professional and friendly, and provided their recommendations when we asked.  The fried mozzarella stack was very good, but a bit pricey. $22 seemed a bit much.  The main courses were not very good particularly when factoring in their cost. $28 for what amounted to 6 chicken fingers in marsala was a bit steep, and the carbonara, although a generous portion, was not very good either. The risotto was a little too al dente for my taste, although the portion was generous.  There are a lot of better dining options in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light up menu &amp; iPad

4FZktbBd_M5nEZogovm60w.text: Wow.   Thank you Paris Buffet.  Line was long so we came here.   Amazing food.    A bit pricey but you get what you pay for.

-Niic29zhPuzwOROWLclMw.text: Food is pretty good.  Service is so so so slow.... almost feel like you have been held hostage by hostess.  Price is reasonable. Portions are actually too big.

6mw6rwmNkwozKUSgRHIjfA.text: Excellent service and food was incredible.  Great atmosphere with upbeat music.  Bar was very impressive and cool!  Wine list is pretty awesome too.  The servers attire is very New York !! Highly recommend this place

BcViEmUvddY6SA-vwBP9kg.text: Excellent experience. I had the scallops while my husband had the veal and both were fantastic. I would recommend and will return when in Vegas. The wine by the glass was surprisingly good.

MktN7nvI-O1MehKQxLnw_A.text: I had wanted to try Martorano's for a while as it seemed like it would be a great dinner spot.  While restaurants can be hit or miss, they did everything right from start to finish.  We were promptly greeted at check in, as was every party arriving.  We were lucky to have Paul as our server.  What more can I say than "wow" about his professionalism, knowledge and hospitality.  He spoke about the menu with a sincere passion for his role as ambassador to our table.  With items I would never order (vegetarian) he spoke about the menu with such confidence and intimate knowledge that he was sharing an insiders look more than just suggestive selling.  The menu was amazing.  Paul prepped us for a fabulous ride and it did not let us down once.  The freshly made mozzarella made it a necessity to have it to start.  We had their version of caprese and fried mozzarella that was evident that everything was made fresh and with love.  Indeed Paul's presentation of the menu was a love story and homage of the chefs vision and passion.   Portlons were abundant and full of flavor where you savored each bite.  Penne a la vodka was exceptional and chicken dish huge.  While the menu consisted of fresh and simple ingredients, it was the symphony of flavors and presentation that made it perfect.  Overall, a great experience from Start to finish and I would not hesitate in recommending it!  I can't wait to return!

ceTlPtdbkm81U2px-LztJQ.text: Great food, super fun atmosphere, and I loved the innovative LED menus!  I also appreciated the visual "specials" that were viewed on an iPad. I appreciated that they appealed to so many of my senses!

ONX86ccD2PLuyQM--vDYvg.text: We were in Las Vegas just recently and had heard about this great place from a friend. So we decided to try it out.  I had the Linguini with clam sauce and the calamari.  It was so delish!!  Our waitress, Jessica was awesome.  So friendly, knowledgable about the menu and gave us excellent service. She made our experience at Martorano's just that much better.  We will definitely be going back and asking for Jessica.

mWsiIR-FyrwP3t5gDImo5w.text: Never have had a bad experience dining here - if you're looking for a nice Italian dining option on the Las Vegas Strip - consider Martorano's! On this visit we sat at the bar and had the terrific Nate for our server - we started off with the meatball & salad (even to share between 2 people) - you get chef's famous big meatball and nicely seasoned Italian salad, for main course we had one of the evenings specials - the You Cuz Linguini with fresh shellfish and one of our regular favorites the Penne al Vodka. We finished off with a slice of decadent cheesecake. The entrees are served family style so definitely suitable for sharing - there's not too many side offerings but I've had the sauteed greens before. They have daily specials so be sure to check on in the Ipad. Entrees range from about $28 - $50 for most. Convenient location at the Paris and since the one at the Rio has been closed - this is the spot! They are only open for dinner. Don't miss out - check it out and you'll leave happy and full! ;-)

RR0fQMGdYYZRfokk0sBGUA.text: I'm half Italian. My Nana raised me on homemade and handmade pasta, delicious meatballs, incredible gravy, sumptuous salad. She was a spectacular cook. Although she passed on to the great kitchen in the sky, I keep her alive by cooking her recipes and enjoying many of the dishes she would make for me.  So why do I begin my review of Martoranos with that introduction?   Two words - the meatball. Italians do not order meatballs out. Your family's meatball is part of your heritage. No one else's can come close. Or that's how it is supposed to go.   Sadly, the meatball that Chef Martorano cooks puts my Nanas to shame. That is almost sacrilegious to say but there - I've said it. There's a reason this restaurant is famous for its meatball. It's AMAZING!   But I'm getting ahead of myself. Let's start with the cool decor of the blue lit bar and the plasma TVs all around the restaurant showing Classic movies or the DJ playing tunes to dine by.   We ordered the meatball and salad appetizer and were blown away by it. Our waiter also suggested the made-fresh-that-morning fried mozzarella in gravy which was out of this world.   For our main course my lady had fresh fish over risotto. Loved it. I had veal parm with peppers, onions and gravy that was phenomenal. The side of ricotta gnocchi was light and spectacular.   This was one of the best Italian meals I ever experienced. Hands down the best meal I had in Vegas in years.   Service was 5 star. The meal was 5 star. A MUST for lovers of great Italian food!

AJw6CSJETx0i3GuT_9ksQw.text: Booked here because the experience in Florida was epic...food, service, atmosphere...well, this was the antithesis, as the restaurant was about 1/2 full (Tuesday eve) and the service was slow.  Food was not nearly as flavorful as I recall, and the portions were overly sauced.  Thumbs down.  Bummed I burned a Vegas meal, and in a gross hotel to boot.  I'll certainly give FL another shot.

-Hum4zeDsHqI5ql9-KdsfA.text: I came here expecting this place to be over rated and it turned out to be some of the best Italian that I've ever had. Best in Las Vegas. The seafood spaghetti had so much flavor that just a tiny taste of the sauce had punch. The appetizers are divine, great vegetarian options and the dishes tasted traditional and homemade. I loved it and can't wait to go back.  I did find a hair in my red velvet cake and they accidentally gave me someone else's doggy bag but the food was so good I'm willing to overlook it. LOL!

Rq7rIWdhqngOxMVO0VetYw.text: The best meatballs on the planet. Period. The meatball with salad option also comes with ricotta cheese and bread... might just be the best meal you will ever eat. I don't care how loud the movie playing is, I don't care how loud the music is... When I am eating this meal, nothing else matters. I'm in heaven.  I have told friends about this and they say " I don't even like meatballs and if I did, I would want them with spaghetti"  I just order for them and when it gets to the table and they start eating it.... They convert right away. So even if having a meatball with a salad sounds terrible to you... Try it. You will love it.  Just a note... If not all then 99% of the 1 star reviews are from jack-off people that are upset the restaurant won't make changes to dishes to make them happy. Go to Olive Garden people ... They will do anything to accommodate you. More pepper, less salt, more sauce, no sauce, this on the side, blah blah blah. This place makes it CRYSTAL CLEAR that they will make NO CHANGES TO ANYTHING. PERIOD. I love that. Finally a place that doesn't fold to these idiots that want to have everything adjusted to them. If you want something made a certain way.. Make it at home. If you don't like MARTORANO'S policy.. AWESOME! Don't go.

ZDnocSPAckOJ2O84jqEeuA.text: This restaurant was amazing. The service was great, the food was drool-worthy, and my colleague and I felt well taken care of the entire time. We had the fresh mozzarella, calamari, and shared a chicken Parmesan special and the carbonara. I have nothing bad at all to say about any of the food- every bite of everything was amazing! - but my favorite had to be the calamari, a perfect blend of sweet and spicy without being overbearing. Definitely will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

BfqwVMu4kGafeHuebCK8MQ.text: Messed up my (simple) order and took a long time to get it right. Waiting so long for average Italian food is nothing to be impressed about.   The place has a good ambience.  That's probably the best thing.  The service was just okay, not even counting the messed up order.   The food was okay and good presentation. However, very overpriced. The pasta noodles were of good quality.  The sauce was nothing special. (I got the red "gravy" with the meatball. The meatball tasted fatty.   The Manager did come over and apologize for the mix up on my food.   No way would I take my wife here for a nice dinner. Much better places in the same price range.   It's not romantic. It's not special. It's overpriced.

GTdTpuS_UFkGCn8mUvgLsw.text: I can't for the life of me figure out why so many people rate this place 4 and 5 stars!    While the service was impeccable, the food was completely under seasoned and needed salt.    Maggiano's has better flavor than here.   Now maybe it was just an off night for the chef, I don't know? But regardless it was enough to make me not ever want to come back.  Especially at $44 an entree.    I certainly could've been a prick and sent my food back but from my perspective shouldn't a chef at a celebrity chef restaurant be tasting his/her own stuff and know whether or not it needs salt?  With so many other choices in Las Vegas there's absolutely no reason to consider coming here.

RAgqkXbjy2ZrGikw-F7OPg.text: If you are from Jersey and now live in Vegas, EAT HERE. Heck, if you are from anywhere and want to feast on fantastic food, EAT HERE. I6N54Io1dcsNhfewpYp9RQ.text: I can not say enough amazing things about this restaurant. While on vacation, I wanted a nice Italian meal and after looking on Yelp, of course, I found Martorano's. I was able to make a same day reservation. They are located inside of the Paris Casino.   We were sat on time and given beautiful menus that light up. I do not know why but I love light up menus! We were greeted right away and asked for our drink order. I went with a nice glass of red wine. I really liked that you could sit down, relax & take your time to enjoy your meal/atmosphere. Our server and bus boy were amazing. I loved their old school Italian Mob-ish uniforms. I realised the owner had to be from the South Philly area after looking at the entrees. I probably am a little biased being born and raised in Philly but any food prepared by someone in South Philly is usually amazing.   For an appetiser we ordered the fresh homemade baked mozzarella and added a side salad. When it came out the server even split it in two and plated it for my brother & myself. It was so delicious, I could have ate the whole thing myself.   For our main meals, he got veal parm with a side of fresh homemade gnocchi. I ordered Fusilli Pollo. Our meals were delicious!  The portions were just right.   I was so excited to hear there was another location at Harrahs in Atlantic City. I will def be going there soon!   I really loved the attention and personal touches our server took the time out for us. We had a great conversation and even recommended a great second glass of wine to accompany my meal with.   If you were get the chance to eat here, I promise you will not be dissapointed.

8DSC1VjHNtQAnvfH8uDygQ.text: First, I want to really focus on the quality of service. Friends and family were enjoying a late night meal and dessert, and a waiter came up and dropped off a pizza to the table. The waiter said it's Complementary of the owner, Steve. The waiter stated, "Steve wanted you all to have the pizza he just made." To me I really appreciated that on many levels. Why? Because the restaurant had many other patrons, and he gave us the pizza. We were extremely grateful for that gesture.   My good friend ordered pasta with Sunday gravy. That dish had to be some of the best I have experienced. Also, the chocolate cake was amazing. It was rich, moist, and the texture was eventful if I must say. Overall, the experience reeked of good times, and we were satisfied with our choices. Oh yea, they kept our glasses full. That is one thing I like to observe at establishments.

14tQllR8p7WlYycAslmE9A.text: Ugh...what is a guy to do?  With so many great and interesting eateries scattered up and down The Strip, I would've thought I'd have a problem narrowing down my pick of where to go for my last expense-able meal for work.  Sadly, instead, I was left to pick from whatever was still open in Paris and Bally's.  Not a terrible lineup, but not exactly the best Vegas has to offer either.  Which led me to Martorano's - a place I knew nothing about, but with a menu of pastas that was all too alluring!  While it was Martorano's flashy, Miami Beach-esque looks that initially caught my attention (which makes sense, given its Miami origins), it was actually their menu that sold me.  Their starters, salads, meat/entree specialties, pizzas, and sandwiches looked pretty interesting, but it was said pasta dishes that I was set on trying.  I was originally eyeing either their Bucatini Carbonara or Fusilli Pollo, but I opted at the last second to go with their TAGLIATELLE with a Beef, Veal, and Pork Bolognese ($36) from their list of featured dishes.  Now, when the dish first came out, I was a little disappointed.  For one, the bolognese looked a little watery/wet to me, but more significantly, it felt light on pasta.  As I ate through the dish, the former turned out to be a little True, but I was wrong on the latter.  Though it didn't seem like there was a lot, there was plenty of tagliatelle (which was perfectly al dente, by the way).  I just wish the bolognese was a bit tighter; as flavorful as it was, it would've felt more hearty/robust if it didn't seem so diluted.  Beyond the food (BTW, their bread with their chili oil is awesome), I thought the service was pretty solid.  My server (bartender?) was friendly and checked on me several times, which I appreciated.  Unfortunately though, it's hard to get too excited about Martorano's thanks to their prices.  I hate saying a place is "overpriced" since there's no way to know the economics of a business, but I don't think it's unfair to say that I wouldn't have ordered my $36 pasta (or come here entirely) if I was paying out of my own pocket.  Not bad, just not sure it's worth the prices.  THREE AND A HALF STARS rounded down.

8xfZdfkaI4labnLV7l4gIw.text: So, food is amazing.  Hands down  the best italian food ive EVER had.  I would have given 5 stars, but....  Arrived on Thurs PM late (8:45ish?)  Resturaunt maybe 1/3 full.  Hostess station asks my name then engages in a 5 min conversation with a guest leaving.  Wipess off menus, THEN asks me my name again. wo9A_GIHo9qNeVEoWouVdw.text: Imagine a tattooed tough guy posing as a a makeup-wearing Chef. This, apparently is the man responsible for the classic food served at Martorano's. This peculiar mix delivers a mixed bag at hefty prices.  We started with the calamari and Tomato Mozzarella.  Both were excellent. The Calamari featured a touch of spice and the ringlets were tender and flavorful. The tomato was meaty and held up to the equally dense cheese. The Veal Picatta was tender and not cloying with lemon.  So, why the 3 Stars? Two reasons. Try to find the cost of a meal at Martorano's. Yes, photos are on Yelp, but on no official website. What are they trying to hide?  Clearly they know this is an overpriced restaurant. Secondly, over $42 for Veal Picatta? Enough said.   I'm not sure why the Marketing Department behind this place felt a makeup encrusted tough guy was the right "face" behind a brand. The image caused my wife to laugh on previous visits to the city, hence the reason we never visited this place. I finally tried because I was part of a group. I'm glad I tried it, but it is doubtful I will ever return. Like the guy in the photo and the hidden prices, it just seems sleazy. After a visit, I know that to be right.

4hjNzhiIHMHb6Nf5QF8c0g.text: As a person who has come here before, the service was very disappointing as well as the food. I came here for my birthday and ordered 2 Calamari appetizers and did not receive them until after the main course which was disappointing since calamari is one of my favorites I look forward to. Addition to that I ordered the Martorano's salad and it was drenched in dressing to the point that it was too acidic and unbearable to eat. Not only was the salad distasteful, so was the attitude from their manager who you think would help with the situation. I wouldn't recommend coming here if you want your order to be correct or enjoy your time.

So now we had Eddie Murphy screaming obscenities: "c**k s****r  &  m****r f****r at mach 10 volume in our ears.  We got up to leave.  Told the manager.  His response to the obscenities was, "that's just who we are".  Really, How sad!  Went across the casino to Mon a Mi Gabi and had a great meal.

MQY7Q5hglcA4a-mla6b_AA.text: Didn't even eat here. Had a reservation for 7:30. Stood there for 15 minutes and no one helped us so we left. This place is a joke. I've eaten here before and the food is not that good to stand there and wait like this. Never again.

h7B8vwM_NR7wr5h4pG3djg.text: Review only for drinks at the bar--- Great bartender! Sat down and was quickly presented with an iPad of all the various drink options. Lots of cool cocktail combinations made expertly and quick. Really impressed with the fast service here because so many other places I've been to here can be quite slow. Bartender was also cheerful and friendly. Will definitely go back for drinks. Only draw back was a bunch of obnoxious investment bankers lurking at the bar, but I can't really fault them for that.

8no6ToSRgBuasOvoKdJh7g.text: My group comes here each time we visit. The food is always great. Love the cheese steak, scallops, and chicken Parmesan. Raymond and Francisco were fabulous servers, we had a group of twelve and they managed us very well. Wonderful food and great service!

cGpr_9GN4u3sYUFcEHQ7xA.text: I was stationed in Sicily for three years. I love carbonara and ate it all over Italy.  I'm not sure where the chef learned how to make it but it couldn't of been in Italy. It was an extremely heavy thick dish. It should be much lighter. It just sat in my stomach all night.  The manager came by and asked how we enjoyed our half eaten meal. I told him the truth and he had nothing to say and just walked away. I guess they only want to hear compliments. Definitely will not return. Even the waiter had an attitude. I will say the bread was pretty good though.

kGvLQagfSVOo78MBo8pS_w.text: Truly disappointing experience. From the blase  greeting by the hostess to the rudeness and sloppiness of the bartender to the exorbitant prices for average food and drink, this was the low point of our week in Vegas. We really enjoy Italian and the quality here was unremarkable yet for top dollar. Mr Martorano has his picture prominently displayed throughout the restaurant. One would expect that he would take more personal pride in the delivery of quality and the hiring of professional staff.

47keIrNOoC5YHHR4y3isew.text: My mother and I came here for lunch, around 11:30am. We had never been here before and wanted to try it out. We had a really cool server, and the drink I ordered was amazing. Except the fact it was kettle one, and $14. Not cool. The salad was good honestly. Then the spaghetti and meatballs came out. The meatball (yes it is just one huge meatball) and honestly, it was not that good. Anyone can simmer some tomatoes and put salt in it. I was not impressed. And it was $27 for tomato sauce. I do not plan to go back here. Ever. Save yourself money seriously.

_TUeEPnD2nk1lLfERrc8QA.text: Very loud inside. All entrees served have no sides and they don't allow any substitutions or anything to their menu. Server was friendly. Managers are very cold, unhappy and look like they hate hate their lives. Ordered the veal marsala and it was ok. Got an $18 side order of spinach, lol. I'll never go back or recommend this place to other locals or tourists. There are better options folks!

1qKCF039BmXw65xGL6R4vg.text: Bottom line don't go !!!  They push the over priced specials.  Will not serve plain old tap water then charge you big time for bottled water.  And the owner says don't break my balls this is the way I cook.  Well first of all your not there cooking.  I'm Italian the food has to much Garlic and to much salt. OVER PRICED OVER PRICED OVER PRICED .  My recommendation go some where else.

CWFvYyR7T_caP9IMt_Yi4Q.text: Not satisfied with this restaurant at all. I went around early afternoon and the restaurant was pretty slow, only a handful of people. You would think we wouldn't have to wait. That was not the case. We had to wait over a half an hour for the waiter to take our order. And almost another half hour for the food to come! It would have been worth it if the food was 5 stars but it was completely average, and for what I am paying (overpriced for the quality) and waiting for, I expected more. Disappointed with the service and the food here and will definitely not be going back.

VdTRoRblqxMUSUCDY-Lwbw.text: Food was ok, host was  horrible and mediocre, slow very slow server even the place was empty, meatball salad is good as reviewed in this site.

rLnmC1B3Ck9WxDhatDZkIQ.text: I'll start by saying that the Service was excellent.  Our waiter was super attentive and extremely friendly.  We ordered the salad and meatball as the appetizer.  It was excellent.  For the main course I ordered the Spaghetti di avolo and my finace ordered the lamb Bolognese.  Both dishes were extremely salted.  It pretty much ruined any flavor of the herbs and spices that the sauce had.  I couldn't even finish half of my plate.  The drinks were good.  Overall, the service is top notch but the food was borderline inedible.  Just like anything in Vegas, this was expensive, but I think I would have gotten something better tasting for the money we spent there.

7cgC6wDiSrkVHeO3e2PU9w.text: This place was GREAT. shout out to the server MIKE, he was AWESOME. Also to the busser JAIME he was funny and very attentive.  the food was DELICIOUS!! The service was AMAZING. loved it all.

4XIfYqOk_4lU7QpI4AVXrw.text: The only good thing about this place is the service. And it looks nice and has a cool ambiance. Besides that, don't waste your money. The portions are small and it was nothing to write home about. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was like $20 and came with like 10 pieces of calamari. Seriously? For $20? I thought they were feeding mice. The entrees were nothing special. We had the chicken permigliano (however you spell it). It comes with no sides!!! And it wasn't even good. It was a fried piece of chicken with cheese on top. Seriously don't waste your money. This place sucks. Overpriced and they are greedy with their portions. I only gave it two stars because the server was really nice. But they try pushing you to buy more (sides, alcohol, etc.). I felt like I was looking for a used car.

UtjO5OjJNM42c10_d6Ayzg.text: Me and my home boy just had some grub. We had the ribeye cheesesteak and meatball and salad combo. The chef hooked us up with some sesame honey glazed wings.  But in all seriousness... Service was great, food was awesome, drinks were delicious. Highly recommend this place!

4zYEihX3BMeadeR0bi6ePQ.text: Went to Martorano's at Paris on Sunday 5.1.2016 and it was not what we come to expect of this place. We have dined most locations more than once; and this was by far the worst experience that we have ever had. Being from Philadelphia and fairly familiar with the cuisine and the restaurant itself. I will have to say that our waitress (Jessica) was excellent and none of it was her fault. We had reservations at 8:30PM and were not seated until 8:40 PM; everyone was crowding the hostess stand. We were finally seated and looking at our menu I order Veal Parmigiana with Gnocchi which I do every location. I was told at first that veal parm is not on the menu but it was on the menu outside the restaurant and every other restaurant that I have been to; but then I was told that they will make an "exception". Then moments later I was told that they were out of Gnocchi (I was the 24th order and they only had 23 orders). How do you run out of Gnocchi on a Sunday night when you have it on your menu and you are still open for another 2-3 hours minimum? This is not acceptable for a place that has reservations and is accepting walk-ins. I got my Veal Parmigiana and it was the size of my fist (which isn't that large) and it was very thick and had bones in it (not usual for Veal Parmigiana)  Martorano's was so much better atmosphere, presentation, and family like at the Rio;  at Paris I feel like its get in and get out not enjoyable.

lQQOdg3BKgZ4ZF72tUhmKA.text: That's right...five stars. ..I have had a lot of carbonara Pasta in my life.   This was truly amazing.  They actually stir the egg in at the table.   The pizza my husband had was thin crust and delightful!

TJ50iifUUZeVCQkEv1HZeQ.text: Highly disappointed with the food especially after our waiter gave us a long monologue about using the fresh and best ingredients.  Brandon, our waiter is the only reason I give as many stars as i did.

C-hxrAV-oKip98cASx-EiA.text: Very limited lunch menu, food overall was good, not the best Italian Ive had but not the worst either. When we asked for bread our waitress said they only serve bread during lunch hours..hm, ok. Im giving them only 3 stars because the experience was boring, we were the only guests at the restaurant. Probably wont go back..

tY9xXxi4YEc3AH7-CyPP6Q.text: Simply amazing! Food was excellent as was the service! If you like homemade Italian food you will love Martorano's.

x7ygo-wiV5YHM9R16gJcyQ.text: The food here was phenomenal. Raymond and Francisco helped us out with some recommendations from the menu and took the the time to explain everything. They were a great team and kept us happy throughout the meal. I tried the watermelon martini Raymond recommended and it was great. The pasta was cooked perfect as was everything else. Started with the calamari appetizer, chicken parm, risotto, you name it. It was all great ! Unfortunately we didn't have the appetite we should have coming here but I will definitely be coming back. This time with an appetite big enough to enjoy dessert afterwards. If we're lucky we'll get stuck with Raymond and Francisco again :) they were awesome!

xVzIXPiLlWue1yrLEkCuQw.text: We enjoyed a really terrific meal. My wife ordered the salad with meatball and I ordered the pepperoni pizza. Great portion size. Very tasty meals. Quick lunch service. They have Lagunitas IPA and I enjoyed that, too.

x3wNguz2ZqdYM7SPGH4fZg.text: Excellent Italian. Had the Short Ribs and Pasta. Sounds wierd but was outstanding. We will definitely come back next time in LV.

gI4ncw8R2k3W5jqjhW8wUw.text: Food was excellent. Server took good care of us.  A bit pricey,  but it was a special occasion.  We would definitely come back when in Vegas again.

MHQVEHpXQqfvzXq9nvtdLQ.text: Great place to stop by the bar for a quick bite and a martini when on the strip. I tried the meatball salad and they do a great job creating a tender meatball. Friendly, attentive service too. Will have to stop by again on my next trip to Bally's or Paris.

IjpLFBUOb-jg174qP0apPw.text: Let me say the review has nothing to do with the food. Been to the one at rio food was awesome service just as good atmosphere amazing.   Service at Paris horrible and slow. They had no personality, just not friendly.  Waited for service a long time then no interaction at all, very different from Rio.   Food. I ordered exactly the same items as last time. Meatball and salad. It was the same, delicious. Bread with oil very good. Spaghetti Dob also very good.   Atmosphere....none there were tons of empty tables inside the restaurant where the theme and atmosphere are yet they sat us on top of a huge party outside in the walkway to hear and see all the drunks walk by, so no atmosphere on the patio....again way different than the cool setting at the Rio with Rocky movies and music.

s6a-oHIuOWZ1ftZlS_pnpQ.text: Give it 4 stars for the food I had, 4 stars for service, 3 stars for price (I understand location costs) and 3 stars on seating (explain below.)  First of all if you are staying or gambling at Paris or Bally's, good Italian, real good. Can I get better in Utica, NY or Philly or Brooklyn or Jersey or....mom's kitchen, yeah, yeah, maybe, but you are in Vegas. If you like veal, you gotta try the house Veal Cutlet Martorano. It is spicy with peppers and really sharp tasty cheese. I get veal all over and am a pretty good cook myself, I'm gonna figure this recipe out (steal it)!  I had it with the sauteed greens (spinach) crisp, fresh & tasty. Why not escarole? I was drinking bourbon, so the food review ends there.  Now if you want a little privacy, stay off the rail with all the casino pedestrian traffic. Interior is ok. I don't get the movies or music, give me Italian music, Martorano!  Wait & bus were attentive and personable. I don't get the lit up menus, but then again I'm old fashioned.  My food was 4 star, I'd give the place 3.5 overall, and yeah I'll be back for the veal & greens.

k2OX1uX31P_s6DfmqThDbQ.text: there was a lot of hyperbole regarding this eatery, so we had to give it a go. when we entered this establishment, our party of four were seated in the main dinning area, much to our chagrin, we were greeted with a cacophony of music, blasting at extreme decibel levels! really?  it was so invasive, that we could not hear ourselves think, let alone carry on a conversation, between consenting adults.   i thought obama had outlawed excessive sound torture, were we to be waterboarded next?  also, there were these funky lights, swirling non-stop throughout the room, really? therefore,  a person is not only unable to speak to your guests, but because of the lighting, you couldn't see them! really?    as a result, we were moved to the outside dinning area, thank you god! once outside, we could at least take advantage of our vision, hearing and remaining senses and  engage in the social pleasantries, associated with fine dinning.  our review of the meals met with mixed results; the appetizers of meatball (yes only one) with a salad, was very good, as was the fresh mozzarella.  however, the main courses of eggplant, ordered by two of our party, was over salty and appeared to have been made sometime in advance. this is against their freshly made food mandate, listed by the owner on the menu, really? they were going to return these dishes but since this place is run by a former mafia chieftain, they decided discretion was the better part of valor and life. my meal, chicken sicilian, was one of the worst meals i have ever been served! the chicken was covered in a thick  sauce, which was made of primarily olive oil and grease! the peppers, which were supposed to add spice and flavor were uncooked! so this chicken dish should really sleep with the fishes, which they will also not eat!  the last dish of spaghetti, was enjoyed by my wife.   so if you desire to go to a place where you don't want to see or hear from your friends, family or associates, martorano's is the place for you, but not me!

MnuAXY88HcV85xer6gaE_g.text: What started out as a sub-par experience turned into a fun night.  We had reservations for 7:15, and the restaurant was absolutely packed when we arrived.  We waited about 45 minutes to an hour after our reservation time before being seated.  We actually had decided to leave because we had tickets to a show and were afraid we'd miss it.  Upon discussing the situation with the manager (or perhaps owner?), he promised to make it work.  We were assigned a manager or some type of higher-up as our waiter, and he was wonderful.  Bread with oil and vinegar was served (one of the things I miss most about Italy!) as an appetizer.  I ordered the tagliatelle alla bolognese and a red wine that the waiter suggested (which paired nicely).  Our food arrived promptly, and was flavorful and authentic.  The other two people in my party enjoyed the meal as well.  We had a great time and made it to the show.  They even gave us our meals on the house!   I deducted one star mostly because of the hostess.  She kept quoting huge parties a 20 minute wait time when it was clearly going to be over an hour.  She seemed quite inexperienced.  That aside, I would definitely go back next time I'm in town, but maybe on a night I don't have other plans.

UHEI7YDj033ED3HGUo1_SA.text: Had dinner there last night because they had a sign that theirs was the best chicken parmigiana in Las Vegas. Had their house salad, it reminded me of the one you'd get a deli In a clear to go container. Commercial tasting dressing and Romain dressing. We both got the chicken parmigiana, huge portion, bland with hardly any red sauce, the same for the pasta. I am from NY and was hugely disappointed. If you want italian food, good somewhere else.

kUAovjp2YOcvG_4OxRQ7hQ.text: It was ok overall. It's pretty and crisp and has good energy BUTTT they do NO SUBSTITUTES... Meaning you cannot even add chicken to your Cesar salad!!!! You can not substitute your favorite pasta. They cook al Dante but I prefer mine a little over cooked and softer, the ends on some strands were out right hard. But my carbonara sauce was delicious. But I was just especially disappointed that we couldn't add chicken to a salad!!!!!

7BOaF_6wj726hhmqfwoRug.text: This is not authentic Italian. But it's authentic NYC Italian. There's a difference. You don't want to go here for an authentic Tuscan dish, but if you want some spaghetti and meatballs, or what I had - the rigatoni with short ribs in "Sunday gravy," was amazing. There's a barrier between comfort food and high-end cuisine in Vegas. But sometimes you don't want a $100 steak...some home-style pasta and sauce hits the spot. And at $28 for my entree, it actually was a very affordable place with n upscale feel. My meal at Martorano's was exceptional. Filling and delicious.  My only complaint is that the drinks are ridiculously priced. I paid $28 for my entree and $26 for 2 Jim Beam drinks (their house bourbon). Sorry, but Jim Beam is not a $13 per drink bourbon. Especially when drinks are measured exactly in jiggers and the bartender doesn't have the option of making it a bit stronger to please the guest. I'm not so upset about the booze content except that they weren't able to make a drink to my liking because it was 75% mixer.  Next time, I'll do beer. Safer and cheaper. But overall, love this place. Affordable but still pretty upscale. Down to earth with the food, but the drinks are outrageous. I'm basing this review solely on the food - not the drinks. Five stars all the way for food, and this is a restaurant after all, so I'll let the drink prices slide.

UGnyRucooqIf3yWTY2wzeQ.text: After scrolling through yelp reviews, this place sure seems hit or miss, but after getting a raving review from a friend we decided to take the gamble. Let me tell you, it sure paid off. I'm still drooling over my dinner last night.   Let me begin by saying the this restaurant has a modern, club like feel. Blue lights, disco balls, sleek bar....and REALLY loud music (I could have done without the last part. The music was so loud I could not hear own waiter and make it difficult to sustain conversation. On the upside, they were playing my jams so I spent most of the time lip singing in my seat as I waiting for my food).   They provided us with a small complimentary portion of pate on toasted sliced bread. I couldn't hear the waiter, so I can't tell you what is was exactly...whatever it was, it was delicious. Complimentary bread was left on the table with olive oil, cheese and some kind of oil based chili sauce for dipping. I live a gluten free life style and unfortunately they do not offer gluten free bread. (They do however offer gluten free pasta.)  As for my meal, I started with an EXTRA dirty martini which was on point. Props to the bartender. For dinner I ordered the pork chop which was one of the chef specials for the evening. I highly recommend, it was HUGE, perfectly seared and seasoned sitting upon a bed of cooked greens with the most delicious peppers which added the perfect amount of a kick.   I definitely recommend this place, I left stuffed and oh so satisfied.

U6woMJP0vbj85d5CvMYhBQ.text: I was excited to have the opportunity to finally eat here. The atomsphere is dark and modern. I loved it. Our waiter did an excellent job giving us all info necessary on the food and the establishment. He knew the menu very well and explained the items in depth like a pro. I got the meatball and salad for starter. The meatball was huge and made to perfection. It was topped with an incredible red sauce and a nice side scoop of smooth ricotta cheese. It was surrounded by a delicious italian dressing topped salad. For entree i got the carbonara. The serving size was more than enough and it tasted so good with the cream sauce and egg yoke. I have no complaints. None. Next time i'm in Vegas i will be a repeat customer. This place lived up to all expectations.

3AqKKsUO35pq8WmeNXas2A.text: Amazing food and service!!! The spaghetti al pomodoro and chicken Marsala were delicious!

65UcJejmZjJv9F2JkFOwpg.text: I went for dinner at 5pm, sat at the bar and ordered there signature dish, rigatoni with sunday gravy. I thought it was really good, but for $28 I expect a larger portion of pasta. Pasta is not expensive, so they should load all the plates up like many other Italian restaurants do. If so, I would have given a 4 star rating!

L7rEDfQMp_ENpMWUOtTFiw.text: I love the Martorano's in the Rio Hotel! I am a Steve Martorano fan, for sure!  I was excited to try this new location. My mom was in town so I thought it would be perfect!  It was not perfect, but it was really good. And I am sure once they settle into this new location it will become amazing, like we  are used to at the Rio. The food was good, although it took a really, really long time to arrive. The service was good in a awkward, trying to hard kind of way.   My mom did not lover her entree, unfortunately. So we asked for it to be boxed up, because she only ate 2 bites. Both the waiter and manager knew she did not like it, and after the long wait, If I was the manager, I would have probably comped it.   I am looking forward to going back in to have some amazing Italian food. Once the "New Restaurant" jitters are gone, and they have there Martorano's mojo going!

Olo8CcDC9Thvu6AbE9Bfkw.text: Fabulous.  Best Caesar salad and Carbonara I have ever had.  Excellent and attentive wait staff.  Will go again next time in Vegas

0t0JnobparuOkw0hpoy-7g.text: I am very confused as to why this place doesn't have a 5 star rating. We went here for my best friend's wedding reception and fell in love with the amazing Italian food (some of the best I've ever had) and the fun atmosphere! My friend and I were singing along to all the songs. :) They really impressed me too when the chapel she got married in was running about an hour behind schedule and I called the restaurant to push back our reservation ON A FRIDAY NIGHT- they were so accommodating and understanding! The service was so great too. I wrote in the Open Table reservation notes that we were there for a small wedding reception and 2 of the staff came by and told the bride and groom congratulations! We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas. Thank you so much, Martorano's for helping us make October 2nd such a memorable night.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bride and groom. This place was perfect for their reception! Thanks Martorano&#39;s!
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such a beautiful restaurant :)

jcffHQEBowxqb0z1xXxiLA.text: A relatively new restaurant in between Bally's and Paris, which replaced another Italian restaurant. I will say this place is much better than the previous restaurant, but that's about it. The decor is very nice, modern with a classic touch, very inviting. It's a restaurant slash sort of night club with a DJ slash bar. When we were in there happened to be a Jazzercise convention in town and all of a sudden 30 women from outside and inside the restaurant went to the dance floor and danced their shoes off. It was a nice touch to the evening.  5 of us sat at the bar, which ended up be very nice, since we got a corner.  I will say the whole Yo Cuz thing and life size posters of Steve and him on TV over the bar in a loop cooking just doesn't cut it for me. It was almost a turn off. Seeing a tattooed jacked guy in a tight shirt and cooking with no audio over and over got old very fast. I would rather see a logo spinning or a game on TV.  To start with the menus illuminate! Very classy touch. How many times is it too dark and you can't read the menu, this is the first time seeing anything like this. Their main menu opens up and it has a easy on the eyes white glow. In addition they have an iPad for drink specials AND food specials. We weren't told about this until after we ordered appetizers as it wasn't clear that there was more to the iPad menu. For drinks I had an amazingly smooth vodka martini, highly recommend it.  For appetizers we shared the meatball salad, the eggplant stack and the fried calamari martorano. The meatball salad is a great idea, haven't seen that too much however you need to have a good meatball. Not the worst meatball but frankly it was not good. Way too dry and I believe too much pork. They say it was voted one of the best meatballs around, they probably didn't have real Italians try them. Do not get it, you will be disappointed.  The eggplant stack was good, nice crust on the eggplant again nothing special. Now the Calamari Martorano, that's no normal fried calamari, and this time I mean that it a good way. The sweet and spicy pepper tomato sauce with balsamic vinegar was delicious. The calamari were tender and the plate was full of flavor. For an extra spice drizzle the spicy oil they bring it with the bread! One thing I don't understand is they have a second fried calamari dish, why have two? I would rather see a different dish.  For the main dish I ordered off the specials (see the iPad). I had the double cut pork chop in a vinegar pepper sauce. The pork was cooked through and through, but more importantly the meat was very moist and full of flavor. It's tough to cook pork all the way and keep it moist and tender, these guys know how. In addition it was a very large portion, as we noticed on a lot of there dishes.  Have to give credit to the bar back, not only did she clean up and help the bartenders, she served our appetizers family-style and was on top of anything we needed. Made the experience at the bar feel like we had a waitress, nice job.  You get a lot for the money, big portions and big flavor at Martorano's!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special: Pork chop with vinegar peppers and broccoli rabe
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Salad and Eggplant Stack in the background
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari Martorano

fGO8gFgZZYw4B2WRaoLaoQ.text: Five stars is difficult for me to give at eatiing establishments, but Mataranos really delivered some knockout flavor profiles.  The service was top notch, the menu is simple but elegant. Get The Cheese!  Because WOW and you are welcome!

_bVm0aKAwcLLfujLcaMrTw.text: After arriving in our room at Paris about 8 pm, my daughter and I decided to eat in the hotel.  We don't particularly do steakhouses, but wanted a substantial meal to share after a long day of travel.  The lasagna was recommended by an employee; it was not on the menu.  There seems to be an "off the menu" menu which you have to know to ask for.  They were out of the lasagna so we chose shrimp over spaghetti with a lemon butter sauce and the "famous" meatball salad.  The meatball was dense and just ok; the salad was drowning in dressing and basically inedible.  The pasta dish was again just ok.  Mind you, we had no alcohol, one salad, and one entree.  The bill was in the vicinity of $88!  For that kind of money, I expect much, much more. Mediocre, at best.

PsR_toqsC__7o5nBBPHqYw.text: Service was impeccable! Make a reservation and no wait! Food is to die for... Large portions so come hungry!  Wine list awesome and reasonably priced. Thank you for a perfect meal... We will be coming back soon.

N81tXKAJTmRT7fVFNt5enQ.text: Had my brother's wedding reception here.  Staff was incredible!! Very helpful, kind, ready and willing to serve! Kept regular drinks filled and we're always around to get you anything you might need.  And food was amazing!!! We ordered appetizers, salads, meatballs, spaghetti, and the chicken Sicilian!! Everything tasted incredible but the the Chicken Sicilian... forget about it! It was amazing!!! Order it now! So incredibly flavorful and tart! My mouth is watering again thinking about it! Mmmmmmmmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun dance floor!
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball of goodness!

abJbmm-eUNNacZqj86Fe1w.text: The food was excellent and the servers were great. Ray and Francisco were our servers and they were so attentive and prompt with everything. We really enjoyed it and we will be back!

f3o5uDDszooxCPOdK6fIGQ.text: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. Service was wonderful. We were really impressed by the freshness and flavors of all the food. Our pasta carbonara was decadent. Cocktails were great and there was a fun atmosphere in the restaurant. We really enjoyed our visit and look forward to returning.

Ood9tE9t3bqNxvJcoN1GzA.text: One of the best meals ever!  My first time here, but not my first Martorano's experience. Our server, Bryce, is the guy you want at your table. He was super friendly and knew everything. His assistant, Juan, was spot on with all of the service. Get the eggplant stack and the meatball salad. If you have room, get the Philly Cheesesteak. You wont regret it. As for your entree, it doesnt matter because you simply cannot make a bad choice.

5LDUzm9YIRWl3ZdG5rXclQ.text: Modern and upscale. Very straight-forward. Even says so in the menu, "No substitutions..don't break my balls!". Wasn't my choice as I was part of a group that had reservations here. I enjoyed the modern touches such as the music played and the movie that could be watched on the TVs during our meal. The light up menus were neat and I enjoyed the overall atmosphere. Waiter was nice and the "drink man" was very attentive. It's Vegas and by now I had come to expect it but the prices were $$$$. Two people could easily spend $100; more if cocktails are had. As mentioned though, it was expected. However, the food was just okay. It was tasty and a nice mix of authentic flavors but my $40 dinner didn't taste like a $40 dinner but more a $20 dinner. I think my biggest "issues" were employees eating "on breaks" right next to our table and it seemed like the owner had a "This is my restaurant and I don't care what you want or what you think" attitude. And while it is, and he's allowed, I just didn't feel it creates a friendly atmosphere to start. All-in-all, a nice time but unless someone else catches the bill next time I don't think we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P1WvdzPCG7-euKgQxkwLWQ.text: Our girls trip to Vegas included a dinner at Martorano's and it did not disappoint!! From the awesome cocktails to the meatball salad appetizer ....holy YUM!!!! Honestly, the best meatballs we've ever had and that's coming from an Italian family! And that ricotta?! Amazing. Thank you for a great 40th bday dinner celebration!

Ou_lrOm7IzbuRw05NMceMA.text: Ok, I have to admit that I was skeptical of eating here just because of how dead it was during prime dinner hours. However, I am happy to announce that I was wrong & anyone that doesn't try this place at least once is missing out. LOL! I had been craving a good beef carpaccio for a long time and that was the 1st thing I saw on their menu. Their service is awesome(we sat at the bar,) their pours are heavy, & their food is top notch. My husband and I shared the fried mozzarella that was topped with a delicious marinara, and their creamy penne pasta that had peas, mushrooms, and chicken. YUMMMMM!! Their pastas and the rest of their dishes are all homemade. No frozen stuff here! The atmosphere was superb as well. I love the lighting. Perfect quiet spot for a cozy dinner date. We will definitely be back!

0kP8pv8C7B50h1LhN-TbuA.text: Amazing place!! Highly recommend it! The service was wonderful with exquisite food that you wont forget!

EURPAmaIgQ2-8FD4e54BvQ.text: One has a circus of choice for dining in Vegas ... BUT why in the F*** would you not have a True dining experience.  The Chicken Parmesan is heaven wrapped in the most amazing gravy and fresh freakin' mozzarella.  Not to mention, Paul, our server  sat with us for a True  heart warming chat and laugh. My Silican Great Grandmother will disown me from the grave for this ... Love you Great Grandma Orlando ... The greatest Italian dining experience ever!  You must dine here!    Why are you not here now!

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QXYdE6EQiUOhKy1FpQSD7w.text: Italian food was tasty but alittle too spicy on some things ordered. Chicken had sauce alittle too spicy as well as my spinach. If you like spicy this is the place for you. I don't think I will come back here

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KRjeerW_zkDqMkCGhdQydw.text: The food was really good, I had the eggplant lasagna, my husband had the chicken parmesan, it was really good. The environment was awesome,we ate out on the patio, so we could see everyone go by. White tablecloths, very attentive service, well worth it, but it was a tad expensive. We paid 12.00 for a side of noodles.

QBQVjAJ6CJOLFmknJxu4yA.text: If I could give 7 stars I would. The best Carbonara I will ever have in my life. I'm positive it will never be beat. My boss ordered chicken parmigiana with a side of spaghetti. Everything came out at the same time, at perfect temperatures and cooked to an astonishing perfection. I can't remember the name of my mixed drink, it was pear flavored, was a dream. The waitstaff was very attentive and knowledgeable without ever hovering. I highly recommend

PIKQj0UIcogXmKj9UhcqxA.text: Best Italian restaurant in Vegas! From the moment we entered until we left, the service was impeccable.  Bryce and Juan were fantastic. The food was prepared perfectly, the drinks outstanding and dessert was decadent. The atmosphere was intoxicating with smells and tastes of excellence. Don't miss this place, it will become a favorite.

1X_uAxPOufFJyXCUVPZQXA.text: This italian restaurant is located inside Paris hotel and casino. We came here for dinner one Thursday evening. We did not have a reservation but got a table without waiting. We were given a table near the bar and entrance which was busy. We tried the highly rated chicken parmigiana and spaghetti. We were pretty satisfied with the service and food. The place is located across the hotel buffet. The prices are higher compared to similar restaurants.

yBnNy3YFkERLJSMZgifc1A.text: This is my second time to come to Vegas and eat here. I have never had a bad meal here. The food is super yummy!!! And the wait staff is super friendly and knowledgeable! Great place to eat!!

GY25M8WFwi0Vha00pXfPwg.text: No need to look for a better Philly Cheesesteak in Las Vegas because you won't find one. The meatballs are second to none as well. However, i do like Carbone's meatballs a little better, just my opinion lol I love nothing more than Italian American cooking from South Philly it reminds me of growing up in Jersey and my grandmas Sunday gravy every weekend. Shout out to Chef Steve Martorano and his commitment to serving the highest quality ingredients and employing a top notch staff.  YO CUZ!!  Dishes I recommend: Philly Cheesesteak Meatball Salad Sunday Gravy with Macaroni   First Cut Veal Chop

0SG6FJXPWqb1akL_qdCOeA.text: Holy wow. This place's Pasta Carbonara was beyond anything I've ever had. The waiter was really friendly and consistently checked up on us for whatever we needed.

SqCwVz1OXtnzcESOAgWOGg.text: The veal piccata is $34.00 And the spaghetti piscatora is $38.00 Oh my the best veal piccata was the best I ever tasted....! The wine sauce was amazing...! It came with two nice pieces of veals...! And the spaghetti piscatora came with a lot of seafood...! I was surprised...! Brando was our server and the service was too good! Wow! The manger came and checked on you....! At least once was in Vegas trips...! Worth every penny!

YIt9AXtrEz7G26QMtHdSxg.text: The chicken parmigiana was absolutely perfect. Large portion, great taste, excellent. I would recommend getting this.  Good service and setting. They also serve bread with olive oil. It is very good and super heavy, so coupled with the chicken, you will be beyond full. No need for a side of pasta or salad unless you want it or are sharing.  I give this restaurant a five stars, highly recommend for the food I had.

cdOUSypfexhWIwSZ70ZG7w.text: I have been trying to reproduce this meatball for a while. Steve claims to give you the scoop on ingredients and the how to via several youtube videos. But alas there are holes (intentional) in his instruction. I don't blame him and yah, the damn meatball is that good!  The next time your walking the strip and are looking for a light meal and a drink, drop in to Paris, plop your butt on a barstool at Martorano's and order a nice glass of red and the Meatball Salad. Trust me.

A49ahfjDcbLPqeMG9YojZA.text: Great service & excellent food. The fried Mozzarella is out of this world good. My wife ordered and enjoyed the Penne ala Vodka, and I had the Braised Short Rib Bolognese. Both were delicious. We will be dining here again. Chris the Jewish / Mexican was our server and was  so much fun attentive. Cheers.

tZ2png2qVIhP7oQMSZx_zQ.text: Got a recommendation from a friend to come here for their al dente pasta and great calamari appetizer.  Went with my boyfriend and took my younger brother here too.  The service is great, beautiful restaurant.  The menu even lights up with the open it which really helps since it is a low lit place.  When the food comes out, it is served to you, which is nice, but I like to take pictures of it before it is served, so it kinda messed up their flow.  I felt bad, but I needed pictures....to post on yelp of course! :)  The server was nice, but he pushed too hard on a good review.  He saw I was looking at yelp and asked if i was going to do a review.  i said yes, and he asked if he was going to get 5 stars.  To be polite, I said yes.  The push of a good review was a turn off.  The food was just okay....not much flavor and not good textures.

2PD-5I3NiScIYOd8kZNk8Q.text: I ordered spaghetti with salad. The dressing was too sour and the meatball was salty. For our main entree, we ordered seafood spaghetti and a special item which both were super salty that we didn't finish. We drank so much water! The music was too loud that we have to yell across the table to talk so we didn't say much.  2 stars for the ambience of the restaurant. I will not be coming back!

Jfo_4YNFUWT1VfX85hQPQw.text: The ambience and the location of this place is amazing . It has an indoor and outdoor seating arrangement .The staff is very friendly and co-operative .  We ordered chicken fussili and a caesar salad , both were good and very filling .We had to take to-go boxes. An authentic Italian restaurant !! Will come back for sure !

qKvD3TpMk6nzJcKRYfxqCg.text: I really don't like to give a review!!!! But for the price the food should be rocking and it's so not!!! So disoriented! Service was great

tNfKnRgio_0YnWTUA8Q_iw.text: Almost perfect experience. You can't alter any of the dishes (I asked for a sauce other than red on the gnocchi or plain and was told no).  The meatball is a must. Also the dessert with the waffles and ice cream was so wonderful. I'd go back just for that!!

_60Zk3cuFPv2H9AE88idfw.text: An excellent Sicilian American restaurant. It reminds me of Sushi Samba, Italian style.  Great job, Chef Martorano.  Our server Charles, our sommelier Mike were excellent.  Great customer service!

xzRPiTySpnzhRJViPAtBZw.text: Excellent authentic Italian restaurant!  Portions are huge!  Very nice knowledgeable servers. Nice lively atmosphere!

NALKmLVzxT8s4vfc_xnwWQ.text: Food was okay. Bread was nothing spectacular; focaccia would have been much more appropriate. Fried calamari was good. Penne pasta with pancetta was nothing taste worthy. Saffron risotto was just eh. Service from waiter could have been more attentive, especially since there were several unoccupied tables for at least ten minutes.  Hostesses were helpful and friendly.

9CpJYjAYp2Kw0H4DjdVpsA.text: Everything about Martorano's is amazing. No exaggeration. From the hostess seating us to the service provided by our server Brandon and his staff.  We ordered three appetizers to sample and when they arrived at the table, to people came right over and plated the food for us. The knowledge, recommendations, and courtesy extended to us throughout the meal was astounding. Now on to the food:  We first came here about three years ago and we've been talking about it ever since. When we talk to people about Martorano's we say, "It's not only the best Italian food we've ever had, it's the best food we've ever had, period."  When coming back this time, we were afraid that we "talked it up too much" but Steve Martorano's place lived up to and exceeded our expectations! Bravo!  We are particularly impressed with the attention to detail paid to seemingly ordinary dishes. We had three appetizers: a Caesar Salad, a meatball, and some fried mozzarella. Each of the three dishes made us chew our food more slowly to savor every bite. For our meals, we had the Chicken Parmigiana and the Fusilli Pollo. Both were amazing as well. We weren't going to have dessert, but Brandon sold us on the Cannoli. Now, I come from an Italian family from Boston, so we know our Cannolis. We've had Wholly Cannoli from Worcester and Mike's Pastries Cannolis from Boston and this Cannoli blew them both out of the water. Even the coffee was the best I've had in Vegas.   10 out of 10. A must. Totally worth the price. Spread the word!

GBAPQSPTE9JLMZo8Nl_kqw.text: I don't know why this restaurant doesn't have 5 stars. Our experience was incredible. The food was to die for, their homemade mozzarella was out of this world. Very authentic food, and we know because we are Italian! Highly recommend!  So we ate again here two days later and AGAIN, the food was phenomenal. Chris our server was outstanding and Jeff the manager was great as well. After talking to them and picking their brain about who Steve Martorano was, we now love it even more. Our kind of restaurant and our kind of guy!   Don't hesitate to eat here. Incredible place.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Will come here again and definitely trying the one he has in Ft. Lauderdale when we go visit family!

o4YQS2mfnhD3K7bnIWzOZg.text: This restaurant is a great place for dinner and has a wide variety of amazing dishes including specials each day. The service is exceptional and very informative. They know their menu well and make excellent suggestions.

MW2kZxZMUwcXWBRFN2mLFg.text: My wife and I are here last night and it was absolutely amazing!  The food there is made to order and tastes just like grandma used to make, I couldn't hardly contain myself from ordering more food just to try it. This place has an amazing menu and great quality food, not to mention a very home feel to it, even though its upscsle.  The wait staff is professional, curious, knowledgeable and also very concerned with making you feel like your home. ( as for Paul, our entire menu from drinks to entree were of his choosing and we couldn't have been more satisfied)  To start: the bread and dipping sauces are just amazing. We ordered a homemade mozzarella and tomatoes antipasto, this was to die for! 4 layers of handmade cheese with thick, fresh and ripened tomatoes between them, fresh basil and a 20 year aged balsamic vinaigrette.  I cannot say enough about it.  We also ordered the chicken parmesan that was on special with a side of pasta and their famous meatball....OMG it was amazing! The chicken was perfect, topped with fresh ricotta and mozzarella, not to mention the fresh tomatoe to round it all out. The pasta, always served (al dente) has changed my view on how pasta should taste and that meatball... was worth every stretched out millimeter in my stomach.  All in all, this place was worth the money and time spent, we will be visiting here again on our next Vegas trip.

nkqCvtwzdW7IlejDo_6GAA.text: This restaurant is amazing!  The Mozzarella and Tomato's are delicious!  They make their mozzarella cheese fresh daily!  The waiter Raymond M.  Was great and was very knowledgeable about the menu, and the high tech menus were fun new idea in the restaurant world!  Thank you for the wonderful experience and I'm looking forward to my next trip to eat there again!  Is there any way we can give a bonus star?

zG39VFaHTseYEdpNutiGGQ.text: I love Italian food and really wanted to enjoy this place but I didn't like it. The bread they brought was dry and tasteless. It came with olive oil or cheese or spicy olive oil and none of that helped it. Just gross. For my main meal I got the veal piccata and risotto. There was two big pieces of veal and plentiful sauce but just not much flavor. And by the time I was halfway through the sauce was cold and it was congealed into a jelly like sticky glue. Risotto had zero flavor. It was supposed to have fresh veggies and cheese but veggies looked and tasted canned and it was just blah.  I did have chocolate cake for dessert and it was very moist and good. I saved more than half for next day but unfortunately got very sick to my stomach about 30 minutes after this meal so I ended up throwing it away because I don't know what I ate here that did not agree with me.  Service was fine.
