Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

imMQY-BXI_dFEn-a564eyQ.text: Reservation is recommended!  Our server, Brandon, was very good. He made sure our food and drinks were served on time.   The busser/assistant was also great! Very on top of his game making sure we had our waters and our plates were out of the way.   Food was of good quality. The pasta was perfectly definitely al dente.   They're very accommodating about birthdays, so don't be afraid to ask ;)

1eqtg3MrWsRjQmuhi7-55w.text: Food was excellent. Had the Spaghetti Pescatore.  Music was horrible.  LOUD disco music in an Italian restaurant?!? Strobe lights?!?  Will not go back unless the music changes or better yet goes away completely.

DhGYw8bTmH8diRSjxrVjXw.text: I was able to go here with my uncle because he had a free meal voucher here through Paris.  I enjoyed my experience over all but I feel like the prices do not match the ambiance. The ambiance looks like a lower class Italian restaurant whereas the prices match something more elegant. I feel like they couldn't decide which direction they wanted to go in.   I ordered the three course meal paired with wine. For the first course the wine was paired with the food but for the next two courses our food came before the wine. I feel that the wine should have been brought out first so I could enjoy it throughout the whole meal instead of having to wait for it.   I also wanted to order a coke but our waiter was never in sight. I probably saw every other server but him. He was nice but I just felt he was absent when we needed him. (Side note: I never ended up ordering the coke.)  The food was good though. I started with the meatball which was tender and paired with red sauce and peppers. For the second course I ordered bucatini with red sauce. That was also good and I was lucky enough to have leftovers to take to work the next day. For dessert I ordered their cannoli. I loved it and paired with the sweet dessert wine it tasted really good.   Good food, just ok service and ambiance.   I enjoyed it here but just sub par.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First wine pairing.
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread!

Fw0aZMvYi2ir3UGdR8lVvA.text: The American/Italian "Philly" style food is delicious across the board. Meatballs, Pastas and Parm style dishes flood the menu and are all very tasty. The restaurant is a relocation or spin off of Cafe Martorano's which was at the Rio for many years. I think this is an excellent restaurant with one severe drawback. At night (weekends?) they turn up the music obnoxiously loud as if it's a night club. It's not a night club, it's a restaurant that becomes impossible to have a conversation in. I have never seen the restaurant packed when they do this, as it clearly drives away more traffic than it attracts.

-pf8yvfNQMd-EK8iwTwr3g.text: What a treat to dine here during our stay in LV.  The food was delicious. Seriously, the best sauce I have ever tasted. It was hot and flavorful (penne vodka). We had the meatball with salad and homemade mozzarella for appetizers.  Amazing homemade cheese! We also loved the lighted menus and the bar area. The disco balls were a nice touch too. Our serving staff was excellent too - Brandon and Humberto!

s0FOl71kMzQlrylFTRQQNw.text: A friend of mine had came here a while back and he would always mention it to me. He raved and raved about it so for his birthday we made the trip out here. I continued to tell him that it probably wasn't going to taste as good as he remembered it but that we'd go anyways.   The food is freshly made to order. The hand stretched mozzarella cheese was delicious until they brought our calamari dish out. I ordered a white sauce clam dish and well I guess I'm not a clam sauce type of girl. I couldn't swallow it down. It was too "fishy-scented" for me or whatever that even means to me. I did nibble off someone else pollo chicken pasta dish but honestly with appetizers that good it was hard to compare. The service was great and the bill was great too aka expensive. I wouldn't return because the birthday boy raved about a pork pasta dish that I can't eat. Never say never though maybe appetizer pit stop? Only time will tell. Yeah my review was plain and simple I guess it was just like my dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the up lighting

iQxshroHUsKDGTuyQxPRwA.text: First time visitor to Martorano's in the Paris Hotel in the fabulous Las Vegas.  Amazing staff -- our waiter was Charles and Eddie and our wine dude was Mike.  All extremely friendly and knowledgable.  Our food was fantastic -- although we over ordered.  We started with a meatball appetizer -- two huge meatballs with yummy red sauce and two lumps of delicious ricotta.  There were four of us at dinner and we scarfed that down because it was so good.  We ordered two caesar salads to split -- they brought us out a huge family style caesar salad that was enough for 8 people!  We each ordered a pasta entree and I truly think after the app and the salad we could have split one!  No where to bring leftovers to so we were sad to leave so much behind!  The bolognese was amazing...the carbonara fresh and tasty...the penne ala vodka was the only disappointing thing we ordered...very dry and kinda just tasted like red sauce on some yummy pasta.  We were celebrating a birthday and they came to our table and sang and brought the most delicious vanilla ice cream or gelato.  The place turns into a "disco" or dance place after hours -- kinda odd for an Italian place -- but the music they were playing throughout the evening (all fun 80's type of dance music) was super fun as well.  Enjoy!  Tell our friends hello.

EbWYcFs8akbSSSl5A8nXNA.text: Attended a Birthday party at this restaurant.  One of the best experiences we had in Vegas on this trip.  Home style Italian food, like your mother or grandmother made.  Service was exceptional as was the Sommelier.  Only negative is the location in the Paris Hotel.  Definitely worth the trek through the lobby/casino area.

Fhf_eTIPHGp2tYY98BoMCQ.text: 4 of us just dropped $500 (five hundred dollars) for dinner and a bottle of wine. We're going to a show @7:00, so we decided we would return and have dessert after the show.  When we returned we were refused a table for dessert and drinks. Plenty of tables available. It was 9:30 pm, restaurant doesn't close till 11:00 pm. They wanted to put us at the bar with music blasting behind us. Are you kidding me? We just spent $500 there 2 hours before.   We travel often and know tons of people that travel also.  We will NOT be recommending this place because of this treatment.    I would think twice about putting my name on a restaurant that treats you're guests this way.

LwjBhZO0gH6CtORjFmDg2A.text: Our server Bryce and Edgar did amazing job tonight as a host. We were not planning to visit here for our dinner but we were extremely pleasantly surprised. I would really recommend here for dinner their lobster with lemon sauce was great.

Jc0VX50ZsGHalNdU6kN2yw.text: Had a very good meal here about a month ago when I was in town on business for a restaurant conference  (Eggplant Parmigiana and a house salad).  Thought I would give it another try this week when I was back for another restaurant related convention. this time, the meal was terrible and the service was indifferent.   The bartender raved about how great the Philly Cheese Steak was and basically told me to order it. when it arrived it was so salty it was not edible. don't misunderstand, I love Philly Steaks and I like salty food as well, but this was disgusting. After he saw I couldn't eat it, he asked if I wanted something else. I ordered a salad and decided to call it a day and chalk it up to a bad meal. However when I received the check, I was amazed to find that the overpriced $18 sandwich  (of which I ate less than half) was on the bill along with the salad.  Bottom line I will never go back. Bad food and Bad service is a lethal injection in our business.

GdegaE3ndxKmfDkCbJqyeA.text: Just amazing Italian food I had in the long time.  Perfect temperature with fresh everything.   I would recommended 100%.

r_3K6WTI3cMe2F2Kq5ab6w.text: Everything we had was wonderful. From the cocktails, to the salad and main course.  I would highly recommend to anyone in Vegas.

TdTWVkp5qPoEoX8pj07GGg.text: This was our first visit to Las Vegas restaurant. We've eaten at Steve's in Ft Lauderdale. Experience was amazing and waitress Jessica was amazing. Would recommend for foodies

VaMGgdFrqGUg9i1G-2YnXA.text: A little pricy but worth it. The pasta with red sauce was amazing. The chicken Parmesan was amazing. The veal was amazing. The fried mozzarella with the meatball was so oh good. Our waiter was Chris and he was very accommodating and super friendly.  Our experience was awesome!

2HEZTmlta14oj-0KneCECw.text: Holyyyyyy Shitballs. This place sucks. (Note: I start every review at 3 stars. You get three stars for existing. Good service? +1 star. Bad food? -1 star. Etc.)  Alright so: The food? Actually not that bad. Pretty decent meatballs, sauce that apparently is called "gravy." (Dear Steve Martorano: it's called sauce. Gravy is what you put on turkey on Thanksgiving. It's made from the juices and drippings of the bird. Look it up, cuz.)  So yeah, food was alright. That's as far as this review goes for positive feedback. Go to Martorano's if you enjoy the following:  - LED backlit menus - an iPad drink menu that gets taken away as soon as you order your first drink (want to peruse the drink menu? Good luck tracking down your waiter to get it.)  - Disco lights that rotate over your table constantly, changing the color of your food from pink to yellow to green to bright white.  - the same 10 loud songs that totally don't fit the meal playing over and over again because apparently whoever is in charge of the music found a mix CD from 1997 in the trash outside of Bally's (Hope you like Doo Doo Brown and Jock Jams vol. 3 while you eat!).  - American Hustle playing on the TV's all around the place. Now listen, I'm into film, I'm a grown ass man, but I don't really appreciate watching permed-up Bradley Cooper mount Amy Adams while I dip my bread in olive oil, ya dig? But apparently they have also been known to play The Godfather pt. 2, which totally fits in with the music. NOT.  This place is what I'd expect from a guy with "Yo Cuz" tattooed on his arm. It's like a 14 year old kid tried DJing for 3 years, had no talent, stole his grandmother's sauce recipe (not gravy. SAUCE.), and opened a bunch of restaurants with shallow decor, a limited menu, and ZERO imagination. This is a perfect example of good food with piss poor execution. Slow it down, Steve, ditch all of the flashy crap, and dedicate the place to serving good food. Because the food isn't worth shit when the dining experience is akin to root canal.   I'm looking forward to heading back next year, when this place is out of business and is replaced by a decent Italian restaurant, just like the one it replaced.  Final Verdict: +1 Decent Food -1 Music -1 Lights, TV's, General Atmosphere -1 Service (Wait staff is alright. But ordering from an ipad that you share with other tables? Not so much. Oh and be sure to fill out the survey on the ipod touch when you get the bill! It's SO hip!)  I won't say avoid at all costs - but get the food to go. Do not eat in the dining room.

tzBcA1m_OfJEyZHkaN5R3A.text: Italian food is top notch. Have the meatball salad and the Chicken Sicilian, that's all you need.

photos.caption: Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Martorano's - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JlzDrGO-UhdsDUDDZm3P7g.text: My family and I had dinner here tonight in the paris hotel. Food was nothing special. Pasta had hardly any sauce on it and my sons riggi pasta dish was real hard and under cooked.  The atmosphere is a nightmare . Music blasting it have us a horrible headache could not wait to get out of there.  Why would anyone want to enjoy a nice meal with blasting music. We could not even talk to each other it was that horrible !

DALy7X6QErPQfaWNaWipPw.text: A few things  Tile on the floor is the exact same as the bathroom in my house that was built in 1905. True story,  exact same. This part is not a knock, just truth.   Appetizer bread frozen in the middle,  what the heck  Pasta subsitution is apparently a chore, and was looked down upon.   Angelhair pasta not offered here.  Al dente only, dont ask for anything else.  No parmesan offered with pasta  Beer selection limited, bummer.  Table service limited,  meh  Basically, i expect this level of selection and service from fast food, not a restaurant.  Very disappointing.  Asked for refund on entrees, received.   Very disappointing

Ujfp6gwf1JZ3fviYJFr3Bw.text: Meatball salad appetizer is incredible. Anything with the Sunday gravy (marinara) is worth getting. Veal picatta had a great sauce with a perfect texture. Chicken Parmesan was the best I've had. Wait staff are helpful and prompt. Worth trying.

msXlkmjs_w7dGQFmFZveVA.text: I am in the Paris Hotel every weekend, so I thought I would take family there to try it.   Very underwhelmed and can't really see what the hype is all about.   Service slow (Sunday night in December) we ordered the Calamari as an appetizer (which was OK) and literally a minute after another waiter showed up with our Entrees! The look on his face when I asked him to come back later was priceless!   We both had the Veal as Entrees, when It came back the second time, I was very unimpressed. It was just a piece of Breaded Veal with a thick sauce and sliced Parmesan cheese.  No Veg, no sides, nothing.   The sauce had huge pieces of a very spicy pepper, I love hot and spicy food, but this didn't go with the dish at all.   It's an expensive place, my wife works for Caesars ent, so we got a discount. To be honest.... There's far better Italian restaurants in Las Vegas for the same prices.

IqaHHgvxwZplcdMrrXiQ9A.text: Just Amazing...There is nothing else to say!  Our server Paul was very knowledgeable and offered several suggestions on what to try.  Food was just like Mom makes...Home cooking and fantastic flavor.  You MUST come and try the rice balls and meat balls!!  WOW!

_WhE3hgey4hLvLLXrwIryg.text: Best Italian restaurant on the strip!!  Beautifully displayed and gourmet cuisine!!  Love their fresh mozzarella and risotto. Scallop and crab dish so delicious!!  Great atmosphere with old movies showing on screens throughout The restaurant.

f6NDLJlf0DZgPOefufMuwg.text: Over hyped, over priced, lousy service and UNDERCOOKED chicken Parmesan - we stopped in here after a show and were very disappointed   The topper was RAW chicken served - saw the previous post on the veal and agree - average cut over breaded and just a glob of sauce plopped on top  Diner Beware !!!

1s-chz7Ac7ABBgN2MyH0QA.text: This restaurant was a complete disappointment. Disappointed because it wasn't very good. Disappointed because so many people told me that they HEARD it was good. AND most of all. Disappointed because we did not go to Carmines in Caesars Palace.    This is Vegas. This restaurant should be good for a few basic reasons.   1. It's Vegas and it's a restaurant in a hotel on the strip.  2. It's in the Paris hotel. This is a nice hotel (for the most part) and to have an Italian restaurant of this nature in this hotel is a shame.   3.  This restaurant is not to far from Gordon Ramsey's steak house. Have you been there?  It's amazing. If I were Gordon Ramsey I would not want to be in the same building as this so called Italian restaurant.     OK. Enough rant. Now the facts. Here's my review.   This restaurant su*ked!!  Plain and simple. I ordered a Cesar salad. If I order a Cesar salad at the Olive Garden I know what I am going to get. I am going to get a mediocre salad with bottled Cesar dressing. Oh.......and not only will I not get anchovies in my Cesar salad, I think most olive gardens do not have anchovies anywhere in the restaurant. But this is not the Olive Garden. This is a fancy Italian restaurant in Vegas on the Strip in the Paris hotel surly they will do a Cesar salad right?  Won't they? .............well......the answer is no. And not only do they do it wrong. They do not even realize it. The Cesar salad at this Italian restaurant doesn't come with anchovies. That is the standard Cesar salad. (I should have left at that point). But.....unlike the Olive Garden you can request them. ....  yea........When my Cesar salad came out, it came with a side of anchovies. ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME. That is not how you do it. You do not add the anchovies that way. Even I know that. What a joke.   OK. One more food item. I know I have rambled on.   I love nochie. It is my very favorite Italian food. Being Italian my self....(well, mostly anyway) I fell in love with this dish when I was a kid and my friends mom in Upper Darby, Pennsylvania would make it from scratch when I would go to his house on the weekends. WOW!!! It was amazing. This was not the same experience. This nochie tasted like chef Boy-Ar-De  make it last March and was kind enough to put it in a can for the Cuz that runs this restaurant. It was hard. It wasn't dumpling like and tasted blan. Yuk!!   A lot of words in this review I know. But in Vegas at a hotel like the Paris the food should be better. I have had a better Italian meal at the Olive Garden.   Stay  away!!!!

uXvk3ew1fCn5dJHwyvjTpw.text: I will start off with the food was incredible! The service was mediocre at best...the server seemed preoccupied and self serving. One the menu, everything seemed in line with the pricing you would expect with added sides. But  everything is ala-cart ($10 for side of spinach and $12 for side of spaghetti) and served in plates that are their own separate full plates so you are reaching three plates over to get your vegetable or pasta.  For the price and service the food greatness does not make up for the other ineptness!  I would not recommend  this restaurant with so many others in the vicinity...if I could have, 2.5 stars and a pass! Never again.

h04wIquTacQ_zTtv7Fl7Fw.text: Simply stated, everyone should be aware that this establishment refuses to accommodate any food allergies or food related diseases.   While I have a number of food allergies, I am definitely not one of those individuals who asks for outrageous customizations to the menu in order to be accommodated and I have never had to walk out of a restaurant due to a refusal to be served - not even in France, where I had to ask (in English!) to have my meal prepared without butter. So, imagine my surprise when I sat down with my extended family, for a birthday dinner for my aunt, and the waiter flat out refused to serve me one of the salads on the menu without dressing and a side of olive oil and vinegar. I did not ask for a dish to be prepared differently, only to not have salad dressing. I explained to the waiter it was a severe allergy and that I would only be ordering wine and the salad and he was so rude and obnoxious in his refusal that he reduced me to tears in front of 8 family members.   Needless to say, my fiance and I left the restaurant and my aunt's celebration and will never return to this establishment. From what I understand from those that stayed, the salads were all prepared with far too much dressing, their version of "al dente" pasta is literally a workout to chew and is really nothing more than under-cooked and the service and attitude of the staff never improved. With so many options available in Las Vegas and even just within the Paris, I would be surprised to see this place still in business when I next return.

m1DuRnrQqQYg52yVzPDnBg.text: Food was excellent. The service was the best I've ever had or seen. They really combine excellent together. Had Chris as our waiter. The food was outstanding

J4f5magaCYEGBpdevwmZ1w.text: Yo cuz?" more like, "Yo clown!" I don't understand the hype. I couldn't even find information about this chef on Google. The Italian food was subpar. We had the salad and meatball, penne alla vodka, and chicken parm. The meatball was dry and hard. The salad was fresh and crisp, but we didn't enjoy the meatball sauce in the lettuce. The penne alla vodka was a good size serving, but lacked flavor.   Atmosphere - Don't get me wrong I'm a millennial and we're attached to our phones, but the light up menus and ordering cocktails through an iPad was tacky and unproductive. The Disco Balls hanging from the ceiling and the large Virgin Mary statue was confusing and made me uncomfortable. If you're looking for good Italian food on the strip try LAVO or take a hike to Summerlin for Parma by Chef Marc

WubGN_FVb0TorC9cR78RPg.text: Made a reservation for 6:30, tables were empty and they still made us wait. We sat at the bar and everything we asked for, they we're out of. Finally sat down, service was just okay. Food did not have flavor... I ordered the pasta with seafood and the pasta was not fresh. Shrimp were okay. Clams had no taste.. my husband ordered the sea bass and it was just bland... Will not go there again. Food is over priced. Save yourself money and go to the buffet instead.

tnywP6TZ274kF9urOWHUtw.text: If you are VEGETARIAN , do NOT EAT HERE.. They have nothing for you, the chef won't even make alterations.  We were very disappointed, the prices are ridiculous and the food isn't even worth it... The manager tried to get us to come back again and try their fish, I was like no way... The food is really BAD....you can find a million better Italian restaurants.. When a place tells you we cannot make anything vegetarian, its trouble, I have learned my lesson.. The decor and the color scheme of the restaurant  is awesome, too bad the food sucks....  I  was very disappointed. I don't mind paying for good food, but when the food is bad and overpriced its horrible... DO NOT GO HERE...

j_n5LwLNex0VgXgxiXa5Ww.text: Yo Cuz!! Because you have to!! Four days in LV eating in the "well known chef's hubs" and THIS place rocked it!!!

TsBfbBYcFlbDb-lOZhX4lA.text: Service - A little stuck up. Reservations - We went late on Friday night but none was needed. Food - Hit or miss.  Overpriced. 1. Short Rib Bucatini Special - Salty 2. Penne Alla Vodka - Just not memorable. 3. Ricotta Gnocchi - Very dense.  The "gravy" was delicious. 4. Sauteed Greens - The spinach was perfectly cooked.

jNs1mjANy_DkWKseN1mpqg.text: This dude Steve Martorano knows his way around the kitchen.  I first visited his Ft. Lauderdale location a couple of years ago, and I ate there twice in one weekend.  I love Italian food and if you do too, do yourself a favor and check this place out.   This was my first visit to the Paris Las Vegas location, and it did not disappoint.  We started with the Homemade Mozzarella with olive oil and sea salt and it just melts in your mouth.  Then I had the Martorano Salad which was popping with veggies, something I love.  For dinner, I went with the Veal Cutlet Martorano which is topped with San Marzano tomatoes and this dish has an amazing combination of sweet and hot that balances your taste buds perfectly.  The table also split the Bucatini Carbonara, which is full of creamy goodness and the pasta is amazingly fresh.    This guy knows Italian food and he is a big guy so the portions are quite large.  I see a lot of people on this site reviewing this place as too pricey and that could not be further from the truth.  Each dish contains large portions, even the salads, so pack an appetite.  If you're looking for a $10 Chicken Parmesan, go to Olive Garden, this place is not for you.

i83AmcalKkXZOcCU5CbxHQ.text: The only thing that saves this place is the chicken parmigiano. The best I've ever tasted,  but just know it is served by itself, no sides. Spaghetti noodles were thick and very good as well. The meatball was average. Gnocchi - a waste, I've had much better.   First, decor was nice but really doesn't match the Paris Hotel feel.   Our waiter Mark...ugh...the only time he became somewhat "attentive/friendly" was when he realized we started questioning the bill and asked for his name. He was nowhere near friendly right from the start. When I asked if there was a kids menu he said no in a condescending tone, like I was asking a foolish question.  A more professional response would be "I'm so sorry, no we do not." He asked if we wanted wine.  When a few  (but not all) of us said no, he walked away while my father was still deciding what to get. When my mom said it was my birthday he dismissed it right away but then said a brief ("I really dont care" tone) "happy birthday" when she repeated it. Also, it was disheartening to see what I think was the manager (heavier set older caucasian man) check on everyone's table except for ours. The only pleasant person was our busser. The host at the entrance wasn't as friendly too.  For their HIGH prices (27-62 per plate) and "fancier/upscale" dining we expected more. Shame on you for having worse service than the Applebees down the street from my home. We eat at a lot of classy restaurants but this was truly one of the most disappointing places. Please do not even waste your time.

2xtGHm-4llWmSaCOFqxXPA.text: Great food. Meatball was great and succulent. Our server Mike was gregarious as they are. Fully explained the menu, the options and his delivery was personable.  Even his help Jamie was great help, helped serve our food and was attentive,  kudos to both.  Great ambience and good dacor. Only downfall was limited selection on pasta options and hostess weren't the most personable.

SVGes4e02ns0DSZfoPLRwQ.text: Martoranos.  This was the toughest review to write from my last trip, and not sure I'll convey what happened in this review but I'll try.  We visited the new location in the Paris Las Vegas hotel on 10/21/14.  We had walked by it during the day, thought it looked cool...liked the menu...so researched it a bit while sitting at the pool and decided that we had to go, seeing how SO MANY celebs and notable people ranked Chef Martorano's food SO high!  So we were pretty excited to check it all out and enjoy a great meal.  We were seated on time at a table on the 'outside' of the restaurant, so we didn't get that movies on the wall, disco ball in the center kind of experience...but did enjoy the al fresco style dining and people watching in the Paris shops area.  Right next to us was a group of 8 conventioneers, who were a bit loud from time to time and seemed to dominate the service as you will see below.  We were greeted by Georgio (hope I spelled that right) after a good 5-10 minutes of perusing the menu on our own.  He dropped off an iPad with the drink menu, took our "flat or sparkling" water order, and explained the specials for the night, which I took note of a seafood selection that he described as a "seafood party in your mouth"...something about that was both comical and odd...not sure why though.  We quickly found out that the iPad was malfunctioning, if you pressed on anything it would just freeze.  So we were unable to check out any kind of special drink selection (we were thinking martini style special followed by some wine with dinner).  Georgio then became a bit occupied with pouring wine for the conventioneers so we were able to flag down his 'assistant' Jason (I think he was an assistant, or in training or something) who quickly brought us a new iPad.  Georgio then came back and took our order...not asking if we'd like to start with an appetizer, not asking if we'd like a drink, but simply saying "are you ready to order"...which led to her saying "yeah I want the martini, the seafood special..." him looking at me so i had to say "I want a Manhattan up with Makers, we're splitting the eggplant parm and I'll take the Buitoni Meatball"...just not how you serve a couple in a high end establishment.  So then another 10 minutes passed.  The restaurant was about 70% full and the bar was not busy.  We had no drinks and had been sitting there for a total of 25 minutes.  Jason kept looking and then came over to say "didn't you guys order drinks?" to which he promptly went to the bar and resolved..bringing us our drinks moments later.  Our eggplant parm arrived shortly thereafter and I have to say it was AWESOME!!  Probably the best I've had..and was a perfect size to split with a date.  After clearing the plates and then taking a wine order (glasses, not a full bottle) the night seemed to be moving more smoothly....until the entrees.  My entree came out but her food did not.  Jason was kind enough to explain that the food was all cooked fresh to order and sent as soon as it was ready, that they didn't hold anything in the kitchen.  Ok, I'm cool with that.  But who knew a buitoni (think thick linguini) and meatball cooked 5-10 minutes quicker than some seafood (clams, shrimp, etc..seafood party) over linguni?  Throughout this whole process, Jason was super attentive to our needs and seemed to really try and keep things going...while Georgio was busy trying to be cool, pouring drinks for the big convention table, and coming up with cheezy Italian style lines to say to everyone.  The manager actually came over and apologized, and first offered another glass of wine (which we both had a full glass) so we declined..then said "well, just pick out a desert and we'll take care of it for you"...seemed to me a nice gesture and the right thing to do.  Her food finally came out and I do have to say we both LOVED our meals.  I had the best friggin' meatball ever and she had an awesome seafood dish.  The food at this place is worth every penny of the price.  Jason continued to check in on us, making sure things were going smooth...while Georgio continued posturing for everyone.  Ever see a person who thinks he's a special gift to everyone, and has no clue he is actually really cheesy and borderline annoying?  Anyway...  We went on to split a desert (thinking this was on the house)...tiramisu.  Now, I'm not even a fan of tiramisu but holy smokes..it was AWESOME!!  We were then brought the bill...which of course did not have the desert or anything comped...but at that point we didn't really want to make a big deal and just settled up.    Funny that on our way out, we asked to have our photo taken and who stepped up?  Yep, Jason!  We thanked him for taking care of us all night and actually tipped him separate, fearful that the tip on the bill would all go to Georgio.  My hope is that if anyone from the restaurant reads this, GIVE JASON A PROMOTION!  He was outstanding!!  Food: 5  Georgio: 2  Jason: 5  Mgr: 1

bD_sbZQOo5TvNL4XmQUWZA.text: My family ate there on 4/19, we ordered egg plant stack app.  It was good but a bit unrefined, too thick slices of cheese and tomato. For dinner chicken parm, no pasta...  Was deemed good. As well as pasta marinira. My father and i both ordered the clams in white sauce, we couldn't eat more than 3 bites as it was way too salty and spicy from the chilis..  We sent both entrees back and didn't order anything else.    Unfortunately we will not be ordering any pasta dishes from this resturaunt again...

rU-jnxavlId0KcYvpWzD0g.text: I can't remember the last time I had Italian food this good! The meatball salad and the eggplant stack are the best appetizers on the menu and are great for sharing. They  advertise having the best chicken parmigiana in Las Vegas and I think they are right! The lasagna was also great. Mark, our server did an outstanding job and made the night that much better. Unfortunately, we never made it to desert, we were way to full. I will definitely return on my next visit.

ZxekxS9gUhGIcdNh151NLA.text: My wife and I enjoyed the food, very attentive wait staff. No substitutions and Insistent on ordering everything right away, I like to get  appetizers and see how full I am before completing my order but it worked out ok.  Not inexpensive but quite enjoyable.

0UW4Wq7u7nyMIJISVSnIoA.text: The very best in service but the food took very long to prepare on a slow night and it came out with little flavor.  highlight was caesar salad but price and flavor didn't match up.  Better places to go for italian.  oh yeah, bread was good but time to prepare courses meant we ate too much of it.

QRBGqMQXW0HTl4D9x4-I1w.text: This is supposed to be a fine dining restaurant however..... Do not expect to change one single thing on the menu, even if you have food allergies.  Too bad! Sorry for your luck!  Don't even ask for salt!  They will not even put the sauce in the side!!!! Eggplant stack was delicious, so was the mozzarella appetizer.   The pasta bolognese was over priced and was not worthy of a fine dining restaurant.  Yo cuz!  Get with the times,  people make changes to the food based on allergies and so that they can enjoy your food, you need to understand that and give a little on this harsh policy!.

shZ3CS4-ppAdG4vm4asDoA.text: Excellent vibe and cool decor. Their macaroni (aka pasta) is excellent. The veal Marsala here is fork-tender and flavorful. The Sunday Gravy is the owner's grandmother's marinara sauce and it is delicious.

zkNs06LwCR39svRKiej5OQ.text: First visit, I arrived as they were opening @ 4:30pm. Ordered meatball & salad. $20, one Meatball was good but not enough sauce., salad had to much dressing and only had lettuce and tomato. Waiter service was okay. Pricy.

iMJQb7w-zyQvLiZykhNrMQ.text: The food is really good but I think it's expensive for what you get.  I had the meatball and salad and hubby had the meatball with spaghetti (their version of it).  Pasta was cooked to perfection and really good.  The staff is friendly and is located in a good location in the Paris hotel.

uxmyvnTWQ69lQUkL8YuEjA.text: Amazing Italian food. Service exceptional. Try the veal scallopini. Prices a little high but we'll worth it. A must if you are visiting Paris Hotel.

xgwC969GdJIiI0g6nGCTgw.text: Second time here and was amazing just like the first time. I have tried many Italian restaurants in Vegas and this one is by far the best. Prices are extremely reasonable considering how great the food is. If you like Italian, you must try this place. I would give it 6 stars if I could.
